Reviews.Title: I absolutely love my new Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: ammount
Reviews.Content: The new Fire HD is a must for all who love to read. It goes wherever I go. It is compact, lightweight and does all and more of what I want to do. I am always in touch with family, friends, and outside world and events. I could not ask for more in an iPad. I highly recommend it. This is the best budget tablet money can buy. Once you have it, you will be amazed how you managed without it. Get one today!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet...Remember to Read the Specs and Remember What you Pay
Reviews.Author: Badgerx
Reviews.Content: We have 4 kindles in the house now and this one is just as good as the others. For $139 it has everything one could expect from a tablet. Could it have more memory? Sure, buy the 16G. But since you can download and delete things, just keep what you need on it and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7 is not as good as first Gen Fire
Reviews.Author: Timothy M. Payne
Reviews.Content: I replaced my first generation Kindle Fire with the 8GB Kindle Fire HD 7" and I am completely disappointed after two months.  I loved my First Gen Kindle Fire! Here are my problems with the new version:1. The web browser silk is worse than the original.  Selecting book marks is awkwardly different and cumbersome.  Webpages just don't always load.  Google news webpage jitters when scrolling.  Sometimes it will not select a link when you touch the link.  The browser just locks up.2.  The email app is worse.  It no longer has a SPAM button when reading email.  It does not allow you to open an email that is a multi-thread email.  I have to select another email and then go back to the one that I wanted to open.3.  Settings is no longer available from the main screen.  I have to back up to Home, select Apps and then select Settings?  Why did they make it more difficult to do something?  I change my display settings often and find the new version frustrating.4.  Less apps.  Apps that I used for years such as the Directv app or Radio.com app are not available for my new Kindle even though I used them for years on my first gen Kindle Fire.5.  Many functional aspects of th operating system changed and I basically had to relearn how to use the Kindle Fire.  If I had to learn something new, I should have bought a Nexas 7.I would not recommend this if you had a First Gen Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother buying for a child, or if you want to use wirelessly
Reviews.Author: twinmom2007 "twinmom2007"
Reviews.Content: We looked at this many times and finally bought three of these for our kids early for Christmas, mainly for use during cross-country plane travel. We are so incredibly disappointed in this offering from Amazon, if I could give this product zero stars I would.- Freetime is a HUGE pain in the butt to use with different ways to access different types of access restrictions, you can never remember where or how to turn on/off certain features, and figure out which child has access to which items.- If you want kids to have access to the free Amazon Prime videos that you are already watching on TV and other devices, you will NOT be able to access these while in kids mode (FreeTime). You have to pay additional monthly fee either for one child or the family rate, to access those same videos you already get for free on other devices, while in Freetime mode in the kindle HD. Confusing (and greedy)? Yup. I think it's called FreeTime unlimited, and we have not tried it, since we are ready for other reasons to write these devices off as the biggest Christmas gift goof ever. I don't think we saw that anywhere in the descriptions of the device, although we saw references to being able to buy unlimited kid video access for a fee per month, we thought that was optional not required. Only on the kindle itself under the help section did we find that (after purchase). Editing to add: you also can't access kids' kindle library books in FreeTime - which was one of the main things I want them to be able to do! I'm happy to buy some kindle books from Amazon for the kids (and did buy several and loaded those before giving to the kids, but they STILL had problems accessing in wireless mode).- Things just disappear off of the device back into the cloud and suddenly become inaccessible with no wireless access. I bought two digital movies and a bunch of apps, downloaded them to the devices (this took about 15 hours of work for me to get two movies and apps onto three devices), then checked to make sure they were all downloaded by opening them with wireless turned off at home, added them to the three kids' FreeTime profiles (another few hours since there are three kids), got on an airplane with three cranky preschoolers, and... half of the stuff wouldn't open without wireless. I don't know if it starts to get bumped off of the device as you run out of storage or what, but we got various messages saying library can't be opened, or just a "!" with no explanation. After a month we have had to do two things to be able to use these devices in any meaningful way: 1. turn OFF FreeTime (which controls what kids see) and 2. kept the wireless on, which we really hadn't wanted to do. This is a problem since we have these linked our family account which also has adult content (do not meanporn! but the occasional R-rated action/adventure movie, a romance novel, whatever - not appropriate for the kids to be browsing). So if you mean to use these for kids I'd strongly suggest starting a new account for the kids and getting them their own Prime or FreeTime paid access, depending on age and how much you trust them/ will be nearby while they are using the devices.- Most of the free apps for android, just to warn you, also have advertising and/or require in-app purchases to be turned on for them to work (or even to open). Some of them state this in fine print, many others do not. Many of the apps we've gotten for free or paid for (or tried both version), will not open when in wireless mode. So this device is extremely frustrating during travel.- These are very cheaply made. The power cord attachments are already loose after a month of sporadic use, and only my husband and I handle them (carefully) to plug them in or while charging, so it's not kid abuse.This device does NOT WORK for the intended purpose. I wish we had just bought another iPad (we have had three, one of which is still in use in our home) and let the kids duke it out over the one, versus try to give the kids each their own (ridiculously inferior) device. I know you get what you pay for, but was really expecting more from Amazon. We continue to love our other kindles (we have a first generation and husband and I each have a newer paperwhite which we love), but will NOT try another of their android devices.

Reviews.Title: Worst kindle ever!!
Reviews.Author: A. Paul
Reviews.Content: I had an older kindle version which I absolutely loved! Only problem with it was my kids kept stealing it. So when this new version came out I preordered 3 of them. One for each kid so I can reclaim mine. They are crap!! They shut off in the middle of games, refuse to power on sometimes, some kindle apps say not compatible and won't download. Not compatible! Its a kindle and they are kindle apps. Most are the talking apps that of course my kids love. This was a complete waste of $$$. Do Not buy this version!! So many bugs. The kids are back to stealing mine because theirs doesn't work!!!

Reviews.Title: WARNING!!! BATTERY IS AWFUL AND DIES IN LESS THAN YEAR!!!
Reviews.Author: scottr
Reviews.Content: I purchased two kindles for my daughters last year for Christmas. I purchased on November 21, 2012 and  I registered them on December 22, 2012 so it would be up and ready for them on Christmas Day...Everything was fine at first but over the course of a year they noticed the battery was declining. No big deal in my mind just keep it charged when not using.Fast forward I buy another kindle for my son for this coming Christmas. It's here and waiting for Christmas morning. So that's three purchased kindles in one year.I'm a good customer right? They have good policies at Amazon right? Not in this case.Yesterday my daughter tells me her kindle will not start at all. I take a look - it won't take a charge. I try multiple chargers, still no luck. It's completely dead.I call Amazon this morning and its explained to me that its out of warranty so they can't fix or replace it but they would be happy to sell me a new one. ARE YOU KIDDING ME??I purchased it Nov 21st 2012 but didn't actually turn it on until Dec 22nd 2012 and today is Dec 14 2013 - less than a year after it was first turned on!So technically and legally they are correct that it was over the warranty - by three weeks!! But it's actual use since it was a Christmas gift is less than year.Regardless, shouldn't the kindle last more than a year? Two years? More? Why would anybody buy a tablet of any kind that will die in a year?DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I'm so disappointed in their policies and their product. I'm returning my unopened kindle I purchased for my son for a new tablet. Not sure which one yet but I'm going to make sure it's battery life is projected for more than a year of use!

Reviews.Title: The Best "Fire" yet !
Reviews.Author: Juiceman
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle fire.  I own the original, the HD and today I received the newest version.  It's by far the best one yet!  The screen quality, the new shape of the back, the outside volume controls, the new off and on button....i could go on and on why this one is the best! Thanks to Jeff and the other folks at Amazon that come to market with these great products. In reading the reviews just written I can't believe the negativity and mis information.  Do these people not read what Amazon has written about the features and benefits of the product?  If you don't like the ads on the Kindle,then spend a few dollars more and get the ad free version. Did the specs say that it came with a camera? No, so why do you expect one? Seriously folks, read to understand what you are buying.  Don't knock a product if you thought it should do something when the manufacturer clearly says it does not.This is a device designed for reading.  It also allows one to surf the internet view videos as well as a slew other things.  There are trade offs to make it do many things.  Some things it does better than others.  That's the way multi function devices work. Everyone wants something different.....one can only do so much for $150 bucks !

Reviews.Title: MUST READ for those interested in Kindle FreeTime Unlimited
Reviews.Author: Jessicala
Reviews.Content: This review is going to be a little different - but I hope it helps any parents who are considering purchasing a Kindle to utilize the subscription to Kindle FreeTime Unlimited for their children.  First of all, the Kindle Fire HD Device itself is a good tablet.  It's not great.  It's definitely not buttery smooth like and iPad.  I'm disappointed to say this but the Kindle and Amazon's flavor of Android just still seems to be a little unpolished and quirky.  You do need to take into account the phenomenal price point of this tablet though.  With that in mind, it is definitely a decent tablet.  Build quality seems good for the hardware.  The operating system is just okay (sorry Amazon).  The device will serve it's purpose fine for a child's first tablet as long as you have a good case.Now on to the real purpose of this review.  If you are thinking about getting a Kindle for your child for Christmas (or any time) and taking advantage of the FreeTime Unlimited subscription model - DON'T DO IT!!!  I honestly don't know what the people at Amazon were thinking in the way they built the functionality FreeTime Unlimited subscription.  In theory it is brilliant.  You pay a nominal monthly fee to get access to hundreds if not thousands of pre-screened, age appropriate apps, books and videos.  Sounds great, doesn't it?  Well, Amazon's implementation of this subscription feature is a complete and utter wreck in my personal opinion.  When you sign up for FreeTime Unlimited you are literally presented with EVERY SINGLE APP, BOOK AND VIDEO within your child's age range.  So if you go to the Apps page within FreeTime, your child will have to scroll through approximately 500 apps.  None of the apps are downloaded to your device at first - they just present the link / icon that you can click on to download the app to your device.  And once you've downloaded the app the only way to really tell if it is on your device is a little black check mark in the lower left hand corner of the icon.  If you're not connected to Wifi and the app isn't already on your Kindle - too bad.This might not seem like a big deal as you read this, but let me tell you it is a horrible implementation of a great idea.  If your child's favorite app happens to be one of the last on the list... they will have to scroll through all 500 of those icons before they can get to it on the Apps screen.  What if their favorite app is in the middle of the list?  Or is it 28% of the way down the list?  Or 73.6% of the way down the list?  Seriously, horrible implementation here.  Yes, you can "pin" your favorite apps to the Home screen within FreeTime, but forget about removing it from the Home screen.  To do that you have to switch back to the apps, videos or books screen and find it in the list of 100's and "unpin" it from there.Yes it is true that the nifty little carousel feature still displays your most recently used applications, books and videos within the FreeTime area, but that is really not that useful either in my opinion.What I really thought FreeTime Unlimited was going to be was a presentation of 100's or 1,000's of apps, books and videos for my child that I could then selectively choose what they could access and what would be presented in their FreeTime profile.  That is simply not the case.  There are books about monsters that I definitely wouldn't want my child to access.  If the Kindle is connected to Wifi and she clicks on the icon - it will download it to her profile.  To me though, it is ultimately the unorganized approach of just presenting every single item available and taking any form of control of what is displayed out of the hands of the parents that makes this so bad.  I can't imagine this is how any parent would want a subscription like this to work, especially for younger children.  Maybe I'm wrong, but for me FreeTime Unlimited is a great idea gone horribly wrong the way it is currently implemented.And just to be clear, I am not the type of parent that intends to just hand the Kindle to my toddler and let her use it completely unsupervised.  I definitely want the experience to be interactive with mom and dad at all times.  I just want her to have an experience with technology that is not cluttered and overwhelming.  And I also want the control to determine the apps, books and videos that she has access to.  Perhaps I'm asking for too much, but I don't think that's really the case here.  I think it's a sloppy implementation of the FreeTime Unlimited subscription model on Amazon's part.  The FreeTime app on it's own allows you to do exactly that - you can pick and choose which apps, books and videos you have downloaded to your Kindle to present to them within FreeTime.  But once you sign up for FreeTime Unlimited, be prepared to have a cluttered, overwhelming, sloppy mess of 100's - 1000's of apps that you have no control over in the FreeTime app.Kudos to Amazon for being a smart and innovative company.  Shame on you for having such a great idea with FreeTime Unlimited and implementing it so poorly.  Seriously, how hard would it be to figure out a way to allow parents to selectively add only the apps, books and videos they want from the FreeTime Unlimited library?

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: DLimp
Reviews.Content: We have two of the original Fire's and this is a great replacement for our kids.  Screen is much improved and games seem to run a lot faster.

Reviews.Title: Worst customer service of my entire life, don't waste your time with this company...
Reviews.Author: JMM3327
Reviews.Content: I spoke with Amazon a few months ago regarding my Kindle tablet not charging correctly. My father(who had purchased it) had explained that Amazon had great customer service and to call. Upon calling I was pleased to find out that they were willing to offer me an out of warranty credit towards any new Kindle fire. I explained it wasn't good timing for me to do it but after the holidays were over I would. With the holidays ending I called Amazon today to do just that. After being transferred and on the phone for over 15 minutes just to talk to someone about why I called, the customer service rep I did encounter was extremely rude to me after I expressed that I was frustrated and was tempted just to buy something else. Her response was, "that's your choice" and hung up the phone on me. I was nothing but respectful towards her and was appalled at being treated that way. Upset, I called back and spoke with a supervisor who seemed like he could have cared less and just wanted to get me off the phone. He just kept saying I don't want to take up your time so I'll just let you go. After I expressed to him that he didn't really seem to care, there were minutes of silence. He finally responded with I'll give you a credit towards ebooks and such then. I responded with okay. He transferred me back to the kindle department without ever giving me the promised credit(not surprised after the customer service I had received earlier that day). I finally talk to another supervisor in the kindle department named Matt I believe and he was one of the better customer service people I spoke with. After explaining everything for the 6th time(and being over the phone over an hour at this point) he transferred me to another department that deals with out of warranty deals. After speaking with the rep there, he explained the only thing he could offer me with the 7 inch was a 32 gb. I explained that I didn't want 32gb, and I asked to speak to a supervisor yet again. I was placed on hold for about 5 minutes and then hung up on for a second time. I never once was rude, raised my voice or was disrespectful but for some reason was hung up on twice. I'm irate that this is how such a large company handles themselves. I then called back for the 3rd and final time. Again after asking for a manager I was put on hold and then ultimately just disconnected. I will forever bid goodbye to Amazon. As someone who frequently buys from Amazon, I'm astonished they treat their customers in this regard. Please don't waste your time. The tablet itself is okay but the customer service was the worst I have ever had in my entire life. Save yourself the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: Huge Disappointment....
Reviews.Author: meandmypal "meandmypal"
Reviews.Content: I own the original Kindle Fire. I have been fairly happy with it for the past few years. I purchased the Kindle Fire HD as a gift ....This Kindle has been a huge disappointment. The first disaster was a frozen screen that Amazon said could not be repaired. Amazon sent a new Kindle Fire HD. This one was fine for a few weeks and now it won't connect to the wi-fi or go back to the home screen. I regret buying this tablet. I should have purchased the ipad mini.....

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jamieann"
Reviews.Content: I actually purchased this as a gift for my daughter's 6th birthday and she is in love with it! She is just starting out with reading on her own and this gave her some extra encouragement. We haven't had any issues with it so far. The speed seems great to me. We haven't done much web browsing though, so I can't give any feedback on that. She has just been using the Kindle Free Time to access a ton of free educational games, videos, and books and it has been great for that! This is my first Kindle and so far I am very happy with it. It is serving the purpose I bought it for and for $139 I think it is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: Third time's NOT the charm
Reviews.Author: jab
Reviews.Content: My mother bought my son a kindle for Christmas 2011. He was really excited to have his first tablet and played with it for about 3 months. Then the battery wouldn't charge. We tried everything from sitting the kindle a certain way to force on the orange light, to purchasing another charger. Nothing worked, so I requested to have another kindle sent out.We got the new kindle and all was well in the world until, about 3 months later, the battery would not charge... Again! I mean, I really don't see why the battery is so difficult to charge, but again, we requested another replacement and it was sent out.Before I could return the second kindle, my son says "mommy, I can't turn my kindle on." The power button is retracted inside of the kindle. Seriously?!?! I explained to the rep that assisted us with the third replacement that my son has yet to get full use out of ONE kindle. He plays with it for a couple of months and then something happens. When I google the issue, I find out that these are all common problems! I'm just wondering why I keep getting these kindles with battery problems or this latest one with the power button being stuck inside of the darn tablet!!!This is so frustrating. Do NOT buy a kindle. Save yourself the time, money, and irritation!

Reviews.Title: Some Improvement Needed
Reviews.Author: Ruby J. Scott
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I like most things about it. It responds quickly and the screen has a very good picture. However, videos and movies that don't come from Amazon won't play; they constantly buffer. Movies from Amazon are played through Amazon's video player and seem to play without any problem! Also, some apps sold on Amazon and that worked on previous Kindle Fires do NOT work with this new model. I do like to read books that have color pictures in them on this device, but I prefer my Kindle reader for reading novels and it's battery lasts longer.10/11/2013 I have sent two emails to Amazon with no response. Now when I try to play you tube music videos,it will play some and then while loading a video the browser totally locks up.10/15/2013 Returned Kindle Fire for a refund ($139). Tried Asus MeMO Pad HD 7 inch (ME-173X) for $150 and it would not play the picture on Netflix videos - only the sound.  Bought Asus MeMO Pad 7 inch (ME-172V) for $100 and so far (older version than ME-173X) everything works as advertised. Picture not as pretty as the Kindle Fire, but it actually works with no buffering! Works very well for reading Kindle books and listening to music purchased from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Tessa Hanson
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 7 year old, and the play time mode is really usefull.  I should have bought one for myself!  A+

Reviews.Title: I expected better
Reviews.Author: Mary M.
Reviews.Content: I just participated in a survey regarding my purchase of a Kindle Fire HD (7"; 8 GB).  I was hoping to give direct feedback on the tablet I purchased in August of 2013, but was unable to do so on the survey. This is our third Kindle and second Kindle Fire HD.  I purchased a Kindle Fire HD for my husband last winter, and both of us really enjoyed using it, so I ordered one for myself to replace my original Kindle.Unfortunately, my Kindle Fire HD does not operate at all like my husband's.  I am constantly losing my place in a book when I change pages--the screen jumps forward to somewhere towards the end of the book. The screen on my Kindle is so "touchy" that I have given up trying to read the daily newspaper on it.  It frequently defaults to the homepage and/or shifts back to previously read articles.  Instead, I have to borrow my husbands KIndle Fire HD to read the newspaper.I contacted customer service early on and complained about its sensitivity.  I was given directions on how to "reset" the kindle.  Even though I tried this, my Kindle Fire HD has never performed the way my husband's does.  I am really quite disappointed in it's performance.  I use it for reading books, but recently it skipped ahead on me so often, that I switched to my cell phone to get through a chapter.  Also, my Kindle Fire HD does not always sync to my other devices.I probably should have contacted customer service again, but I just decided to "live" with the quirks in this particular tablet.  However, they have become so irritating that when I decide to purchase another tablet, I will certainly think twice before ordering a Kindle.

Reviews.Title: very happy with this
Reviews.Author: pleased customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my four year old son and to be honest i would love to have it myself it is an awesome tablet and works great amazon hats off with this one.P.S my son wont put it down.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am a full time student, and a single parent. I am always employing creative methods to get the most for the meager amount of money I have. I am not a techie by any means, but I do my homework before making any electronics purchase over $50. I was going to buy a refurbished kindle for $99 but I saw for $40 more dollars that this one had some slightly better specs than the previous HD.This thing has a beautiful screen! The sound quality is very nice too. My son is madly in love with Free Time already. This is my first tablet and I know it is entry level but I think it will suit our needs just fine. Also if you are a student getting Amazon Prime for $39 a year just makes it a sweeter deal.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the $$$$
Reviews.Author: Bevhills
Reviews.Content: All my kids have kindles and we just bought this one for our 5 yr old , it's faster ,and all around better than the last model and the price is right !!! Prime membership now has free  tv/ movie downloads which is great so you can get things to watch for when your not connected to wifi !!

Reviews.Title: no video
Reviews.Author: Judith Tyler
Reviews.Content: I love Amazon. Just bought the HD as my 3Rd kindle. Bought a new season of a TV  show to celebrate. Can't live stream any vids (error 57) and can't download (try again or cancel download). On the phone 90 min and they couldn't figure it  out. (this was Saturday evening as I got new kindle Saturday afternoon). Didn't hear anything Sunday and just called (9:30am Monday) and they are still working on it. A bit frustrating not being able to play with my new toy! The reps and IT reps have been great. Friendly, understanding and kind but ultimately not much help getting the issue resolved. I can't wait to update this to say it's been resolved! Amazon has always been right on the ball. Never had an issue before that want resolved in 15 minutes or  so. Guess they've spoiled me over the years!! I will continue to be an Amazon customer and don't write  this review to slam the company. Just wanted others to know about the video issue if they're thinking of buying an HD.Update: 10pm Monday still no video. Am planning on returning my HD and asking for a refund for the season of Perception I bought and can't see tomorrow afternoon if it's not working. More sad than mad. Why aren't they helping me?Tuesday 7:35pm: finally someone told me what error code 57 means. Either Microsoft wrong on my kindle our Microsoft wrong on their end. Just read another review which stated if you buy the 8GB kindle, no way to download and watch videos?? Confused because even when I  was online still coituldn't "stream" vids that I bought. Customer service rep has agreed to call me at 11 tomorrow morning when I can be online and trouble shoot. Although, if 8GB isn't enough to buy/download vids, feel like Amazon should have made that clear. Hoping for the best!! Will continue review until resolved (unless they don't let me). Curious as to whether the 8GB had something to do with it or not. If true, REALLY!!!  Wished Amazon let me know that beforehand...IUpdate: Amazon did not call me@11 am. Called customer service around 12:15 to request a new kindle. They attempted to send me through the same crap that I've already gone through. (ie... Restart kindle, send me over to the IT team. I am all done. My frustration level is high and I can't recommend this product. Am kinda posed that they didn't send replacement next day shipping, but at this point, am used to Amazon treating me like a second class citizen...  I really hope that this transaction is not the norm.  Amazon, please make this right!! I love Amazon and can't believe I've been treated so shabbily. Look over everything and HELP!!

Reviews.Title: Please read the specs before you purchase AND stop bashing!
Reviews.Author: N. Humes "Modern Marvel"
Reviews.Content: READ the Specs! The Kindle HD doesn't have a camera and one persons experience isn't representative of everyones experiences with this device.  The people that have all these issues, did you do any research before purchasing? People write negative comments (and discourage others) because they didn't do their due diligence and blindly purchased. IT never claimed to have a camera and being the best on the market. You purchased a tablet for little to nothing (in the grand scheme of things.) Did you price other tablets including the iPads??! If a camera, skye, HMDI port, another user-friendly interface (which is subjective), more apps (which are too many as it is) are important to you than this isn't the right choice! Seriously, how many people will even use 20 out of thousands currently available?) If these are your requirements, you should have considered buying an iPad or other device and dish out between $300 - $500 dollars. Please people,...before you criticize, post misrepresentations, and bash the product that you bought, be an informed consumer and post facts which allow people to make an educated assessment. Amazon was VERY upfront in the specs and capabilities of this product. Yes, there will be lemons and defects as these products are man-made and not the millions of people that purchase will have the same experiences for various reasons. Overall, I think the product delivers for what was advertised and what the market that they target want to do with this device.

Reviews.Title: best reader/tablet ever!!
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: i love my kindle..its easy for me and my little guy (6yr) to use. If you have prime your abke to borrow books (saves money) . you can also read book in more formats than the nook. plus kindle book are cheaper!my son loves playing games on the kindle. i was able to set him up this his own screen so i dont have to worry about him playing games that he shouldnt. plus he has access to alot of free games and shows with kindle FreeTime

Reviews.Title: Huh?!?!
Reviews.Author: Cindy
Reviews.Content: What's the point of this new version in today's market? No camera, no microphone, heavier than G1. I gave my G1 away expecting a new and improved. Instead I got G0001 model. Really? Then I paid the extra dineros not to have ads streaming but still get "suggestions" of products. Suggestions = advertising --- incase the folks at Amazon did not know that. Disappointed, just disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7'
Reviews.Author: Katscolor
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get my new Kindle Fire.I have wanted one for the longest time,but I am thoroughly disappointed in my Kindle and more so in the Customer service that Amazon has offered,or should I say lack of. I started having issues with my screen freezing the day I opened it.The Customer service person I talked to ,said, oh this happens and here is what you do. Well, 7 weeks later,it is still freezing on a daily basis .Sometimes refuses to wake up. I have asked for a new one. I did this 4 weeks ago, and I was told it was NOT covered under my "limited" warranty anymore. IF this had been another Electronics manufacturer ,they would have sent a new one no questions asked. I am a Prime Member,but I am considering not renewing. Your company has disappointed a Loyal Customer.I wanted to add that Amazon did the right thing,and they refunded my money . I used it towards a Kindle Fire HDX. And, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Serious issues with parental controls - No way for a parent to truly regulate access to content.
Reviews.Author: Lauren A.
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is great.  I bought 3 - one for each child.  However, if you're interested in FreeTime, know that it is oriented towards really young kids.  And your entire Amazon Cloud is available on EACH Kindle without FreeTime.  So, parents, if you have books and magazines  on YOUR kindle that aren't child appropriate (and I'm sure you do) your child will have access to them without FreeTime.Issue #1:  My 9 year old and 7 year old want access to certain websites that are totally fine - sumdog (math games), pottermore (a harry potter fan site), americangirl.com and the like.  With FreeTime, there is NO WAY to give your child access to those sites. Internet browsing is completely restricted and as the parent you can't enable internet browsing or choose specific sites to grant access.  So, disappointingly, my kids can't use great sites on their Kindle Fires.  I don't want to disable FreeTime because I'd rather err on the side of control, but it should take into account the fact that parents of older children and tweens may want to pick and choose websites to give their child access too without giving access to everything.Issue #2:  Why on earth is the entire Amazon Cloud content available on every Kindle?  My children - even if they were teens - do not need access to every book that has been downloaded to our shared cloud!  I shouldn't have to go back and delete things to avoid giving them access. And what if I want to read a Harlequin romance or the like or some trashy magazine?  Why should my child automatically have access to it if I want to read it?Issue #3:  I can't get the Amazon Cloud Player with free time.  I have CDs in my cloud player.  Can't give access to the kids due to the insane FreeTime restrictions.  So, if I want to give my kids access to music from Frozen, Disney Princess, Taylor Swift etc., I can't.I called up to see if this can be fixed and after being bounced around on the phone tree, the Amazon rep "took my suggestions" about improving FreeTime.  Hope they do!  Amazon listen up: Don't force us to choose between overly restrictive Kindle FreeTime and a free for all of shared content. Don't make the CLOUD automatically available on all Kindles registered to your account.  I want to pick and choose content for each Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Good if you have Amazon Prime
Reviews.Author: Joy Austin
Reviews.Content: I've taken a while to write this review and use the product because I wanted to be as accurate as possible. If you're an average/occasional reader and are looking for a devise to browse the web, read books and play games, I'd say your money is better used for an iPad. If this is a purchase solely as an ereader and in addition to your usual tablet, then it is a great product and worth the money.Pros-Great portable size that can easily be placed in a purse or travel bag-Vibrant colors and fast graphics-Very easy to read in all light setting (artificial, daylight by the pool, reading in bed at night)-Amazon Prime enables downloading of one book at a time, for as long as you need to borrow it-Good battery life which allows you a lot of usage without frequent breaks to charge-Easy grip style allows you hold in one hand with a no-slip functionEbook Pros-Hold and define words function. Super user intuitive and great, especially for young readers who don't want to get out a dictionary and may just skip over a word they may not know-Great to read in all light settings: dark, light, natural light. Unlike other tablets, can adjust the backlighting to compensate for where you are and your viewing preference-Numerous ebooks available to borrow for free through Amazon Prime programCons-Hard to type for a period of time, especially if you have larger hands. My hands are tiny, I wear a size 4 ring, but I noticed browsing the web is almost a tedious task. Forget paragraph emails; I'd rather use something else than this. Yes, it is bigger than an iPhone, but the in between size of not big-not-small product makes for awkward keyboard usage-Not user intuitive. This may be because I'm used to using an iPad, however when I got it out of the box, I expected to be able to figure this thing out in minutes. Unfortunately, it's not that easy. It took me quite some time to figure out how to use the borrow function of books on Amazon Prime. I would've like to have seen a home screen button which would take me straight to it as soon as I opened it up. I also think it would give Amazon another place to capture an audience for the Prime subscription-As a tablet, it just doesn't cut it. I bought this as a supplement to a tablet for reading so I could just throw it in my purse while on the go, but I hoped buying the Kindle Fire HD would provide a bit of extra umph so I could phase out my tablet and just use this portable device. The apps aren't as great nor nearly as many, however maybe it's just timing and once developers realize they need to expand their platforms, better games and apps will be available.Overall, if you have the extra money and are looking for a strictly reading device, I'd say you can't go wrong with the Kindle HD. It's reasonable priced and very portable. The ebook functions are easy to use and user friendly. A great product made by Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for the first year, customer service was a total failure on Amazon's part when it stopped working right
Reviews.Author: Jaime Kutcher
Reviews.Content: After a year of using my 16GB Kindle Fire HD with no problems it randomly started shutting itself off when the battery is around 80%, sometimes even 90%. It works once plugged in but it needs to be tethered to the wall in order to be used more than 30 minutes. Amazon's response after 3 WEEKS and having to contact them THREE times: bad hardware but you're outside of the year warranty, send us the broken one back and buy a refurbished one for $40 less than a brand new one. I was beside myself. OR I could buy a new one and have two kindles for $40 more and one them wouldn't be a broken and refurbished piece of electronic equipment. The problem started before the year was up but it was over the holidays so I didn't get around to complaining about it until January (I got it December 2012). So if you think your Kindle has a problem AT ALL, make sure to contact them before the 365th day. After that, don't expect them to get back to you when they REPEATEDLY tell you they'll be getting back to you. It's a lie.If you would have asked for my review a month ago, it would have been 5 stars. I love the display, apps and had no complaints about it. Now I'm just disgusted with it all together. Most of the comments I've gotten from friends is to just get a tablet.

Reviews.Title: So disappointed
Reviews.Author: P. McQuinn "Bookjunky"
Reviews.Content: I loved my original Kindle Fire. The only thing wrong with it was when I started running out of storage space for apps. I kept deleting and deleting and finally faced up to the fact that I needed a new device with more storage. When the new Kindle Fire HD came I was so excited. until I got it out of the box and began to us it. The factory settings were terrible. I had to call tech support to fix the settings so I could single tap and not have to use 2 fingers to swipe the unlock bar on the screen to work like the old one did. A very reliable app I have used since the days o my old Palm ViiX, that ran just fine on my original fire, proved to be another headache. No longer can I just plug the device into the computer and easily transfer files via the cable I have to use box sync now. So when I sent my word files to the device via box sync the device kept demanding I buy a new office app for the device. So here came 3 days of fussing and calls. The factory setting on the device caused another issue.Stranded indoors because of the weather I needed an escape and began watching videos. This device runs Netflix but has to frequently have the cache dumped and the device itself reset while watching. The great frequency the device has to be reset is really very annoying. I have had to reset the device more in the short time I have owned it than my original Fire was reset the entire time I have owned it. In fact depending on what I am doing I have to reset the device 4 to 6 times a day on the worst of the days.Being able to get a case with a closure that turns the device on and off when the cover is opened sounded really great. Unfortunately I am experiencing a problem with setting the device down at night, fully charged, and picking it up the next morning to find it badly needs to be charged. The day I am writing this it had a 9% charge when I picked it up - down from the 100% charge it had when I sat it on the table the night before. Now it had not been touched overnight. This was not the first time.I so wanted to love this device as much as the old one but I just can't. The buttons are located on an angled surface on the case of the device and are very fussy to operate at times. The little light that went on on the old device to indicate red while charging, green when fully charged is missing on this one. The battery life is great when it doesn't discharge overnight while not being used.The pro to this device - the sound is greatly improved. Improved battery lifeCons: reliance on boxwave for some file transfers  the angled surface on the case where the buttons are located  great frequency resets are required  mysterious battery discharges  fussiness required to operate the external buttons on the case. The original Fire was very user friendly for those with impaired grip.

Reviews.Title: Do Items Like This Normally Last 2 Months?
Reviews.Author: Watchman
Reviews.Content: I got this product in November of 2013, and by January of 2014 I had to send it back because it would not turn on (naturally inhibiting the purposeful usage thereof). All I have to say is that I will NOT be getting one in the near future, or possibly ever. This is the first product by them with which I have had problems. Maybe it was a fluke.

Reviews.Title: This Senior says AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Gardengirl "Shar"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a first generation Kindle to this product and I am so happy with it. I am a senior and am a little intimidated by some technology. I am having no problem learning this as it is very user-friendly. Graphics are sharp and clear and I was blown away by the quality of sound on it. I cannot speak for the technical side of this product but I can speak from the user's side and in one word I would say it is AWESOME! and highly recommend, especially if you are a new user in the Tablet world.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!
Reviews.Author: darkraven
Reviews.Content: I am so happy that I have this, everything runs perfect on it. It charges fast, the battery life is great, video is crystal clear.

Reviews.Title: So nice I will upgrade.
Reviews.Author: Arthur
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this so much for reading, easy internet news, and chess/bridge games that I will upgrade to the Fire HDX model.

Reviews.Title: Hoping my 3rd replacement works...
Reviews.Author: Janice S.
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me say that I LOVED my Kindle Fire HD when I first received it (on August 9th, 2013).  The options for apps were better than my Nook.  I loved the fact that I could check out an electronic library book. I loved Kindle Free Time for my 3 year old.  HOWEVER, my Kindle randomly got stuck in the "restart loop" and after trying all the online fixes, I called customer support.  I was pleasantly surprised to hear that they would send me a replacement.  What they neglected to tell me was that the replacement was a refurbished Kindle.  I received my first replacement on November 16th, 2013.  After spending the time to register it and download all of the apps that I previously had, the "new" Kindle started to act up. I called customer support once again and at this time offered to PAY EXTRA for a new Kindle Fire HD (instead of a refurbished one); however, was told that wasn't an option.  When I offered to PAY EXTRA to be able to upgrade to an HDX, was told that was not an option either.  (Apparently, if I had an older model, paying to upgrade to the HDX would have been an option, but not since I had the HD.)  When I received the second replacement on December 2nd, 2013, it was acting up straight out of the box, but I was determined to give it a shot.  (By "acting up", I mean the volume would randomly increase to the highest level and make the "binging" noise.  It also would randomly just pop up the "shut down" box and I would have to hit cancel repeatedly and hope that it didn't shut down.)  However, I was going to give this one a fair shake since it was my second refurbished replacement and I REALLY didn't want to go through the registration process, download all of my apps AGAIN if it wasn't going to work.  Long story short (although that ship has sailed), I should have immediately called and returned the second replacement.  It worked for a while and here I am in the same place I was in November on January 12, waiting for my third replacement Kindle to arrive.  Again, I offered to pay extra to either get a New Kindle HD or HDX instead of a refurbished one. (I was told that I could not pay extra to get a new HD as there were none available; however, when I look on the website it appears that there are New HD's available...not sure what that is about.)  I spoke to THREE customer support staff who were very apologetic but could not really fix my problem. (Don't get me wrong, I know that it isn't their fault that their hands are tied, but the situation is getting ridiculous at this point.)  I was again told that it was not an option for me to pay extra for a new device at this time and that my comments would be passed along to leadership and that the best way for me to share my thoughts was to review my purchase, so here it is.  If my 3rd replacement works for longer than a month, I MIGHT increase my star rating to three.  If my 3rd replacement doesn't work, I only have one request... that SOMEONE/OTHER COMPANY has developed a Kindle Free Time equivalent so that I can trade my Kindle in for a reliable tablet that will work consistently.  It is SAD that my Nook HD that is almost two years old is out performing my less than 6 month old Kindle HD, but at least I still have a tablet for my daughter to use!

Reviews.Title: not worth your money
Reviews.Author: Indri harahap "cici_nomaden"
Reviews.Content: We bought this kindle fire, because we owned the first version of Kindle FIre. My biggest complaint on our first version is that after a while, it's hard to charge it without having to wiggle the cable around, practically do the acrobat while at it, because the darn thing wouldn't charge properly. When it finally does, we never knew how we got it charged in the first place. Anyway, it's a prickly device. So we thought it must've been because it was old, and since the price was nice, we thought we'll just replace it with another kindle. We thought the manufacturer must've gotten those bugs fixed, right? Well, WRONG!This version does even worse than our first version. After only a couple of weeks, we can't charge it at all. We've tried different chargers, different plug ins around the house. It just wouldn't charge. Thank God Amazon customer service is reliable enough where we can return the darn thing for good, and get a full refund without having to pay for shipment back. Great Service, Amazon! Just wish your device is just as reliable!

Reviews.Title: My First Tablet
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: This Kindle is amazing! The HD Display looks so great, and it's easy to use. The battery holds its charge very well and it has a nice lightweight feel. A great buy!

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed - Is Amazon losing its focus on quality?
Reviews.Author: A. Soman
Reviews.Content: Update: 10/13/2013The replacement tablet arrived in 2 days. It did not have the build quality issue as the original.Booting it up I noticed that the brightness on the new one was better, since I compared it side by side with the first one at the same display settings. But once the firmware update got done on the replacement, the screen brightness went lower. Maybe its something to do with extending battery life via the firmware update.Apparently Amazon took a serious note of my concerns and they sent me a custom shipping label which would get the defective kindle back to their engineering section rather than the returns center. Good work Amazon! Hopefully you will be able to do something to improve the display quality on this. I mean the resolution is great and there are a lot of details in the display, but the it looks like it it about to grey out and die- especially compared to the first gen Kindle Fire I have been using for more than 2 years.So based on all this, I will update my review to 3 stars. I see a lot of reviewers talking about how great this is for the price. But the fact is that there are a decent number of tablets out there for $100+. Based on hardware I cannot say this is an awesome deal.Good:The battery life is good.Display is sharp.Bad:Lack of screen brightnessThe UI is slow and jittery.Tablet is slow to open applications.The web browser is a joke.Having said that, this is a great option for consumers of Amazon content, but those who want to consume content offline - it would be better to go with the 16GB model since there is very little room left on the 8 GB version to download media.Hope this review and update have been helpful to you. Thanks for reading-------------------------I have been a prime customer for many years and I have had a Kindle fire ever since it first came out. Great device, great customer service.In fact it was so great that I didnt bother to upgrade to the Kindle fire HD. But with the launch of this Kindle Fire HD 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers, I thought I will shell out $140 so that my daughter can make use of the freetime feature.Unboxing this device, i saw that its nowhere as well built as the previous generation. The back panel was actually loose and was flexing when I touched it. I am shocked as I never expected Amazon to cut costs when it came to quality.Powering it on was an even bigger disappointment - the white is more like a yellow and when I cranked up the brightness the backlight started flickering! Very bad Amazon.The Amazon skin over android is as usual very heavy and the tablet remains sluggish in performance. But that was the case for he first generation as well and didnt bother me as much since the hardware was so well built.Amazon customer care is awesome as usual, and when I contacted them, they sent me a replacement which is on the way. But I really dont know if it would be much better than the one I have. I will upgrade my rating if the replacement is working without issues.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't run Hulu or Netflix on the fire hd
Reviews.Author: mrd
Reviews.Content: My goal with this device was to run basic apps and watch Hulu and Netflix. Well, I wasn't able to run either for too long before crashing. I contacted to kindle team and all they said was kill the app through a "force stop." It worked for 5 mins, then would just "buffer" thereafter. It's a shame because Amazon has always delivered for me.  I was very disappointed with this purchase.The kindle was able to run apps and browse fine. It failed with video playback.  Couldn't run video on the browser. Only would run 20 min max on hulu before crashing. Since the main purpose of this device is to use as a tablet for media consumption, the fire hd fails to deliver.

Reviews.Title: Never thought I'd say this...
Reviews.Author: Mountain Mama
Reviews.Content: But we've had this for 4 months and it's broke -- can't get it to even turn on.  We've charged the battery and more and all we get is the black screen of death.  I'm so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Keeps breaking-very annoying.
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, however, I felt compelled to warn others.  After having it for two months, one kindle would no longer charge and the other one had a frozen screen that would never shift from the offers!  Amazon sends you replacements that are refurbished.  One replacement will not stay turned on unless it is plugged in.  Do not waste your money on this product unless you pay for the protection plan.  You will get your money's worth out of the protection plan.  However, it is so annoying to have to keep sending them back.  I encourage you to spend the extra money and get an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Absolute waste of money
Reviews.Author: L. Sandoval
Reviews.Content: We originally bought the Kindle Fire HD for our children for Christmas.  We took two of them back and traded one up for the 16GB model.  The main reason we bought it was for Kindle Freetime.  Kids get bored with Kindle Freetime though and you have to purchase different apps.  Big problem is when you try to add them to their account on the Kindle, the full version you  purchased doesn't work on their account and wants you to purchase it again (even though they are supposed to be linked by my e-mail address like videos, etc.)Another problem, it crashes constantly.  Some apps from the app store just don't load in Freetime.  Sometimes the battery can be completely full, you go to wake it up from sleep, and it won't even turn on.  You put it on the charger for about an hour and miraculously it starts working again.  I've never had a device so riddled with problems.  I have had Windows, Android, and iOS devices.  None of these devices have these problems.  If you are using it for one person you may not have an issue.  I still see it crash quite frequently no matter what app I use.  The same thing happened on the 8GB version so I know its not related to the device itself but more the Fire OS.Go get a Nexus 7 or a Apple iPad instead.  Don't bother with the Kindle Fire and the Amazon ecosystem.

Reviews.Title: Speedy Delivery!
Reviews.Author: Lisacious
Reviews.Content: I must say, I'm truly impressed with the delivery of this product.  I ordered it on Monday, Jan 6 and received it today!!! Unbelievable!! I was expecting it to arrive next week sometime.  Glad I now have it. I've had 2 tablets and neither one of them lasted very long although those tablets were not ordered through Amazon.  I love this Kindle Fire HD tablet already! The pictures, whether games, videos, movies, etc., are crystal clear and beautiful.  Excellent sound as well!  Features are great also!! All is going well with my new tablet right now.  I hope it stays that way!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my son
Reviews.Author: J. M. Pena
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these last May for my 7 year old son who has Asberger's.  I love it not only for the quality of the picture and sound, but the durability.  I purchased an OtterBox Defender Standing Case for Kindle Fire HDX 7", Black for it shortly after.  He has dropped it by accident a few times and the Kindle Fire continues to work flawlessly.  I have a variety of movies, apps, and educational games on this Kindle.  He loves it.  When we travel I am able to set up my hotspot internet on my cell phone and he can get on to the internet to stream movies and other things that he could do at home.  Great entertainment.

Reviews.Title: Rating Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jeanne T. Houde
Reviews.Content: Love my Fire HD.  I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a portable tablet and e-reader.  This fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Reading on this Kindle Fire HD is great!
Reviews.Author: Bglasgow2
Reviews.Content: I have discovered reading again. This kindle makes it so easy to sample books, order books and read books. For an entry level tablet I am thrilled with my purchase. Grand Slam Amazon!

Reviews.Title: I am in love
Reviews.Author: Chad C
Reviews.Content: I like that it is smaller and the screen is so clear; its better than I expected.  I sleep with a loud fan and the speakers have been loud enough to still hear movies, versus my laptop that I can't hear in the same scenario.  The silk browser is fast.  It's awesome.  It's light and very portable.  Don't leave home without it. I am reading more books than I have in years. Waiting in line or in the car doesn't bother me anymore... I have a Kindle!!! For $140 it can't be beat!!!

Reviews.Title: Not an iPad, but...
Reviews.Author: Joshua B. Smith "Joshua B. Smith"
Reviews.Content: Not being an iPad isn't a mark against this tablet.I had to pay for some medical testing, so I sold my iPad (being a poor 20-year-old on the tight budget) and when I was in a place a few months later to re-obtain a tablet computer, I wasn't interested in buying another iPad and putting that strain on my wallet.That happened to be the same week that Amazon released their new generation of Kindle Fire HD tablets. Having owned a kindle in the past, I knew about the quality of their hardware and customer service. They have always been honorable and helpful, just as I was used to with Apple. Warranties that cannot be matched in the industry, to my knowledge. There was no hesitation in hitting the "order" button.And I'm so glad that I did order this little jewel. It's everything you need in a tablet computer. Fits perfectly in your hands, has a beautiful screen, and is functional and un-complicated. It's got all the apps that you're going to need. Netflix, weather apps, Tumblr, Twitter and Facebook.I will update this review when I have had a few more weeks with the Fire, but I don't think I will have any negative comments.Do get this, as it's the best deal for a tablet in the industry right now!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Battery Life and No One Cares!
Reviews.Author: Cryston Redieske
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I am an avid Amazon customer.  I purchase something from Amazon usually a couple of times a week.  However, this New Kindle Fire has been such a disappointment that I'm not sure that I will buy anything created by them again.This Kindle Fire was a Christmas present for my son, and he loves it.  The problem is that it won't stay charged for more than 2 or 3 hours.  I called Amazon customer service and was told to perform a hard reset, turn down the brightness, and to turn off wi-fi.  Well, I did the hard reset and I turned down the brightness, but I refuse to turn off wi-fi.  What is the point of having a tablet that you can't get on the internet with.  And my son uses Facetime, so he doesn't have access to the wi-fi settings to change it based on his current needs.  Amazon customer service called me back again and said that I need to turn off wi-fi.  Well, I have an "old" Kindle Fire (from 6 months ago) for my other son and he never has to turn off wi-fi and the tablet will last all day, and my husband and I both have iPads that last all day without turning off wi-fi.  I just think this is a ridiculous expectation of a tablet computer.  All of this is happening after spending an entire day online and in stores searching for a kid proof case for this Kindle because the old ones don't work for it!  So, I guess I won't be receiving any real assistance or a replacement for my Kindle and I'll just have to live with a Kindle that won't work for more than 2 hours.  And, even if they did decide to do something about it we have been discussing this problem for so long that my date to return the Kindle has almost passed.I have NEVER had any problem with Amazon or their customer service prior to this and I am truly disappointed in how this has been handled.  So, I suggest ordering the older Kindle Fire model or a different tablet all together because if you happen to get a faulty one that's just to bad.  You will have to make do with what you got!

Reviews.Title: on my 3rd kidnle
Reviews.Author: Patricia Natzke
Reviews.Content: I am on my 3rd kindle fire. why release or ship a product you are aware there are issues with?

Reviews.Title: Great reader for the price - Kindle Fire HD 7" 2013 Version
Reviews.Author: Alex Kearns
Reviews.Content: Aunt & Uncle bought this for my 8-year old daughter.  I was against it at first, thought I would have to pay a monthly subscription fee (but that is an optional thing).  My daughter has used it every single day for 30-minutes, and not a minute longer in 'game mode' because parents can restrict the amount of time spent playing games (nice feature). Reading time is not limited. She has had it for 2-weeks now, so this is an "early" review.  I'll update this review at a later date if things go wrong with the device. We are having problems getting the 'sylus pen' application to work, so my daughter can keep a journal - but I honestly think it is having 2 parents that lack electronic device knowledge, having never downloaded an App before. So since I have nothing else to really compare it to, I have to just say we are overall very happy with it and our 8-year old thinks it is a godsend - she loves books and is excited to grow her electronic library. This will be used primarily as a Reader moving forward.  It is very bright, but we don't allow her to read in the dark regardless so not bothered by the brightness. It is lightweight and has great sound and clear display.  Now we wish we could just find a good protective case for the 2013 7" Fire HD Version - one that offers impact protection, as well as a smart sleep/wake feature to save battery life - if anyone has a suggestion for a good "kids" case, please post a comment!

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire HD 7" is a big disappointment!
Reviews.Author: EileenDalla "EileenDalla"
Reviews.Content: After owning a Kindle e-reader for several years, I decided to replace it with the new Kindle Fire HD 7" when it finally gave up the ghost and died.  I was so satisfied with my e-reader that I never gave a second thought to ordering the new Fire, but I wish now I had done a little research into it before spending my money on a product I am so disappointed in. The touch screen seems to have a mind of it's own and when turning a page it sometime runs away with itself and I end up several pages ahead of where I want to be.  It has also changes from English to another language just by turning a page.  I find I have to recharge everyday and sometimes even more often if I have spent a lot of time reading.I have yet to have my wifi work efficiently when I am within range of a hot spot and have resorted to loading books from my computer the same way I did with my e-reader.  All in all I have to say your Kindle Fire SUCKS!!!! I wish I had just ordered an e-reader and saved myself a good chunk of money not to mention the aggravation and stress I have to put up with when it goes off on one of it's tangents.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet
Reviews.Author: meangreen
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet of any kind and I love it. My wife also loves it. The reason I finally decided to try a tablet was because of the $139 price tag. I know it is not a top of the line but it still is giving me all I need. I really do not understand some of the negative reviews where people are complaining about the lack of a camera, hdmi, mic, ect. Did they not read the description before they ordered as it is plainly stated. Anyway, I love this thing so much that i am now considering purchasing one of the new HDX kindles when they come out.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal! Some Setup Issues
Reviews.Author: Paulie Walnuts
Reviews.Content: I ordered the new Kindle Fire HD the day it was announced and received it this morning.  When I first powered it on, the unit was set to the Japanese language option.  After a few minutes of trial and error, I was able to set it to English.  After I registered the unit, the screen went black and could not reboot.  It asked if I wanted to do a factory reset, which I did.  After the reset, and re-registering, the Kindle Fire went through a software update.  Since the update, the unit is running great.  It is very quick, the screen is beautiful and the new user interface is really nice.  The only disappointing thing is the sound.  I own the original Kindle Fire and the original Fire HD and they both had richer sound.  Also, this model seems to run a little warmer than previous models.  It is very thin and light compared to past KFs, but it still feels solid.  For the price, it really is an incredible buy.  I just hope the initial reboot issues were corrected by the software update.

Reviews.Title: Great Little tablet
Reviews.Author: Keiron Charles
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle fire. My mother has the original Kindle Fire, I have the 2nd generation HD and I wanted to buy one for my father for his birthday who was the odd man out without one.As a student, I have Amazon Prime and I manage to get it THE NEXT DAY after ordering it which was amazing and completely surprised me. Also when I first opened the tablet I thought I got the wrong tablet as I didn't know the HD was redesigned and looks now like the HDX (The pictures of the back needs to be updated on the website).The back design are more arched so it does fit in the hands better. It is also smaller and lighter than the 2nd Gen HD. The slightly annoying flush buttons of the 2nd generation HD is now split to two sides of the Kindle which is better but i personally wish the buttons were raised because I still have the issue where i'm searching for the correct orientation. Also its worth noting that it does NOT have a front camera or have the micro HDMI port of the Kindle Fire HD 2nd generation. This isn't much of a deal breaker considering that all cheaper priced kindles were camera-less.The improvements of the OS makes use simpler. One of my favorite improvements is the lock screen. While it still has the advertisements, It now shows the time so you don't have to unlock the screen to see the time. Also the Silk browser is miles better on the first incarnation which we all can we was painful compared to Safari/Chrome/Dolphin.All in All, this Kindle Fire is a great entry tablet. If you just want a tablet to read, go on a few websites, then go play Candy Crush, This is a no brainer for the price. If you're more about productivity and apps, you look at your Nexus 7's and iPad Mini's

Reviews.Title: Good for the price, but ultimately it's flawed.
Reviews.Author: theLorax
Reviews.Content: This is a decent tablet for the money. Good bang for your buck. It's easy to recommend it for people who are on a very tight budget, or for casual users who subscribe to Amazon prime. This is not a tablet I would recommend to people who want the best tablet on the market.The Kindle Fire HD is a combination of good qualities, and limitations. I'll briefly go over the main ones.As I mentioned, the main selling point is the price. I got mine on black friday for $100, and that's quite a bit cheaper than a 16GB iPad Mini, or Microsoft Surface RT. The tablet has some good hardware that exceeds what other $100 tablets have. You get a dual core processor, and 1GB of RAM. Speed wise, it's pretty decent. App loading, and web browsing is pretty good. It's not blazing fast, but it's definitely not sluggish either. The screen is also very good considering this is an entry level tablet. The PPI/Resolution is quite high, giving photos, videos, and text a crisp, detailed look. Colors are vivid, and the brightness is adequate.One of the best things about this tablet is actually the speakers. It's stereo, and the two speakers are wide apart, combined with Dolby 5.1, it can have almost a surround sound. The volume also tops out at a surprising level. Of course you won't get a lot of bass. But the quality and volume level is quite good. Better than all the popular tablets I have owned or tried. Wifi performance is also great thanks to its dual antennas. Having an Amazon Prime membership will definitely elevate the experience with this device. Prime movies, TV shows, and rented books are integrated into the menus.Now for it's limitations. There is no camera. That means video conferencing with Skype is not possible, as well as snapping photos. This may not be a dealbreaker for most, since most people will have their cell phone cameras, and standalone cameras to use. But the previous Fire HD had a front facing camera. I don't see why they had to remove it.There is no voice dictation, and that's something I used quite a bit when composing emails. Anytime I needed to type in more than one sentence, I would use it. The device also does not have LTE. Again, this is something that only a small percentage of users would be taking advantage of anyways.It is also somewhat heavy considering it's size. But still not too heavy that you cant operate it comfortably with one hand. I also would have preferred if the bezels were thinner. This is mostly a personal preference. Some people say that the thick bezels prevent typos and accidentally touching things on the screen, but I haven't had a problem with thinner bezels when I used the iPad mini. The smaller dimensions would have been nice as I could have fit it in a coat pocket, and even jeans pockets probably.While many Android tablets have SD card slots, this one does not. It would have been good to have for putting on my own movies and music. But it's not a deal breaker.The Kindle Fire HD's OS "Mojito" is also very limited. On the bright side, it's very simple, easy to use, and reliable. I've rarely had apps crash, or things act buggy, or experience any persistent technical issues. Casual users, and people who are not technically inclined will appreciate the OS. However, this comes at a cost.The app selection is severely limited. There is nowhere near the amount of apps and content for Fire OS as there is on Google Play for standard Android devices. I have no idea why so many great games on Google Play are not available for this device, despite the fact that it has hardware that is more than good enough to run it. Not only games, but apps in all categories.One of the dealbreakers is that there are no other web browsers you can download and use on the device. I would have liked to use Chrome so I can sync bookmarks with my desktop, and I would have liked to use a special 3rd party browser that supports Flash like Photon for the iPad. A few of my most visited sites use Flash, and I cannot go to them on the Kindle. Also with Fire OS, you don't have the customization as regular android. You don't have Widgets either.Also the side buttons are quite small, and they are so flush with the edge of the device that they are difficult to find. It took me a while using the device before I could get accustomed to this. They also removed the HDMI output which was on the previous gen model. It would have definitely been nice to have. I often travel, and it would have been great to be able to bring my own HDMI cable and play my videos and games on the hotels TV's.I understand it is possible to root this device and install Android Jellybean on here, making the device more capable. But i've heard you lose the ability to use Amazon Prime, and that's something I can't lose since that's a big part of what I use the device for.Overall, I think this device is definitely worth the price it can be had for now, and it's definitely an okay choice among entry level tablets, but it definitely cannot compete against higher end tablets. For casual users who have amazon prime, this is an okay choice. If this came with standard Android, and it retained a front facing camera, hdmi output, and had an SD card slot, this would be much easier to recommend.

Reviews.Title: the Interface is tedious
Reviews.Author: W. Watson
Reviews.Content: The device functions well. I don't have any complaints about that --reading books is easy enough, exept when you want to leave the book. Getting it to show you the exit from a book requires a lot of repeated tapping at the bottom of the screen because the little tab for bringing up the navigation menu disappears, and it's not always easy to get it to come back so you can exit the book. That part I consider a minor annoyance.What does bother me is that they make managing applications to be ridiculously complex. If I want to force an application to stop, I can't do it from the application. Instead, If it's a game, You have to exit the game and get back to the home screen, then flick the top down to select settings then go to applications, then to manage applications, then you have to scroll through every application to find it, or select the dropdown to view running applications, then click on it, and then hit the force stop, to shut off the applications. You can have apps running for days after you think you've closed it --just sucking system resources.The thing that really turned my smiley face upside down is accessing files you have on your kindle. Finding what you've put on is the most abysmal experience I've had in computing. The lack of any sort of explorer-like interface makes me think the designers were just high on crack when they were working on this. Even on my three year old smartphone, I can click on the file explorer and see where everything is. I'm not using it for much, but when I'm trying to find a picture that I've stored on it and you have more than a hundred, it's just out and out aggravating. Folder navigation is the cornerstone of just about every operating system, but it's conspicuously absent.The photo/video section deserves its own roasting. What sort of idiot thinks that people wouldn't want to sort their photos or reorder them by date, file name or size, etc? I uploaded some of the images from a comic I'm working on onto my kindle, and when I go to view them in order, the kindle decides on some sort of random algorithm that makes absolutely no sense --in what order it's going to show them to you. Even though my pictures were in named numerically so they could be viewed/sorted in the proper order, they do not show that way in the built in photo app. And they're grouped together with every other photo that I have.  There is no way to navigate to the separate folder in which I placed them, and there's no way to view only the contents of that folder. That is the stupidest setup I have ever encountered. You have no option anywhere to change how it displays them, or to tell it to sort by name or by folder or anything we take for granted on 99% of the other android devices out there. After having this thing for a couple of months, I pretty much know I won't buy another one until they fix this idiotic setup.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD went bad after only 2 months
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire seemed to be okay until 2 months into purchasing it when it started to shut down in the middle of games, reading a book, etc.  At first it was just every once in awhile where it would shut down, and the battery level had nothing to do with it because it would happen when the battery level was at 98% full.  Progressivly it got worse where it would shut down and the only way to get it to start back up would be to plug it in to turn it back on (and the battery was not low). After a month of dealing with this I finally contacted Amazon. When I explained the issue and told them I had done a factory reset to try and resolve the issue I was told they would send me a replacement. Today, I received the replacement. IT IS A REFURBISHED Device. I immediately contacted Amazon and was told when they are sending replacement devices they may send refurbished or they may send new; it just depends what they have on hand. When I stated that I had only had their lemon product for 3 months and expected a brand new device I was basically told too bad.  This was my 3rd Kindle. I loved my Kindles.  I will NEVER buy a Kindle Fire again.  Would I buy a regular Kindle? Possibly... but the next time I want a tablet I am going with the iPad.

Reviews.Title: "Refurbished" does not meet my expectations
Reviews.Author: Wy
Reviews.Content: When something is refurbished, you expect it to work a little longer and 1-2 weeks. My earlier problems were continual restarting for no reason at all. In the past few days it a frozen solid and pushing the off button took some doing. I will be returning this. I am disappointed.

Reviews.Title: VERY IMPRESSIVE!!!
Reviews.Author: Greggorio!
Reviews.Content: This pocket sized piece of state of the art technology is fantastic.  I purchased the basic 8GB model as I intend to use it only for e-reading as well as briefly checking on facebook and emails.  The screen size of 7 inches may seem a trifle small if you have used other tablets but it remains larger than my paperwhite.  The clarity of the screen is breath-taking.  The weight is barely noticeable and the size overall is virtually the same as a paperback you would hold in your hands.  I paid the absolute bargain price os $158 (on special at my local retailer) so the purchase is even more outstanding.  The wifi is super fast when you download a book.  Setup was a breeze and it took barely 30 seconds.Negatives are really only my opinions on the design.  As it is a tablet, you are always touching the screen to read the next page, so ideally I would request that Amazon consider page turning buttons for the next iteration of this awesome tablet.  That is all I can think of.  If we could get the paperwhite cover (with auto shut off and auto on) then I would definitely order one of those, too.In summary, then: this device is so good that it will make you realise that you need an 8.9 inch HDX, as well!!!!Seriously!!!!!So guess what I am buying myself for Christmas!!!!!BFN Greggorio!!!

Reviews.Title: Hate my kindle
Reviews.Author: Little L
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be great for audiobooks and movies while traveling but I have to fight to download everything.  Extremely slow, loses the connection most of the time.  I have been able to download one movie I purchased.  That is it.  I just spent an hour trying to download a book.  I have followed all the "tips" to no avail.  I am usually very pleased with anything from Amazon, but I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Everything I ever expected!
Reviews.Author: Barbara W. Schwanke
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and I can download library books to this device. HIGHLY recommend! It's multiple programs are easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Can not download more than 1 movie.
Reviews.Author: natalie
Reviews.Content: Unable to download more than 1 movie to Kindle Fire. Have to constantly keep everything in the cloud. If you want a new movie, music, or book on Kindle you have to remove from device and then download only the one. Can not add and external Seagate Wireless Plus to Kindle Fire to use for storage because Amazon will not let you download movies to anything other than device. Does not work, don't be fooled. If you are taking a trip that lasts longer than 1 movie, do not buy this item. You will no longer have access to your cloud unless you are sitting on a Wi-Fi. Needs to allow external storage of movies, music, books to be played on this device. I bought these items, let me use them!

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Loraine
