Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd kindle fire.  The first two quit charging at about 8 months of use.  Each under different circumstances.  The first I only charged when it was dead, the second I kept in Grace-Digital-MatchStick docking station.  When the first one died, customer service said it happens a lot with the first generation, but since it was under warranty I got another for free.  This second quit charging after 6 months and customer service told me this time it was because I left it in the charging dock, and that ruins the battery.  I've read in the forums that the newer generations are not having these issues so I'm saving up to get one of those.  The only reason I paid for the discounted, refurbished one is it's what i could afford at the time.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Melodie Smith
Reviews.Content: I was worried I wouldn't be satisfied with this tablet, but I love it.  I didn't think I would use it a lot.  Boy was I wrong.

Reviews.Title: Kids vote Team iPad!
Reviews.Author: Nathel Turner
Reviews.Content: I enjoy using the kindle for reading. I do not like the interface of the apps, the lack of customization, and the at times counterintuitive setup. My children who enjoy reading as much if not more that I, prefer the ease of functionality and multitude of free children's apps and books found on the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Check on model options before you buy....
Reviews.Author: Jan Budz "J. Budzine"
Reviews.Content: I was happy with timely delivery of product though upon opening the Kindle (s) that I purchased, discovered too late they were not models with cameras. This surprised me as I purchased a Kindle HD fire 7 inch WiFi  (I'm looking at the original box of the one I purchased right now) for myself earlier this year and mine has a camera, a so I guess I assumed (guess I should know better than to assume...) that theses would too. Also my friend purchased 2 Kindle Fire HD 7 inch screen  around the same time, she got hers from Best Buy for even less money,(we thought we were ordering same ones) and hers had cameras. So ultimately this is my fault, but maybe vague advertising. Buyer beware and read the fine print!! Otherwise rest of options on Kindle are great.

Reviews.Title: Battery life and available apps could be much better.
Reviews.Author: Alicia Jay White
Reviews.Content: If you're trying to decide between an iPad mini and this device, consider how important battery life is for usage.  Battery on this device barely lasts a day for me if wifi is turned on even though the  device is not being used. I think it's because the device is looking for WiFi and the room it's stored in doesn't have a strong signal.  If I use airplane mode it improves a lot but it's nowhere near the battery life of an iPad or even regular Kindles.The screen is great for watching movies and TV shows. With Amazon Prime, you can download select movies and shows to the device for viewing without an internet connection.

Reviews.Title: Worked just long enough to get past warranty
Reviews.Author: Khaldun
Reviews.Content: So it worked great for over a year and my kids loved it.  and now it is just a really well cared for paper weight.  We tried different chargers on it including the charger for another kindle we have and when we plugged the other kindle into the charger of the broken one, it charged.  Have tried hard reset about a hundred times.Amazon customer service was nice and friendly but of course since it is out of warranty, there is nothing they will do.I expected it to last longer than a year and I am really disappointed that it didn't make it any longer.Am now considering trying some other android tablets instead.

Reviews.Title: Simple Review - Best Cheap Tablet
Reviews.Author: Ambercool
Reviews.Content: I've been a early adopter of tablets since the first Apple iPad.  I got this one for $119 at Best Buy, and I have to say this is the best deal out there.  I mainly wanted this for a cheap way to have my books read to me with the text-to-speech so it fulfilled my requirements.  I then started to watch some Amazon Prime movies and it looks great.I don't know how effective this is for office work, but I use this for books and entertainment only.  I have yet to find a cheaper brand and model that delivers this much.  So far I've had no technical issues.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: eyewrock
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love it. I have to say I was hesitant about buying it. I'm an Apple person. My house is full of apple devices. I have an iPhone, MacBook Air and there are multiple iPads in my home including the iPad 2, iPad 4 and the iPad air. The only reason I really wanted a Kindle was to have easy access to the Amazon kindle store since apple has denied access to buy Kindle ebooks directly from an Apple app. I know. It's crap, but what are we going to do about it. I should also mention I also own a Nook and while I have ebooks on it I prefer the Kindle store to the Nook store. It's much more organized and has a much wider selection.Okay, now on to the Kindle review. I ordered it not expecting to use it for much more than reading books and the occasional app to pass the time on but when I turned it on I was very surprised. The screen is amazing. The set up was super easy and I immediately downloaded a few apps to test the screen resolution. I did a side by side screen resolution comparison with iPad 4 and we (my family and I) agreed the Kindle was marginally better. We even zoomed in on a web page and yes, the iPad 4 was faster to load and smooth the small text we zommed to but the Kindle was right along with it. This was the test that counted (according to my brother in law) so the screen resolution and speed was awarded to the iPad 4, but only by a hair.Another issue I thought I would have was the special offers it comes with. I read many reviews of people who hated them and felt like they were renting the device rather than owning it and opted to pay to remove them. I thought I would test it out and if it really bothered me then I would spend the $15 or so and be rid of them. This has not bothered me one bit. The ads only play when the screen is locked and swiftly go away when you swipe to unlock the screen. If anything, I sometimes find myself starting at the beautiful screen. So if you're thinking of buying the Kindle try the offers first and save yourself a few bucks.The obvious difference for me was the different app store, which was another issue I thought I would have. The app store is chock full of choices in apps and I didn't miss the apple app store one bit. Oh, and one thing I love which apple doesn't offer is the coins that the Kindle comes with (500 coins which translates to $5), and if you buy certain apps you get more coins that you can then use for apps. I downloaded an app and then received an email letting me know I received one dollar towards mp3 songs. Not bad if you ask me. I just wish I knew which apps offered what but I'm sure the more I play around with it the more I will learn.I also have to say shipping was fabulous. I ordered this Dec 19 and selected free shipping and received it before Christmas. Great service which is what I expect from Amazon.All in all, I love my Kindle even though I haven't tried many gadgets it offers. Also, the fact that this tablet doesn't have a camera is a non issue to me since I hardly ever use my other tablets for the camera. They're just too big and bulky for that. That's what real cameras and phones are for.To other iPad users out there, the lack of a home button took a little getting used to. There is a swipe thing you have to do to get the home button on the screen and that will redirect you to the very different home page of the Kindle, and that too took a little getting used to but after a few days it becomes natural.If you're thinking of getting this tablet, get it. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: NOT user friendly
Reviews.Author: Julie Marie Allen
Reviews.Content: I specifically bought this for our 9 and 11 year old daughters (one for each of them) because of the parental controls but not only is this feature difficult to navigate (I can't seem to figure out how to move apps and books that they purchased outside the parental control into their respective profile on their device) but there's also a MONTHLY charge to enable the parental controls (not cool Amazon.com).  How do I feel about this? "Disappointed" is one term that could be used, "cheated" feels more appropriate though.Aside from these two problems (which are significant from my point of view as a parent who's trying to allow my kids screen time without it being excessive while also trying to help them manage their internet and app intake), the device seems nice.  Granted, it's no I-pad mini, but the price is right.

Reviews.Title: WARNING WARNING WARNING...
Reviews.Author: Paul C. Hoerner
Reviews.Content: If you are buying a Kindle Fire HD for someone because you love your Kindle Fire HD, this is not the Kindle Fire HD from last year.Amazon has made a HUGE mistake in naming this after a previous product and I feel it is very misleading.We bought one for our son as a Christmas gift because he loves using mine to play all of his favorite games. Imagine my surprise when I unpacked it to set it up and found something that doesn't resemble anything like my Fire HD. I contacted Costumer Support immediately and told them I had been shipped the wrong item. They agreed and said that they would overnight ship the correct Item. It wasn't until I did a little more research that I realized I had been shipped the "correct" item it just wasn't what we were expecting. So, even Amazon customer support is confused.The main problem is the lack of camera. My son plays Rovio products that scan in Telepods through the camera... no camera...no good.I'm sure this is a fine product, as the specs all match up to the previous gen Fire HD, but no camera, and no HDMI output, mean this is NOT a next gen Fire HD.... it's a next gen Fire......

Reviews.Title: Love and Hate
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I got the original Kindle Fire when it first came out. It had some errors and its problems, but I was really impressed with it and loved it! The Kindle Fire was my absolute favourite tablet and e-reader. So when it was stolen, I was determined to get another one at some point.Well, as an early Christmas gift, I got this one. To say the least, I'm more then a little disappointed.Starting with the outside design, I don't like the slanted sides. I don't like how when its plugged in, the plug sticks out and upward towards the screen instead of towards the back. It's annoying honestly. Not to mention, instead of the plugin being in the center, it's towards the left side. So it's right in the way of where/how I hold the tablet. That makes it even worse. I'm constantly bumping into it.Personally, the locations of the power and volume buttons aren't very convenient either. The power button on almost all products and every other product I own is on the top. For the Kindle now it's on the bottom. So I'm constantly forgetting and having to look for it. Annoying and inconvenient. The volume buttons aren't easy accessible either. As again, you have to look for them. You can't just keep your hands where they are, holding the device, the reach up with a finger to effortlessly turn the volume up or down. Nooooo. You can't do that. The volume buttons are at the top of the device, completely out of easy reach.Moving onto the software, I continue. I'll start with the over flow of apps that sit at the bottom of the screen. On the original Kindle Fire, they displayed 1 row of mini apps at the bottom of the screen and by swiping up, you could display more. Now you display between 2 and 3 rows that fade out. It's too much and looks so cluttered.Next comes the most annoying part of the entire product. The lovely suggestions bar (that sits under the main carousel) that I can't seem to find any way to get rid of! To me, this is like advertising. Which honestly, I thought I paid extra to get rid of anyway! Guess not. I don't want suggestions for new apps and things to download. I wish I could turn it off, but I sure can't find any way to do so. I absolutely can't stand things like this. I would love this if it was only to be seen in the app store, but it's not. So no, I'm not okay with it and no, I don't like it.I will give Amazon credit for adding a "Help" app. I haven't yet used the app, but I have opened it and looked around. I absolutely love the idea of having this app! To be able to get help right on the tablet is a great idea that I think more tablets should have. I no longer have to open my laptop to contact someone, I can do it right from my tablet, which I think is an absolutely wonderful idea! I love this new addition the most!Moving on to the "Games" tab. I don't like how there's no way to re-organize how the apps are displayed. Why can't I display the apps like before where you could choose to list them by "most played", "title", "installation", etc. We could also choose to display grid view or list view (this is the current set up). It's annoying how I can't display things the way I want. It's like you too AWAY customizations when you should be adding more.In the "Apps" tab though we can display the apps as just buttons with the name underneath. It takes up less room and I like it better this way. I don't understand why we can't do the same with the apps in the "Games" tab.Next we go to the "Books" tab, which is probably the best set up out of all the tabs. However, I don't like how there is no way to delete books from the device itself. Like the Oxford Dictionaries that the device comes with. Two books here that I'll never, ever use, but can't delete like I could on the original Kindle Fire.For someone who doesn't use the "Music", "Videos", "Newsstand", or "Audiobooks" tabs, it would be nice if we could simply choose not to display them. I haven't and know already that I never will use these tabs and I find them to take up space. I wish we could choose to remove tabs that we don't want displayed or don't plan to use. I think it would be nice to be able to reorganize the order of the tab as well.Finally, the last tab, the "Docs" tab. I use this tab quite often myself. Again, they got rid of an important setting. We're no longer given the option of grid view, instead we're stuck with the never-ending list view. For someone who has TONS of docs uploaded onto the device, having a list view doesn't work out too well as I have to scroll FOREVER to get through the list since it's so long.I have also noticed that all the book covers that we once part of my docs have been removed or at least, they no longer display. I find this annoying as well. I went through hours of work to make sure everything had a book cover and no none of them show up or are displayed. It's annoying.Don't get me wrong. I love the Kindle Fire. The set up and operating system is unique and that's what I loved about it most. However, I'm very disappointed in the latest version. If I could, I'd have gone back and purchased the original Kindle Fire that I loved. I had so few complaints about it. This, I have a love hate relationship with it. I love the kindle fire, but I hate the changes. I thought with the latest version, the tablet would get better and more amazing. I thought I'd love it even more then I did. I never thought that I'd fall out of love with a product I used to be addicted too and now annoys me.This was a real disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Keeps restarting at random
Reviews.Author: Robert Alexander
Reviews.Content: Goes into a restart loop and I can't use it randomly. Not too impressed seeing how much money I've spent on it. Hope this is fixed in a software update soon.

Reviews.Title: 5 star device for the price.
Reviews.Author: Joe R.
Reviews.Content: I own an iPad so in reality I did not really NEED to buy a kindle fire.  But there a few what I think are good reasons why I went ahead and purchased this device.  1: it was on sale for a day.  2: my 3 year old son is abusing my iPad. 3:  I like the simple design.  4:  looks (and is) durable.  So I went ahead and bought and I have no regrets.  It is very responsive, has a pretty good picture, has good sound quality, and is user friendly.  Although my justification for buying this was solely for my son to use it I can't help playing with it as well.  I use it for reading and watching Netflix.  The internet works nicely.  It is perfect for simple use.  When I give it to my son I'm not worried that he's going to break it because it is not fragile.  Between my son and I we've put a lot of miles on this thing and it has really achieved its purpose.  If you're thinking about getting one for the hell of it, go right ahead, I don't think you'll regret it.  I'm typing my review on it right now and it's correcting all my mistakes.  :)

Reviews.Title: One Click is always on
Reviews.Author: mikestuff
Reviews.Content: You should be aware, if you are buying this device for a child, and you purchase Free Time, you cannot log off the Amazon account on the Kindle and One Click purchasing is always on.  So you may get a big surprise when your child starts buying apps on your account and there isn't anything you can do to prevent it.  Amazon will tell you that you can turn off purchases in Parental Control, but it requires a password to exit Free Time, so the scenario here is that if your child wants to go from playing Free Time games and reading, to watching a Netflix movie, you must either give him the password to exit Free Time, so that he will still be able to buy all the apps he wants on  your account, or he must come to you to enter the password to exit Free Time.  An organization as big as Amazon should be able to make a software fix that would allow you (the parent) to control the capabilities of  your child on the Kindle.  I've read forum discussions going back a ways and this seems to have been a problem for a while and Amazon doesn't seem interested in fixing it.Update:  Stephanie from Amazon Kindle support was kind enough to contact me and help me resolve the issue with the One Click within Kindle Free Time.  She showed me how to set up Parental Control to prevent my grandson from making purchases.My previous 2 star rating is now a 5 star!

Reviews.Title: More a Tablet than a Reader
Reviews.Author: Ian "ICE"
Reviews.Content: If you want a reader this is not for you. If you want a low cost tablet that can be also used as a battery draining reader, this will work.

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: Siclali05
Reviews.Content: I've had the Kindle Fire HD 7" now for about 24 hours and already had to call customer support and deal with them for close to an hour. I am not new to tablets, I own an iPad and a Kindle Paperwhite and love both.  I decided to get this Kindle because I love educational apps for my son and liked the idea of Kindle Freetime.On that note, Kindle Freetime stopped working after less than a day.  I looked online to try to fix the issue myself and couldn't, I then called customer support.  She walked me through some troubleshooting stuff and said she couldn't help me and would transfer me to someone who was more familiar.  Again, this person couldn't help me either and said he'd transfer me to someone who knew more about this device.  Finally, the last person was able to get it working.  I've never had a tablet do this brand new.  He did tell me if the last effort didn't work he'd, "be comfortable sending me a new one."  Umm that's the least I'd expect.On a positive note, the apps in Kindle Freetime are great for kids and I like knowing he cannot exit Freetime without my password.  I know everything on there is educational.  I used it to watch a t.v. show on Netflix and loved how clear the picture is, etc. I don't think I'll be reading on it since I have the Paperwhite and this is like reading on an iPad, too much glare.

Reviews.Title: Lousy / missing user guide categories limits usefullness.
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bill
Reviews.Content: The device itself is fine, but the abysmal instructions are a serious limitation.  You are on your own to decipher functions that should be simple.  There is a User's Guide, though it only covers a few superficial instructions.  It does not tell you how to remove anything from your device, as one example.  It does not tell you how to organize photos into folders or view those folders, if downloaded to the device from elsewhere.The device is fine.  It just needs instructions that help you get the best from it.

Reviews.Title: A great tablet for its intended use - fair price to boot.
Reviews.Author: Stephan C Nandelstadt
Reviews.Content: The tablet is not a world changer, but it is perfect for what I need it for. Reading books with music on and looking quick stuff up is what this baby was made for. I kind of disregard the reviews that complain about the fire not being the "to do" everything the $500 plus tablets do, because this is a $140 tablet. In my case, this is a comfortable gem well worth the purchase. For anything I need more horsepower or functionality for, well I have my PC. I have not had any problems with my unit and like it very much.

Reviews.Title: 3rd Kindle
Reviews.Author: Terri Jenkins
Reviews.Content: I love it , but wondering should I have just spent the extra money for the HDX.  Just got yesterday.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HD 7"!  Fits nicely in my hands and in my purse.  I take it everywhere and find myself reaching for it all the time when I have a spare moment or two.  Kindle has done a nice job on both the visual and the audio elements and the colors are lovely. This is a very nice device for a very affordable price!

Reviews.Title: Superior Sound, Beautiful Display, Feels good in your hands.
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: I have had all the Kindles, all the Nooks, and all the Ipad's, I'm a gadget person. I thought I would play with the Fire HDX and probably send it back, but I enjoy it. The sound is the best from any device so far. I love the physical buttons. I love downloading video. Comcast does allow this on a limited basis with the Xfininty app, but the selection is smaller, and the downloads take longer. Amazon, goes the extra mile, don't forget the daily deals for books, and the free app of the day. Treat yourself, nothing wrong with having an Ipad AND Kindle,

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: barry
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle. I switched from an E-Reader to the New kindle Fire HD. I still read a lot but, needed a tablet that would do more than the E-Reader and surf the internet easily.

Reviews.Title: EXACTLY WHAT I WAS HOPING IT WOULD BE!!!!
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Webb
Reviews.Content: I am in a nursing home and wanted a tablet that would be easy to use with good graphics. I already owned a basic kindle that just had books on it and enjoyed it very much.The kindle fire HD I bought is FANTASTIC!!!! I use it every day for reading, movies, shopping and surfing the internet. I have found this product very easy to use and perfect for a nursing home environment. I have dropped it many times and it has suffered zero damage. I often cannot sleep at night so I stick in my headphones and watch movies without disturbing my roommate. The picture is as good as my HD television and the sound even through headphones is perfect. The selection of books and movies is wonderful and I have already had months of use on my Kindle Fire HD 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes Special Offers with absolutely no trouble. I highly recommend this product for anyone as it is fun, easy to use, and a lot of computer/tablet for the price. I cannot wait to see how the new generation HDX will be. This is one of the finest products I have ever owned!!!!

Reviews.Title: My child loves it!!!
Reviews.Author: Philip Lacy
Reviews.Content: I got this for my child because it does the things a seven year old child needs it to do. People who are getting this tablet for themselves and expecting it to be an iPad are setting themselves up for failure. If you'll notice on most of the pictures for this tablet, there are children movies on the screen. Its basically geared towards kids or not really needing to do more than read or play games. Its only 8gb so it cant hold very much. Its a 7 inch screen so it isn't big. Please compare the price and understand what you're paying for. Great for just basic use. All the negitive comments are from people expecting the best from the cheapest price. The same people are also upset that their Kia got beat by a Porsche. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: INCORRECT DESCRIPTION
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Miller
Reviews.Content: I purchased the kindle fire HD 8.9 because it said that you can download prime videos for offline viewing and that is incorrect as confirmed by amazon, it is ONLY the HDX that can do this.Amazon support needs to get their act together, before I purchased I called to confirm and the first person on the phone said that no devices can watch movies offline unless you purchase them.  I called again because that was not what I read on the amazon website and the second person confirmed it worked on the new HD and HDX.After getting the device and not getting any options to watch movies offline, I called a third time, and the person who answered once again said no devices can watch movies offline.  I had to show him the web page for him to help me, and then they confirmed it was a typo, only the HDX can do this.This is the link that has the typohttp://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00BHJRYYS/ref=fs_ta#entertainPrime Instant Video DownloadsNEW—Prime members can now download over half of our collection of Prime Instant Video movies and TV shows—with new titles available daily—to the all-new Kindle Fire HD and Kindle Fire HDX tablets. Watch downloaded videos anywhere—on a plane, on vacation, in the car, or wherever you don't have a wireless connection. Prime Instant Video is the only U.S. online video subscription streaming service that offers offline viewing, and it's included at no additional cost.

Reviews.Title: Not even a month
Reviews.Author: Preston Daigre
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a Christmas gift and halfway through January it won't power on. Although I contacted Amazon late at nigh about the issue, they did respond with a quick response to set up a call with their technical department to get the problem and offered a replacement if we can't fix the issue. Hopefully, all goes well. I will update the rating after the call and correction of the problem.

Reviews.Title: Died after exactly one year
Reviews.Author: John Engdahl
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire died almost exactly after one year after purchase, right after warranty expired. Amazon customer service was useless; after spending 15 min on the phone with them (mostly on hold), the rep suggested I purchase a new one. We have several iPads, iPhones and and iTouch that have worked without a hitch for 5+ years.  This level of support from Amazon makes me question my Prime membership and frequent purchases.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: we travel a lot so I read while my husband drives I had no problem with my old kindle but this new one has to much glare to be able to read out side or in the car. prefer my old one over the kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire not improved
Reviews.Author: T. Austin
Reviews.Content: Gen 2 had everything I needed.  Sleek, modern and ready to go.  The HDMI port was awesome.  I could plug into TV at home and while on travel.  Side volume and power controls were optimal positioning for me.  With the current version, no HDMI sucks.  New rear postitioning volume and power is awkward and also makes the new covers odd.  Also no camera.  I am going to return new version and get another Gen 2 from Best Buy.  Hopefully the next version will be better.

Reviews.Title: just ok
Reviews.Author: CrabbyOldguy
Reviews.Content: Bought this because the price was good, its sort of fast, has very good intergration with amazon prime, but limited apps and no access to Google play makes me wish I had bought a nexus 7 or a hd nook , or even an ipad in steadmy final word just ok, nothing special

Reviews.Title: this is why i buy from amazon
Reviews.Author: read it all
Reviews.Content: i had my kindle fire for almost a year when the screen froze up and i was unable to unlock it for use. i immediately contacted amazon (through chat) and their representative walked me through some trouble shooting. when after about five minuets we could not get it working again he said "well i'll just send you a new one. the label to return yours is in your in-box." it was that easy. amazon paid to send me a new one and to return the old one. in fact, except for the week when my first kindle was not working, the whole thing was totally hassle free. i like being able to trust that if i have a problem with amazon's produces, they will replace them with no argument and no hassle.

Reviews.Title: Can't replace battery!
Reviews.Author: sheila prescott
Reviews.Content: Designed to throw out after 1year,numerous calls to CSS.best answer was that iPad has an app for kindle so I can now read my hundreds$ of amazon downloads on my wife's 3yr old ipad (still works). Thanks?

Reviews.Title: Kept freezing up and restarting
Reviews.Author: J. Ausman
Reviews.Content: This was a new unit purchased, but on Day 2 it kept freezing on me and restarting.  I only planned to use it to consolidate and replace my physical cookbooks with kindle cookbooks.  I still think I will do this to free up room around the house, but I'm looking more at an iPad now.  I can always download the kindle app for viewing.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the Kindle Fire HD, I had expected so much more.

Reviews.Title: One-year life span is not good enough for me
Reviews.Author: globglobglob
Reviews.Content: I bought this device for my family to use and share. All was good for about a year, at which time we noticed the battery not holding its charge. Soon we had to recharge it daily for hours to get only about 30 minutes of reading time. Eventually, it wouldn't take a charge at all. We tested with other power chords and no luck. The device was dead. I called customer service who told me that since I was past the one-year warranty, that she could only offer me the "privilege" of buying a new device at just under $100. When I said I wasn't happy with that offer, the customer service rep then took down my phone number and proposed that she call me back. I never heard back from her.  This is not what I expect from the earth's most customer-obsessed retailer. I do not want to buy devices with a one-year life span. This customer is disappointed in Kindle Fire and the customer service I received.

Reviews.Title: Fire already doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Amber Curtis
Reviews.Content: My daughter bought the fire with her own money. We have had it less than a month and it won't even turn on. Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: My family has three kindle fires and I refuse to ever buy another.
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: My family has three kindle fires and I refuse to ever buy another.  My daught has owned two alone and both of them have broken due to some kind of internal problem.  The first was replaced under warranty and the replacement has now broken as well.  You can spend days just looking through all the problems they have and the frustration levels are through the roof.  She wants another and uses it for her college but I cant continue to buy these if they continue to break a book in the hands never fails or needs charging.  She just tried to get help from amazon on the latest problem and they could only offer to sell her another and had the nerve to promise her the new one would not have any problems like the others.  I asked her how she could say that and guarantee it, she could not.  My wife has one of the newest ones and when it breaks I will produce  nice you-tube video of all three being burned at the stake.  Just ridicules how these kindles  have fewer and fewer features for more and more money and still continue to break.  It's just wrong to sell products with so many of them having the same exact issues.  Much like the computer operating systems we have come to hate from that other company.

Reviews.Title: If you want to spend most of you time on Youtube, don't buy, else a good product.
Reviews.Author: Gil
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is a great tablet except for the fact sit does not have Adobe Flash installed and unable to see YOUTUBE videos.  Without the ability to see youtube and other videos I have which require Adobe flash it is almost useless for me.  I have mentioned this to several others which were going to buy one and have changed their minds.  I gave this one away and ordered a Samsung for a few bucks more with a lot move useable things.  I am aware there are ways to install Adobe flash, but right now I just want some thing which works.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: merlbert
Reviews.Content: I purchased a unit (still not finished paying for it) and it would suddenly turn completey off a week after purchase. I called Kindle and we followed all the instructions that six techs could offer. The last time the unit broke,  I was concerned as I was running out of the 30 day return window. I was told not to worry that all was documented. Fast forward two months... The same problem reappears and  I just got off the phone with supervisor (on phone for more than an hour) trying to return the unit. It was only through the grace of this supervisory rep that I could return the unit. They did not want to refund my money for this purchase! I was not offered an upgrade or anything for the hours spent on the phone trying to get the issures resolved. I would not accept the same replacement.and could not purchase an upgrade without starting over from scratch. Save yourself lots of frustration and purchase from some place else as Amazon's policies are not fair, reasonable, or sensitive to the customer's needs.

Reviews.Title: It was GREAT, for a little while.
Reviews.Author: Natalie W.
Reviews.Content: I bought My Kindle when it first came out, shortly after it STOPPED WORKING. It will NOT TURN ON. I do not know if anyone else has this problem buti HATE IT. My friends Kindle is doing the same thing also. :( very sad...

Reviews.Title: reboots all by itself.
Reviews.Author: Dave Harlan
Reviews.Content: I would NEVER recommend this item to anybody. Kindle needs to figure out what is causing these to reboot on their own. This was a gift for my wife. She could not read her books or do anything on either of the two that were sent to us. Amazon was outstanding in support but you can't fix a piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: On the fence
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had this about 2 weeks and have about 2 hours of total usage on the tablet. So far, pretty disappointed. Freezes a lot. Randomly shuts off. I was reading a book and in the course of 10 minutes it shut down 4 times and didn't save my page, finished the book on my phone with no problem. Never dealt with anything other than Apple products and went into this with an open mind, I still prefer apple software and products. I love the size of this, perfect for my 16 month old to carry around and play games/watch movies (which is what I got this for) but at this point that is the only thing this product has going for it. I will probably have to call Amazon and see what is up. I had very high expectations for this product because I find Amazon to be amazing, so all the more letdown.

Reviews.Title: Kindle's are great!
Reviews.Author: Mommy
Reviews.Content: 3rd different kindle that has been in my house.  Got myself one, got my mom one for Christmas 2 years ago, got my daughter one last Christmas.  Love them!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: me1939
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle fire. Up graded for more memory and love it..I take it with me everywhere...keeps me from getting bored since I retired.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD 7
Reviews.Author: peg sabey
Reviews.Content: Totally enjoying it! Easy to take with me.Love sharpness & being able to enlarge the words for reading.Would reccommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: HD 1 or HD 2 ?
Reviews.Author: E. Hoeft
Reviews.Content: The first generation HD has an HDMI port and a camera.  This second generation HD does not.  Amazon should list this deficiency.

Reviews.Title: An excellent device that does exactly what it's supposed to do.
Reviews.Author: John Ames
Reviews.Content: This is the least expensive of the current line-up of Fire tables, but it is just about perfect for my needs. I like the compact size; it is easy to hold one-handed for reading e-books. Only my wife's Kindle Paperwhite is handier.The Amazon apps store has a good selection and it is easy to side-load apps like Firefox that aren't available from Amazon. Overall, though, I find the included Silk browser and the e-mail app to be sufficient for my uses.Amazon's handling of books, music, and videos is elegant, simple, and flexible. I like that the content "lives" on Amazon's servers and the tablet can download and what I'm reading right now and keep the rest on the cloud. This is especially important with the 8 GB model. The memory can fill quickly, so Amazon's method of managing it is very helpful.The Kindle Free Time app is great! My two sons each have their own profile. I have in-app purchasing turned off system-wide, but I believe that's the default for Free Time. I have run into a few apps for children that do not work well with Free Time -- the screen flipping upside down is the most common problem, but locking rotation before going into the Free Time environment seems to help. I've noticed that for some apps, when I load them into Free Time, they seem to download and install separately, so I end up with three copies of a particular app -- one for me and one each for the boys. Again, be careful about memory usage.Videos and movies look great on the screen, and the sound is very good. I use a program called Handbrake on my desktop computer to rip DVD movies to a digital format, copy the digital file to the Kindle with the USB cable, and then use the VLC+ app to view the movies. Feature-length movies usually come in at 750 MB to 1 GB, so two or so are easy to store and view.I wish this model came with a camera, but overall it's an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: Not Just a Page-Turner
Reviews.Author: K. Madden
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my Kindle Fire HD. Does a lot more than I thought it could.Three things need improvement:Needs Flash to be fully Web functionalNeeds a USB port to supplant Cloud storageNeeds cloud, mail, and Web connectivity everywhere, not just in hot spots

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Lorac
Reviews.Content: Perfect gift for my elderly father.  He loves it.  Wasn't sure if he would like to read off it instead of a book but found it easy to turn pages and to read on.  One of the best gifts of late

Reviews.Title: Love it :)
Reviews.Author: Hillargh
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a bit concerned about getting a defective Kindle Fire HD. Mine is fine. I imagine the packaging may have contributed to any defective or damaged ones, as it is most certainly not protected against rough handling in transit. I really enjoy it, it's not too slow or bogged down even with the special offers, the picture quality is good, and it handles everything I need it to. Great battery life, even when I have a million things running, unless I have the brightness at full and then it drains it more quickly. But, even then, it's not bad battery life by far (several hours on brightest - 8ish -, even more on lower - 10ish -). The only down side, really, is that you're limited to the amazon app store, which has far fewer apps than the google store, but seeing as how this is an amazon device, it's expected. I also find the charging port a bit wonky, the angle is odd, but that's really just a preference thing. Overall, I would recommend this to others :)For those confused about the camera option: This does NOT have a camera at all; front or back. Check the product description carefully. If you're looking for one WITH a camera, do NOT get the 7" Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: get you one
Reviews.Author: Steve Blakely
Reviews.Content: My wife is using it now. I am writing this review, and she is using it now! HEY! PUT THAT DOWN! she won't do it. She won't put it down. don't buy this cause you won't put it down. It works too good.

Reviews.Title: MISTAKENED
Reviews.Author: NyujiBaby "<3 Mi"
Reviews.Content: WHEN I FIRST SAW THIS TABLET I THOUGHT I WAS TRULY GETTING SOMETHING AWESOME. THE FEATURES AVAILABLE AND THE QUALITY OF PICTURES/VIDEO GOT ME.  SADLY, IT DIDN'T TAKE LONG FOR THINGS TO GO BAD FOR ME. THE TABLET SCREWING UP, PRIME VIDEOS NOT PLAYING, AND KINDLE/AMAZON'S INABILITY TO BE REMOTELY HELPFUL -- THAT WAS IT. I REALIZED I'D MADE A MISTAKE BOTHERING WITH IT. I WILL SAY THIS, THEY'VE DONE A GREAT JOB ADVERTISING FOR, SAY, SAMSUNG OR APPLE?

Reviews.Title: Keeps on shutting off
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle HD 7" with 16 GB, the first one was replaced by customer service because it kept on shutting off in the middle of web browsing, checking e mails, listening to music.  I think there is a problem with the actual on and off switch I am not sure. Customer service is great, they do  replace the unit if it is under warranty which this one still is but it is very frustrating to have to engage with them again and walk through the whole process of explaining what is going on. If it wasn't because of Amazon's great book content for Kindle and the benefits of Prime membership I would probably just give it up and get a different tablet.

Reviews.Title: Amazon fail
Reviews.Author: isableandaking
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this, I didn't. It's very much limited to what it can do, the google app store is non-existent. I got a nexus 7 and it's leaps and bounds beyond this. I get what Amazon is trying to do with these devices, but I think it's very much limited in their vision, maybe in the future updates they will fix all these restrictions plaguing this device. It definitely needs a root-ing/jailbreaking, which I tried to do myself and instead got it bricked. I haven't had time to try to restore it, since it's very frustrating to work with, maybe when I jailbreak it successfully I'll update the score here.

Reviews.Title: Can't see outside
Reviews.Author: Beverly Miles
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed that i could not read the Kindle Fire HD outside. I just assumed if my kindle keyboard would work outside my Kindle fire was an update so i should be able to do the same with it. Everything else is great.

Reviews.Title: Wow, this is for me!!!
Reviews.Author: Mrs. Pauline Dow
Reviews.Content: I have a samsung galaxy that I still can't work. Of course I never read the book. This Kindle fire is great, it does the work for you. I am a senior citizen who just likes something simple and easy to understand. I love it. I watched movies all last evening.

Reviews.Title: Nice device but not 5 stars.
Reviews.Author: Tough critic
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet device and I enjoy it very much, even though I don't use its full potential. I mostly use it to read books; although, occasionally I'll give in to temptation and shop on Amazon. It's fairly easy to use, the display is clear and the colors vibrant. The negatives are: 1) there is a lot of glare from the screen unless you're in a dimly lit place; 2) the battery runs down quickly if you leave it in standby mode. It's best to power off completely but then powering up seems time consuming when you just want to pick it up & read. 3) borrowing library books is a cumbersome process but understandable since Amazon prefers that you purchase books from them instead.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Christine Baril
Reviews.Content: i bought the original kindle about 3 years ago or when ever they came out and i loved it.  i used it every day.I love to read and this is so much easier to hold than a book.  I bought the new kindle fire HD because the old one would not charge anymore.  I love this one as well.  you can get a free book a month with Prime and there are so many books to choose from. If you like to read this is the way to go.  on Sundays when the weather is nice i will go out on the deck and read.  Sometimes it is tough to see the screen in the sun but i think that should be kept in mind when they come out with another one.  I would love to take this down to the beach.I would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: Sent it back
Reviews.Author: SB
Reviews.Content: This is nothing compared to the iPad.  It was far more difficult to use and a bit more complicated IMO.  While I love my Kindle, I do not like the Fire.

Reviews.Title: Didn't think the Kindle could get any better!
Reviews.Author: Alison
Reviews.Content: It really is incredible. There's so much I love about it, and I thought the paper white kindle was amazing! I am in love with the Kindle Fire! It is heavier than the original, but with the back lighting and all other features... I love it.

Reviews.Title: Loooove it!!!!!�
Reviews.Author: Gwendolyn Ivanac
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with my Kindle Fire HD. It does so much more than just reading books. I have had two tablets before my kindle and they turned out to be disasters but amazon made it so easy for me and also refunded my money. If ur looking for a tablet that has games, surfing the web, reading.this is the one. Oh yeah the graphics r great. Thank u Amazon and Kindle

Reviews.Title: Fast booting, reliable, great apps, features and perfect touch screen.
Reviews.Author: Greg S Meyer
Reviews.Content: My son and his thoughtful wife got this for me as a gift.  I was looking at them online and couldn't seem to pull the trigger for fear that I would get a $100+ useless paper weight.  This device has been my constant window to books and information when doing mindless tasks at my night shift blue collar job- now I'm laughing at a clever comedy video or learning something from a TED talk.One of the neat features is the very pleasant audio reader voice that seems to work with every kindle book I have picked.  If I'm wide awake it's natural sounding enough to not distract.  Then if I have trouble sleeping, just turn the volume down to barely audible, hit the on/off button once and the screen goes dark while the audio keeps going. ZZZIn fact, there's no component from the frustration free packaging to the excellent touch screen keyboard that could be any better designed.I feel lucky to own this intuitive little tablet.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: After about 2 months of ownership there are multiple technical issues.  I am not a techie so dealing with them is a headache.  My iPad, while more expensive has had no technical issues at all, ever and it is a first generation.  If I had not had the technical issues with the kindle I owuld have given it  4.5 stars.  It does everything I need except play all videos, there are some videos I have not been able to get it to play.  You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Better
Reviews.Author: Ann H. Sanger "Nanny"
Reviews.Content: We have the original Kindle Fire. This one is lighter weight, more screen area, faster, and better games. I like text to speech.

Reviews.Title: Kindle the best purchase you can make.
Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: I previously had a tablet and was not very happy with it. Now I have my Kindle and LOVE it. I don't go anywhere without it. Even if you are stuck somewhere with no wi-fi you can still read your books that have been sent. It is the device for everything. The best purchase I have ever made.

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle
Reviews.Author: Pitzy
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I asked for. No complaints. I might add a camera and voice activation....I also recommend a stylus for typing

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Jacquelyn Hebert
Reviews.Content: Easy to take anywhere. I can read books, check email, go to my computer homepage, play games and so much more-all in color. The price was excellent and this Kindle meets or exceeds what I was expecting from it. Quite a bargain in a small package!

Reviews.Title: I recommend this kindle.
Reviews.Author: Linda Renk
Reviews.Content: The first kindle I received had a problem but one call and a new one was on the way.  Within two days I had a new one, transferred files and was up and running.  The one problem I had was resolved with one phone call and an American speaking tech who was so nice he even called the following day to be sure the problem was resolved.  That was three weeks ago and the kindle has worked like a charm.  It is easy to use, works much better than I had hopes of and is easy to use in doors and outside.  It is easy to carry, quick to start up and has a bright, clear screen.  I could not have wanted more.

Reviews.Title: Great for my daughter
Reviews.Author: Juan Pineiro
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my daughter (9) and the KF 7" has met all my expectations. Ideal for Netflix, reading books and playing some educational apps. She can also check her e-mail in a safe way. Oh, and don't forget listening to music. The perfect deal for a  9-year-old girl.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Michael Rose
Reviews.Content: This kindle worked out perfect do my son he uses it almost every day for several activities. Awesome product. Fun

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle
Reviews.Author: fpc64
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle.  The first one is still going strong but the kids wanted it to use so I got myself an updated version.  It is the only tablet I would buy.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: bart
Reviews.Content: got it  its  great  wife  loves now  that  she  figured  out  how  to  use  it  lol easy  to  use has  many  books  already

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: C. Brown
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it don't go anywhere without it. Easy to use and personalized when  got it. I should have got one a long time ago.

Reviews.Title: like it but having problems
Reviews.Author: david l King
Reviews.Content: I like the price ,like the convenance,but having problems with it turning off every 3 min sometime ,going to try holding differant .I have it in case to protect

Reviews.Title: didn't work for me
Reviews.Author: Kathy Halloran
Reviews.Content: It was a defective product and 'broke' exactly 30 days from receipt. Fortunately they give you a few days to mail the return so I'm hoping it gets there in time. I'm not sure I'm goiing to purchase a new one for fear that I get another defective product, but don't realize it until after 30 days.

Reviews.Title: Keeps freezing and rebooting on it's own.
Reviews.Author: Sharon A. Bunting
Reviews.Content: I really love this device while it works, and it's frustrating when it shuts off while I am in the middle of reading something.  I bought this device do I didn't have to be on the computer just to hang out, since I work on a computer.  Amazon customer service is wonderful, they are sending me a new replacement Kindle and I really hope it works, because if it doesn't I will need to return my entire order for a full refund.  I advised the rep that I already tried the hard reset, holding down the power off/on button, but the device keeps powering off randomly.  I didn't store anything on the device to say it's a memory issue. I am praying I get a device that works without any issues.********updated******3/27/2014*******I received my replacement kindle and it's working great!

Reviews.Title: Weak
Reviews.Author: ltlgrmln
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great for reading and watching Netflix, but they have apparently dropped all support or updates for it. Consider the tablet abandonware. I've had it for three months and I haven't seen a single software update. It's like Amazon doesn't realize that to have a good piece of hardware, you need to update, patch problems, and continuously improve the device. I have continuously had problems with the Wi-Fi connection and Apps not even displaying icons. There is a way to fix it -- resetting to factory defaults. This means that I have to spend a few hours re-downloading and setting up the tablet that I'm just tired of doing for the third time. It would be trivial that the APPS DON'T EVEN DISPLAY ICONS, but the books don't display covers, and I CAN'T EVEN TELL WHAT THEY ARE WITHOUT OPENING THEM, BECAUSE THEY DON'T HAVE THE TITLE UNDER THEM. I apologize for yelling, but there is honestly no excuse for an overlooked detail such as this, especially on an "E-READER." People have been having this simple problem since 2012. Two years later, nothing is updated.Consider this tablet abandonware -- go with a different company. Maybe try an actual hardware company that cares about supporting their product.

Reviews.Title: need page numbers
Reviews.Author: Marcyann
Reviews.Content: Picture is great....miss page numbers.  Doesn't always open to where I left off.  Needs easier access to page adjust ment.  Also needs instructions enclosed with unit to get full use of it.

Reviews.Title: Llllllllooooooovvvvvvveeeeeee iiiiiitttttt
Reviews.Author: Tonya
Reviews.Content: I had promised myself for two years that I would get an e-reader in the end I got kindle fire and I find it hard to put it down love being able to watch movies, read books, and play games all for one device. You can do anything on this and I love it...

Reviews.Title: New
Reviews.Author: fulltime mom
Reviews.Content: Still getting used to this new version. I went ahead and ordered the otter box  for this one and I will say that I am glad I did as my kids seem to love the fact no that my kindle "looks like it is wearing a battle suit" So far I am loving everything about it I just wished I opted for the top memory that would have been helpful when downloading HD movies. lol I guess I will know better when the next upgrade comes out.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: VICIOUSJ   (Jessica) "~J.ACOSTA~"
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle fire HD. It is the perfect size to fit in my purse and take with me on the go. It has awesome picture and looks amazing. If your a electronics junkie like myself this will feed your craving. Just to let you know this one doesn't have the camera.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 2 months
Reviews.Author: Karla
Reviews.Content: We have an older Kindle Fire that is very durable and is still going strong after 3 years. I bought this Kindle Fire HD for my son for Christmas. We noticed that the new tablet is not as durable and feels cheap. After 30 days the Kindle Fire would not work unless it was plugged into an outlet. Yesterday (2 months after purchase) the screen went black. We tried charging the Kindle Fire HD overnight and this morning it will not turn on. I am extremely disappointed in the quality of this Kindle.

Reviews.Title: I was just that one Kindle that I was Very disappointed.
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: UPDATE - I decided to exchange the Kindle for a new one. So far, I have no problems and like my Kindle. I have changed my mind and will give more stars.Screen froze and then it rebooted itself, three times within 5 minutes. I reset the factory setting because they say I may have downloaded a bad app. When powering up, it froze again and I had to hold down the power button to get it to turn off.Now I don't trust the Kindle. I was so excited to receive this and start using it. Returning for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy if you like or use Google apps!
Reviews.Author: Matthew D.
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire does not have any availability for Google apps. Everything on the Kindle Fire only supports Amazon's "play store". The Kindle Fire has tons of features to advertise Amazon's company. I do not like the response time of the Kindle Fire. Also for some reason, when you go to play a video from YouTube on their "silk" web explorer the video almost always seems to be in poor quality. Because of this, the Dolby speakers are not being used at their full potential. The one thing that really wowed me was the Dolby speakers. This first time I heard them, I was literally said "Wow!". All in all, if you want to mostly use Amazon's support system for their books and videos go ahead and buy this. If not stay away, and buy a tablet that doesn't restrict you to its own support system. I have two stars only for the awesomeness of the Dolby speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great little gadget.
Reviews.Author: Kim McConville
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it.  She loves to read and uses it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing.
Reviews.Author: polkadot zombie
Reviews.Content: If I could return my Kindle Fire HD for my original Kindle Fire, I would.  I have  had several generations of Kindle and this one has the most errors and user issues of them all.  This one is just disappointing. YouTube is virtually impossible to use.  I can't get through a 15 minute video without it erroring out.  And after it errors, NOTHING works.  Not Facebook, interest, silk web browser, nothing.  So you have  to restart your Kindle.  I have tried all the different fixes from Kindle user forums, Kindle support is no help, and I have yet to find a decent app to fix this problem.  I have also never been able to get all my books to transfer over from my old Kindle.  Again, Kindle support was no help.  I finally just gave up.  I am really disappointed in this incarnation of Kindle.  After being a die hard Kindle user and recommending them to everyone, at this point, the next tablet I buy will probably not be a Kindle.

Reviews.Title: excellent!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: nancy peaslee
Reviews.Content: Best tablet on the market. I recommend this to anyone that wants a quality tablet. Never freezes and I have owned others that don't even compare.

Reviews.Title: Bought for Kindle FreeTime for kids. Don't bother.
Reviews.Author: David D. Caldwell
Reviews.Content: We brought these for our twin girls who are 3 and our youngest son who is 4 with the sole intention of using the Kindle Freetime app. Big mistake. Calling the app unstable would be an understatement. Crashes are common if you are in the FreeTime OS overlay, keeping it plugged in at all times helps a little. Even at 100% power it must be plugged in or it crashes. This was supposed to be our kids main gift for Christmas and they are unused sitting on the shelf because they got tired of it never working.Outside of the FreeTime app it is just a generic low end budget tablet. Nothing special, slow, sluggish compared to a decent tablet. Kindle Store apps are always behind their REAL counterparts, sometimes it is as little as a week, but so far most apps are behind by a month, some more than that, and others have abandoned wasting their time with the Amazon store all together and you are stuck with an old dated version.Save your frustration and get a real Android tablet. Out of all the tablets that I have seen and used this is by far the worst, with the sole exception of a $60 android knockoff which was about equal in terms of performance.

Reviews.Title: silk browser on is horrible , keeps crashing randomly , seems like a amazon prime video is only thing that works ?
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Christlieb
Reviews.Content: Side buttons are way too similar in shape , cant seem to charge it with solar power panels I have , but I end up using my ipod touch over this unit , the browser doesn't crash like silk and their no product ads when you power it up , don't like seeing adds when I power up side the open home thing.The screen and look of the unit is great along with the quality of the videos in hd ..they fix the issues maybe ill buy one again in 5 years lol

Reviews.Title: The on-going revolution...
Reviews.Author: John P. Jones III
Reviews.Content: As I post this review, I note that there are already 4,000 plus reviews, less than 10% in the one-star category. A testimony in itself. I recently purchased this Kindle model after the "Black Monday" madness, and have had a month to evaluate it. Overall, I am exceedingly pleased.As advertised, Kindle Fire can be used for a variety of purposes, including watching movies and listening to music. I have an older Kindle (with the small keyboard), that works just fine for reading books, which I still consider as its primary usage. So why upgrade?  The touch screen, the color, the HD for the pictures, and the ease with which a display can be changed from vertical to horizontal mode are all significant improvements. As an additional plus, I found this Wi-Fi enabled device handy for connecting to the web, and the Silk browser, developed especially for the Kindle, to be easy to use for accessing email... and even ordering more products from Amazon!In addition to the Kindle itself, it really is strongly advisable to purchase a cover for it. Fortunately, I am a member of the Vine program, and had the sturdy protection of a Belkin Chambray Cover for Kindle Fire HDX (will only fit Kindle Fire HDX 7"), Blacktop provided to me for review purposes, and my 5-star review of it is posted. I still love reading books the old-fashioned way, turning the pages in hand, and consider a room without a bookcase ill-furnished. But it is hard to beat the very handy storage and ready reference that the Kindle facilitates. For viewing books with pictures, particularly art books, I'd go with the larger Kindle HD 8.9". But for travel, particularly backpacking, say from town-to-town, so that the Kindle can be kept charged, this is the model I would go with.I consider myself "tech-savvy," but on the other hand, I must see a clear purpose for the latest "gadget" before I purchase it. For example, when relatively cheap, hand-held GPS devices became commercially available in the mid-90's, and I was often travelling in "unmapped territories," I immediately understood its utility and purchased one, and it did revolutionize my ability to travel in the desert safely. Likewise with the Kindle series of products. In terms of storage of books, and portability, it is revolutionary. So too is the cost of obtaining information. Books can now be obtained for 60-70-80% off the cost of a print version. Although I am long-past college age, I have been appalled at the ridiculous high-cost - actually a "racket" - that are college textbooks, and I note that Kindle goes a long way to helping students "break" this racket. Finally, there is the sheer speed by which an author can complete a work, and convey it to concerned readers, without the one to three year delay so often associated with the traditional publishing industry, with its host of "agents," et al. And Amazon even makes sure the author is paid honestly, and on a timely basis. Like the GPS, a Kindle is essential. 5-stars.

Reviews.Title: Not reliable
Reviews.Author: Lynne Eddy
Reviews.Content: I bought this this past summer (2013) and it freezes up and won't respond to a hard reset.  Really disappointed.I have a NOOK and have never had a problem with it and I've had it for 2 years.  It even got run over buy a car and it still works!Should have stuck with the NOOK product line.

Reviews.Title: Can't Beat the Kindle!
Reviews.Author: W. Adams
Reviews.Content: I already have two kindles (paperwhite and fire), so when my seven (7) year old wanted a tablet at Christmas, I immediately bought him one as well.  And boy does he love it.Now, I realize some people dislike the amazon software, but for prime members like my family, the software really simplifies things.  When my son wants to watch a movie, he just goes to the home screen and selects videos.  If he wants to download a children's book, he goes to the home page and selects books and picks one.  Same thing for apps.  Plus, the parental controls are easily accessible for me and my wife, and we can prohibit certain content.  Easy for him and easy for us.For those people who adore their ipads (my oldest son is an apple junkie) and rave about their unbeatable speed and refinement, I understand your sentiment.  However, for the price paid and the features, I personally prefer kindle fire hd.  Fires look great, work great for what my family uses them for (books, video, apps, and web), cost a lot less, and have enough choices in the app store to keep us all happy.  (I do agree more apps are needed however for those who adore the immensity of the android market.)All in all, the kindle fire is well worth a buy.

Reviews.Title: Serious lack of useful apps
Reviews.Author: jerrid
Reviews.Content: I have had this product for a year now and can say it runs smoothly but has some aggravating flaws. I do a lot of shopping  online and find amazon has excluded competitors apps like best buy, home depot, and Wal-Mart from the app store. Also, a lot of apps an adult might use for entertainment simply aren't offered like You Tube, Directv anywhere, Nbc or Fox to name a few. I continuously find myself searching the app store for various items and end up disappointed. It seems a lot of the apps offered are games aimed at children. Lastly, I have found Adobe flash player is not compatible with kindle and the "experimental" flash player the kindle uses is a headache. As was typing this review using the kindle.

Reviews.Title: Amazon fails to disclose the major publications don't support the text view version of Newsstand
Reviews.Author: T. Verhaegen
Reviews.Content: I already had an Kindle e-reader.  I purchased the Kindle Fire for the huge selections of magazines.  The glossy digital brochures say the Kindle newsstand has a "text-only" feature (you double tap the middle of the screen)  so one can read the Kindle articles. Without the text-only feature, the texts are FAR TOO SMALL to read.  Amazon says paraphrased "most publications support the text-only function."  The truth is most publications DO NOT SUPPORT the text-only feature.  I downloaded Time, People, Entertainment Weekly and Rolling Stone.  ONLY Rolling Stone had the text only feature -which worked fantastic.  Time, People and Entertainment Weekly do not support the text only.  The photos are nice but if you want to READ the articles, the fonts are about 1.5  - seriously.  I emailed Amazon about the issue.  I asked for a list of magazines that DO SUPPORT the text only version.  They sent a form letter saying to contact the publications and if no luck with them - to contact Amazon again.Hence you're left with subscribing with a magazine - checking to see if its text - only supported - then cancelling your subscription.  All this because Amazon wishes to keep this information secret.

Reviews.Title: JUNK JUNK JUNK
Reviews.Author: Rob_B
Reviews.Content: There is a reason they offer live customer support... because you'll need it!  Constant issues with internet connectivity.  Despite perfectly functioning WiFi this device struggles or won't connect to the internet.When I contacted support about this they just continued to have me perform a reset on the device.also...VERY IMPORTANT.... the "10 hour battery life" is more like 2 if you are lucky.  I would leave a 100% charged device in the morning on hibernate and come home to find it on 10%!!!No internet, bad battery.  Buyer beware!  I've had my device 6 days.... I'm returning it for a refund!

Reviews.Title: Bought 2 Defective Kindles! So Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Katie Hale
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 kindles for my kids for Christmas.  After 2 days of use, BOTH Kindles started defecting.  Volume would just stop working while they were watching videos or playing apps.  Or the Kindle would freeze. Neither would keep a battery charge very long (Kindle claims 10 hour batter life... we never got close to that). After the 3rd day of use, one of the Kindles claimed that we were out of storage.  We bought the 8 GB and we barely downloaded any apps or videos-- I was shocked.  After 7th day of use, one of our Kindles just completely stopped working-- wouldn't turn on despite a full charge.I chose to go with Kindle Fire HD because I love/trust Amazon and it seemed cheaper (more reasonable) to buy it for my kids than to spend 2x as much on an iPad Mini for children.  Despite my frustration with the Kindles, I did have a wonderful experience with their customer service.  They were very understanding and helpful.  They offered to replace both kindles but I just don't trust these devices anymore so I opted to have them returned and refunded.  I know the Kindles work for many people but not in this family. I hope you have better luck if you decided to go this route.

Reviews.Title: Not the same
Reviews.Author: Ginger Mull
Reviews.Content: This kindle is different from the one I purchased last year despite them being called the same thing,  it does not maintain wireless connection and is also very slow to load any app

Reviews.Title: This will not let you watch it on TV!
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: I received this as a gift with the hopes of attaching a cable and watching TV with this. I bought the first Kindle Fire last year as a gift and they can attach and HDMI cable and watch movies but the "All new 2013 Kindle HD" (not HDX) can NOT do this. So an OLDER version can do this but the NEW one can't? I just spent 40 minutes on line with Amazon and got a complete run around because even their customer service agents are confused on what this product does. I was told last week that I needed a cable so I bought 2 different ones that were recommended by Amazon's customer service personally... both failed and today I was told after being transferred 3 times that it won't "mirror' anything. Highly frustrating that a brand new version is sub par to the old version!  Advice to Amazon: You may want to put that in the description to prevent other from the run around I had. Also, educate you agents so they know that as well.

Reviews.Title: In CASE your searching for a case for your Kindle!
Reviews.Author: lori gillen
Reviews.Content: I received this item for Xmas 2013.  I went on to www.amazon.com and purchased the wrong case because I didn't know I had the 2013 Kindle Fire HD model.  If you don't have a case for this kindle check out the following link (they also have photos of the back of the kindles so you are certain to make the correct purchase. B00FFWJ2HAThe item is the Fintie Amazon All New Kindle Fire HD 7" Slim Fit Folio Case with Auto Sleep / Wake Feature (will only fit All New Kindle Fire HD 7 2013 Model).

Reviews.Title: Very limited use
Reviews.Author: will
Reviews.Content: Was disappointed that nothing could be added that wasn't bought from amazon. Free apps excluded, would not allow downloads from pc, not compatible with any card swipe apps. just very disappointed

Reviews.Title: Perfect for bringing my mom into the Internet age
Reviews.Author: Aldona Birmantas "Aldona"
Reviews.Content: I decided it was time to bring my 76-year-old mom into the internet age. She's never used a computer, or the internet, and I asked a lot of folks what would be the best "learner" computer I could get her. Many people said Kindle Fire, and after some research, I decided to purchase it for her.Today is Christmas day, and she finally got her gift. She LOVES it. And she really loves games and has already set her sights on Candy Crush Saga (oy, lol). She enjoys it though and it was really easy to get it set up. It's also easy for her to use, even with her really bad arthritis - that was something else I had to consider.For anyone looking for a "beginner" type computer, I highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Beverly Sims "granimal"
Reviews.Content: Wish I had bought this instead of a Touch as I originally did.  But, since my spouse uses it only to read, he is inheriting that one and I will simply keep this baby.  Merry Christmas

Reviews.Title: Content is still King
Reviews.Author: Blaine A. Edwards "Blaine Edwards"
Reviews.Content: We have become Amazon content subscribers (Movies, Books, etc.) over the years because of the devices that Amazon can be used on (Roku, Wii, etc.).  We have an IPad and you can download movies from Amazon onto the IPad, which works great for us.  We were looking for a tablet for the kids and came across the Kindle Fire HD.  After getting it setup, I can say I am impressed with what you get for the price.First things first, it isn't an IPad, but it is pretty good.  You don't have access to all the apps that IPad has but what it lacks in apps it fully makes up for in extra content.  You get immersed in everything that Amazon has.  Since we are Prime members (something I highly recommend getting), we can download Prime movies and TV shows right to the Kindle Fire at no extra charge (something you can't do with Netflix).  Prime has a very large library, especially for kids.The next thing that I found great is the size of the downloaded movies.  An HD movie takes just over a 1/2 GB of memory and a SD takes just under a 1/2 GB.  You get the option of the amount of quality.  If you want the full HD, you can download it.  If you want to cram as many movies on it as you can for traveling for your kids, you can do that too.  After downloading three movies and an episode of "Bubble Guppies" for our kids we still had about 10GB of memory left on a 16GB tablet.  You can't do that with an IPad.The Free Time settings are awesome.  You setup accounts for your kids and set what content they view or play with (apps, movies, books, etc.) and then put the device in Free Time mode and it is password locked.  You can setup an account for each kid.  On top of Free Time, you can subscribe to Free Time Unlimited which is additional access to books, movies and apps.  We are doing the trial right now and see how much our kids use it.  I will give an update later.With Kindle Fire, you can share books and be a part of the lender's club which includes some pretty good titles (Harry Potter, Hunger, etc.).Lastly, all the major stuff that you use an IPad for, you can do on the Kindle Fire HD.Are right time for complaints.  It is a little more sluggish than the IPad when opening up a new App, but not enough for me to care. There isn't any sluggishness when it comes to playing games or scrolling.Next, I wish they had Google services.  Not going to happen.  It has its own browser called Silk, which isn't bad but it isn't Chrome.No camera, or GPS.All together, if you have a mobile phone that does GPS, or acts as a camera, this is the device you have been searching for.

Reviews.Title: Worst customer service ever!
Reviews.Author: VALERIE MILLER
Reviews.Content: I purchased this kindle for my husband for Christmas because he enjoys reading books on my Nook tablet. It arrived on Dec. 5th and I kept it hidden and unopened until Dec. 17th. I wanted to have it charged and ready to use for Christmas morning so I took it out and turned it on. Immediately it began to flicker, it worked for about 1 minute then went blank with lines running through it. I turned it off and on a couple of times but the lines remained. A quick call to Amazon and they transferred me to Kindle. They said they would ship out another one immediately and email a return label. When I checked my credit card they charged me again for the replacement kindle and $13 for shipping! Another call to Kindle and they stated that I may have dropped the 1st unit and damaged it so they may not refund my money.... I informed them that I had not dropped it, I had just taken it out of the box for the 1st time! I am very disappointed in the treatment I have received. After losing control of my temper and my blood pressure flying off the charts I finally got them to remove the fee for the replacement unit. The new one arrived promptly and I tested it for a few minutes before wrapping it. I guess we'll see if it holds up when I give it to him on Christmas day. I will never order from Kindle again. I have never had an issue with my Nook and would totally recommend it over the Kindle fire.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Cris Smith
Reviews.Content: This is a great reader!  You have the option of using it for watching movies or tv shows through the available apps.  For the price this is very versatile!

Reviews.Title: best gift
Reviews.Author: meema
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my husband 2 months ago he has not put it down. He had an ereader but was not computer literate enough to be able to download. he has a net book but was too confusing for him as typing was too hard. now we download the apps and got prime he loves it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn Duncan
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle fire HD but I need to take the time to learn how to work it better.

Reviews.Title: Great Apps!!!
Reviews.Author: Lesa A DeSantis
Reviews.Content: OI love my Kindle Fire HD. I already have the original Kindle, but wanted something that was easier to use at night. What I didn't expect were all of the great apps that you can download. I am using it constantly.

Reviews.Title: Never received
Reviews.Author: bernard simard
Reviews.Content: I would love it if I had it, you claim I received it but I did not and now I have to seach to get to you to settle this mess.It , as you figure a Christmas gift, So it will be late, thanks.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB - Includes Special Offers
Reviews.Author: Bruno F. Smid
Reviews.Content: This Kindle version replaces my older 7" (non-HD, no camera) Kindle Fire version, which I enjoyed very much for nearly 2 years. I upgraded to the thinner, faster Kindle Fire 7" HS, with an optional upgrade to 32 GB. During two months of use, I have added many useful apps, and am enjoying the greater speed and flexibility of this Kindle version. Although I still use a hi-speed Desktop at home, the Kindle serves as a portable at home device for such apps as email, books, games (love word games) Google Earth and Maps. In addition, I find this Kindle the perfect travel companion  replacing the larger and much bulkier laptop or notebook. It is light, takes little space, and gives me all I need while on the road. Since I only use a basic wireless prepaid phone (none of the high tech phones available today), the Kindle is a very happy compromise. I love books - and here my Kindle stands out, providing a service that neither desktops nor cell phones can offer. In short, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Nicer than a laptop for books and videos
Reviews.Author: Frickmom
Reviews.Content: Nice to be able to go online with something smaller than my laptop and also read books on it.  I didn't give it 5 stars because I still have problems with the game "Words with Friends" which is one of the reasons I upgraded to this from a Kindle e-reader. I know the problem is with Zynga and it's a shame they don't have any customer service . Thankfully, Amazon has awesome customer service because I'm technically challenged and it took me awhile and many questions on the forum to understand this thing. I'm sure it does a lot more than I use but will eventually find what else I can do with it.  But it sure beats dragging books home from the library and it's easy to travel with.

Reviews.Title: Incredible
Reviews.Author: Kayla
