Reviews.Author: Cara Case
Reviews.Content: What a great tablet for the price. I did my research and compared several different tablets and for what I needed (mainly the reading part, e-mail, videos) this was the biggest bang for your buck. I love how simple it is to use. It was very easy to set up and get going and the Kindle support is great. Definitely won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY KINDLE
Reviews.Author: specialbutterfly
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD.  I am learning as I go, but so far so good.  I wish that I had gotten one before now.  Thank you Amazon for Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: jkwbwca
Reviews.Content: Tablet does what I need it to. Great for watching movies, reading books, and magazines look spectacular. Ive read some reviews complaining of the adds on home screen under carousel..there is an option to turn these off under device settings. Add that shows when device is turned on doesnt bother me at all. I user the Flixster app for a UV movie and it worked great. I have tried the new nexus 7 and for the price this works just as well for me, I like the volume and power button locations much better on the kindle and l dont need a tablet camera. Screen does pick up fingerprints easy. Overall I like it and feel good by spending only $139 vs $229 or $269 for same entertainment value.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Karen Griggs
Reviews.Content: I love, love, love it!It is so easy to read on.It is a must have for any book lover!

Reviews.Title: Pretty much what I had in mind...
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Bird
Reviews.Content: Having owned this for less than 48 hours, I already feel right at home with most features (and believe me I'm not terribly digital-literate).  My 1st Generation Kindle Fire had grown clunky and seemingly unable to run many of my favorite apps reliably, then the YouTube App just died and no amount of coaxing would fix it, so I opted for the dumbed down version of the former Fire HD 7" (feels the a slimmed-down budget version of the earlier Fire HD 7", which my wife loves and uses constantly).Likes:* Price (they took out the features I don't need and left mostly good stuff)* Video Clarity (Impressive)* Sound (outstanding for my purposes)* Excellent Reliability on Net* Seemingly seamless integration of former favorites and proclivities.* Excellent table of contents on "printed" materialMakes me say Huh?* Where are the search features in Apps Store and Prime-Videos* Still screws up many PDFs sent through Kindle-Convert* Silk Browser is pretty good, but harder to find user-tweakable features.Would I buy another - sure, but hope I don't have to for a couple of years!UPDATE: 12/10/13 -- Kindle remains solid for Amazon products and most apps, and the screen presentation is commendable.  The truly frustrating thing is its inability to reliably play YouTube.  YouTube seems to update its "flash" mechanism from time to time and all my other wireless devices seem to transition right along with it -- I'm in yet again in another Kindle "update-window" where YouTube will not play, which is maddening because I have grown to rely on it for its many DIY presentations.Come on Amazon, let's quit with the fake-flash already, and get the real-deal!

Reviews.Title: Good Budget Tablet & Perfect for Parents
Reviews.Author: Zachary Long "Wedding Photographer"
Reviews.Content: We are owners of the original iPad and currently the iPad 3 (New iPad), so the review is comparing what we are used to (iOS) to the new Kindle Fire HD. When I saw the banner on Amazon.com announcing the new tablet at the new price, I figured it couldn't hurt to give the Kindle a try as a secondary tablet for our son (2.5 yrs old). We were most drawn to the new Amazon FreeTime Unlimited feature and also liked the smaller form compared to our full size iPad 3.My first impression of the Kindle is that it just isn't as "snappy" as iOS. In iOS, clicking on an app immediately launches it and it's very easy to exit out with a click of the home button. In the Kindle, I've had apps crash on loading or take a few clicks to launch. It just doesn't feel as responsive as the iPad at all. Also, closing an app involves swiping to open the menu and clicking home. Not the biggest deal, but for our 2.5 year old the iPad is much more intuitive and doesn't lag when pressing the home button to quit an app.While that is what I dislike about the experience, overall the purchase is a solid one. For the price, this can't be beat at less than half the price of an iPad mini which is the same size screen. The screen and form factor is great. It doesn't have that iPad metallic slickness but feels more like a gadget and is easier to hold.The best thing as a parent is the Amazon FreeTime app service though, $2.99 per month for any app/book I want? That's less than the price of one iPad app a month. While the app selection isn't overwhelming as an adult, as a kid the amount of available books is awesome. Also, the limiting feature of the Kindle was another huge draw for us. It allows you to selectively set limits for each activity such as 1 hr of video, 1 hr of apps, but unlimited time reading books. Once you're "in" the Amazon FreeTime app it also requires the parental password to get back to the Kindle home screen, making your child stuck in the FreeTime app with it's parental control limits in place (this is a GOOD thing!).As a techie Dad I'm slightly disappointed in the Kindle OS performance (why does the Thomas App crash on loading?) not being snappy. As a parent it's an amazing inexpensive screen device. I just wish the Otterbox which I preordered the same day as the Kindle HD came out was actually available (it seems to be delayed and still shows as shipping 2 weeks after the Kindle HD finally arrived instead of same day).

Reviews.Title: Good new design, I like the screen and the greater power of the new hardware
Reviews.Author: R. McAdams
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: 2013-10-11:I am going to revise my original rating from 2 to 4 stars. Amazon and their software vendors seem to have heard our hue and cry, and are responding. Three of the applications on my list of non-functioning software for the new Kindle Fire HD are now working (Simpsons: Tapped Out, Ice Age Village, & Retro Defense), and it looks like more are on the way. So, now that the software is working, the new hardware is indeed quite nice. Everything I said in my original review still stands, I like the zippier processor, the larger memory, and the new operating system.4 Stars.ORIGINAL: 2013-10-08:This is a temporary review, because I have a feeling they are working on this. When/if they correct this, I will update this review. But, regardless, as things stand right now, I thought I should warn others about this new Kindle Fire.  I was super-excited about this new Kindle Fire. I was going to replace my original Kindle Fire with it. I even paid for 1-day shipping, pre-ordered it, and everything.I was ASTONISHED to receive it, and find out that my favorite applications I had been using for quite a while on the Kindle Fire (original) did not work on the new Kindle Fire HD 7".  I know that Amazon does not make the applications, but they were perfectly able to work with their software partners and ensure that at least all applications in the top-100 lists were ready to go with the new Kindle Fire! As things stand right now, the new Kindle Fire HD 7" is sitting unused in the box it came in, and the cover I ordered for it hasn't even been opened. I will return everything for a refund if they don't get the software availability and functionality issues sorted out in the next 2 weeks.In the meantime, save your money, and temper down your expectations for this new tablet. It has promise, but as with all hardware, it is USELESS without software to run on it. When/if they get the software issue sorted out, I will be more than happy to use it. I was very pleased with the screen resolution, the new OS, the external volume buttons, the snappier processor and the expanded memory (I ordered the 16GB model). But, none of that means ANYTHING to me, if I cannot run my favorite applications on the device. I am not a heavy tablet user, I only use my tablet for a few games, and to watch a movie or TV show when I am traveling. So, if the few applications I use are not available on the device, then the device is just an expensive paperweight.2 stars as things stand right now. I will update this review if things get better.

Reviews.Title: love my kindle but...
Reviews.Author: donna l browning
Reviews.Content: the kindle fire hd ss awesome.  i had wanted one for the lingest ti.e and finally got one.  i already had a prime account because of my granddaughter`s kindle.  I`ve read a lot of free books and have downloaded many free apps.  The only shortcoming I`ve noticed is the battery life.  For instance, i unplugged it from the charger arou d 8 this morning add tt was 100%  I just picked it up after not using it all day and battery is at 38% so I`m pretty much charging it every day.  That ss the only negative.  I love everything else about it.  My husband has an ipad and i much prefer the kindle over the ipad.

Reviews.Title: Initial recation
Reviews.Author: M.S
Reviews.Content: It's a good device for the price. I've been using it for less than 24 hours, so this won't be the most thorough review. This is my first Kindle Fire, so I won't be comparing it to the previous generations. I will post an update when I get a better idea of the battery life, but I currently estimate it to last about ten hours. This is based on about three hours of use and how much battery remained. I recommend the 16GB version if you are not planning on getting all or most of your content through Amazon, or if you don't always have access to Wi-Fi for Amazon's Cloud drive. The 8GB version should be fine for people who don't need a lot of storage or who can take advantage of the Amazon Cloud.Pros- I like the design.- Excellent screen for streaming videos or watching videos- Reading is intuitive- I love text-to-speech- No problems with internet dropping. I haven't had any issues with the built in Browser.- Cloud is easy to use- Charged via Micro-USB cable so you probably have about ten compatible chargers lying around your house.Cons- Default music player is kind of annoying, and I haven't found any good alternatives.-Kindle OS is not as user-friendly as Android. No Google Play means you'll be digging hard for alternatives to some of your favorite Android apps or installing them manually.- After my initial setup, I encountered a recurring error where the device would crash when booting up. I had to restore it to factory settings and reinstall the updates. Fortunately, I have had no issues since.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE! Not the same as the original Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Doug Guibord
Reviews.Content: I have purchased 3 kindle fire HDs, for myself and as gifts. This was also purchased as a gift. BUT, unlike the original, This Does not have a camera, Does Not have an HDMI port, billed as an 8GB device, but only has 4.78 GB available to use. I will admit, I ordered it simply based on my experience and did not read the tech specs again, assuming it was what I had ordered before. BUT Amazon needs to make it more upfront in the title letting people know that this is a stripped down version of the device!NOTICE: This requires special handling to return for a refund. SO be aware. If you have a previous version and want one like it, THIS IS NOT IT!

Reviews.Title: "New "Does Not Mean Better!
Reviews.Author: Starfishin "Starfishin"
Reviews.Content: I'm posting this after reading a lot of comments from people who are a bit confused about what this "new" Kindle Fire HD offers. Maybe you're like me -- after buying my daughter a Kindle Fire HD last summer, and "borrowing" it a few times, I fell in love and bought my own "old" version KFHD. I can't remember the last time I've been so unreservedly enthusiastically about a purchase. However, if you've been looking at a friend's Kindle Fire HD for some months now, and think you're going to buy a new, improved or upgraded model today -- you're NOT. Sure, you're paying a less money than an entry-level KFHD cost a month ago -- but you're also getting a lot less Kindle for that money.As people are beginning to figure out, this stripped down version doesn't have a camera (I know, I know -- read the description. But you really can't fault people for assuming the "new" version would have the same features are the old.) I really thought that was a feature I didn't need, but as it turns out I love the camera in my Kindle Fire HD -- it makes it unbelievably easy to curl up in a chair and Skype.  I've also tried it once for video conferencing -- again, much easier than using a laptop. If you use Skype -- or if you think there's any possibility you might want to use it (Grandchildren? Children away at college? Elderly parents?) you really want this feature.The baseline new KFHD has half the memory --  8 GB vs 16 GB -- of the old. Skimping on memory on a device as versatile as this is shortsighted, to say the least. It's pretty funny -- when the old KFHD came out, Amazon explained why you NEEDED at least 16 GB this way: "We wanted to answer your question about storage. HD content is much larger than SD content, which is why Kindle Fire HD starts at 16GB." So suddenly HD content doesn't require as much storage?Some people consider the Kindle Fires a tablet substitute -- I think it depends what you want a tablet for. I don't think any of the Fires are for serious work. Light work, social media, e-mail and entertainment, yes. My old KFHD has unbelievably good speakers -- if the complaints about the speakers on the new KFHD are to be believed, then that's a big strike against it as an entertainment device (if I'm home alone watching, why should I have to go to the hassle of using earbuds just so I can get acceptable sound quality?)No HDMI port on the new KFHD? OK....lousy internal speakers, can't connect to tv or monitor....how are these improvements?It is nice that Amazon stopped cheaping out and included a power cord with the new KFHD -- on the other hard, it wasn't an expense for many people, who simple used the power cord from other Kindle devices.While I've still got my fingers crossed that I won't encounter the battery/charging issues many people report at the one year mark, for now I am quite satisfied with my old version KFHD -- and I'm convinced it's a superior product to the new version. If you'd like to compare the new version with the prior version, go here: B0083PWAPW(and Amazon -- if you're listening: On the advice of someone who works for an airline, I "named" my (3 differentversions!) Kindle e-readers with a version of my first name and my phone number so that if I lost it (and the airlines apparently have a astounding collection of lost Kindles)the finder could locate me. I keep my KFHD locked, because unlocked anyone would have access to my entire life. However, that also means there's no way to identify me if I lose it.  It would be great to have the owner's contact information displayed even when the device is locked. I, the airlines, and Kindle-toting passengers everywhere thank you!)

Reviews.Title: No brainer for the money
Reviews.Author: Jason Cronan
Reviews.Content: Great tablet for the money - can't beat it! Have an ipad 2 that I paid 3x's the price for and I can essentially get the same use out of the Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: my second Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really wouldn't recommend this Kindle.  It is my second Kindle in 13 months.  I loved my first one but this one doesn't begin to compare to my first one.  Because I loved my first one so much, I made sure that my new one was exactly the same (I should say as close to my old one as possible).  This one is way slower than my first.  You almost need a hammer to make any of the keys work.  I read a lot of ebooks and play a lot of games.  My favorite game is Scrabble but I can't stand using my new Kindle, It is sooooooooo slow and no matter how many times I click "play"  it highlights whatever entry it wants to and  I have to leave the game a few times and come back and try it again before it finally clicks on the right choice.  Frustrating to say the least..  My first Kindle's USB Port that is used to charge came loose and my tech told me it wouldn't be cost effective to fix it but I would give my eye teeth to have it back...

Reviews.Title: Love my new kindle fire! Amazing price
Reviews.Author: Brie "Brie"
Reviews.Content: I am so happy I finally bought myself a kindle fire. I have used my kindle touch for years for reading only and I own a budget priced android 7 inch tablet. Now that I have a kindle fire, I wish I would have skipped the android tablet entirely. The kindle fire has amazing picture and sound, very fast response, long lasting battery, came with wall charger, and is perfect for using to watch my Amazon prime movies and tv as well as my Netflix, xfinity tv go and hbo go. I also am so much happier with this kindle for purchasing text books and comics as it is much easier to zoom and view them easily. Overall I would say that if you are looking for a nice inexpensive tablet for videos, books and games, the kindle fire hd is perfect! And this is especially true if you are an Amazon prime member!

Reviews.Title: Short Life For The Price...
Reviews.Author: Douglas "College English professor who loves ...
Reviews.Content: Kindle number five for me, and no one in my family has ever had one last for more than a year and a half.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Dr. Brian N. Leviton
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews, I was hesitant to purchase this tablet. I am pleased that I did. It is easy and simple. It does more than I need. I believe that negative reviews that I read had more to do with unrealistic expectations. It's a tablet, NOT a computer! I highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD  was worth the money
Reviews.Author: Christopher D. Crane
Reviews.Content: I gave it this rating because it was what I expected and more for the price. Even for a 7" the graphics are awesome. It is way faster than the older version as well. Good Buy!!

Reviews.Title: I really like this tablet
Reviews.Author: David Núñez
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start saying that I'm an apple person all the way, I have an Iphone, an Ipad, one macbook pro and one iMac, apple tv and an Ipod in the car, also my wife have Apple products and my three kids have an Ipad mini every day, saying this I think Imake my point clear, We bought the Kindle fire HD because the Kindle Free time , the way that you can control the time that the kids use the tablet and how they use it  is Amazing, also the fact that for a minimum monthly payment ($2.99 ??) we have free books that we can borrow and a lot of videos and some app that  fit perfect for our kids age and the educational content is Amazing . I think this is the best tablet you can get for your kids

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointing and frustrating experience after a week
Reviews.Author: LJS
Reviews.Content: I have an original Kindle Fire that I love but which is showing its age now so I bought a Kindle Fire HD (2013).  I was really on the fence about buying it as I think the 2012 HD is a better device. I have to say I am really disappointed with new design. (Note that the current HD is really a successor to the 2012 Fire). First of all the 2013 Fire HD is slightly wider than the original Fire which makes it harder to hold even though this newer model is lighter. My first Fire had a classic tablet shape with the power button and charging port on the bottom and it held up really well to daily use for the past several years.  On the original fire, when you charge it, there is a light that tells you it is charging. The 2013 Fire HD does not have light so you are forced to keep the HD on when charging so you can keep swiping onto the main page to read the incredibly tiny battery indicator. Due to the weird slanted sides, the charging cable plugs in at an angle.  This design leaves the charging cable in a position where it will be easily damaged so I am very confident that it will not last more than six months.  (Sadly you will want an extended warranty on this).The Fire HD has some accessibility features but they are extremely poorly thought out.  First all, the silk browser (unlike that the original Fire) will not let you change the fonts and font sizes.  While the Settings Menu has an option called "Use Large Font Size" I have found no instance of any larger fonts being used for menus or settings or headings or anything in any section of the Fire or the silk browser.There is one Accessibility Feature that ALL users should be forewarned about to not play with ever as it is very buggy.  "Screen Reader" option is a feature that is supposed to read the text on the pages to you. However, if you turn it on with out realizing it, you will end up getting locked out of your device unless you are able to PRECISELY swipe with two finger the lock button (it took tech support's help and twenty tries before I could get back in) and then you will need to double tap items that are "highlighted" with this tiny border around to select them until you can get back to the Accessibility Menu.) For whatever reason, it is very hard to get the HD to "register" that you are doing the right actions.  I am both hearing impaired and visually impaired so I had a very hard time fixing this problem as the highlighting is not easy to see. Note that restarting your Fire will NOT "erase" this setting, you must use the alternate swiping and taping meant for this Screen Reader mode to go back into the settings menu to fix it.  If you do end up with something that seems like somewhat like a frozen screen after a restart, turn up the volume and see if it is describing the page verbally. If so, then you turned on this feature and it is NOT that your screen froze but rather that you are not use the correct swiping methods needed when this feature is turned on.Being visually and hearing impaired, I am unable to use this feature as I can't hear the descriptions well enough (very mechanical voice) and the "highlighting" of selections is nothing more than a one pixel wide colored square around the icon or label. If you are visually impaired and plan to use this, I strongly recommend that you work with someone with very good eyesight and hearing to test this after checking Amazon's help section for detailed instructions as there are no onscreen instructions. I have hand-eye coordination issues and I found the alternate method of selecting things in this (and in the Screen Magnifier option" very hard to use and remember. The whole thing is very complicated and not user friendly.I tried the email and gave up.  While it worked with my email provider, there were no font settings at all in the email so I could not enlarge the display size of the fonts in the emails or within the app itself.I did not notice any significant improvement loading pages as compared to the original Fire. the HD does not remember my preferences for clearing browser data so every time, you need to go into settings and select each setting. That is really annoying.Hearing impaired persons should note that there is section for setting a variety of closed captioning settings for video that have CC on a browser page including fonts and sizes.  This is different from the setting to turn CC on or off in the main Settings page for the whole device. However, the Amazon Video app itself does not have any CC settings within its settings page.I strongly prefer reading ebooks on the original fire over the HD.  The HD does not have true "white" background - rather to my eyes, it is an off white which means it has less contrast and was tiring to read.I did not get the 10 hours or so of battery life that I believe the HD is supposed to get.  And the plug part of the cord got very  hot and I had to unplug it after about two hours and let it cool down.In a lot of places, the HD uses writing in a light grey color. It is very hard to read and all of the menus in the various Amazon apps are small and hard to read.I had also hoped that since the 2013 HD was designed after the lending library was introduced, that it would have a way to browse the entire lending library. Nope. And you can't go onto your PC and shop for them even to read on the Fire, you actually have to stumble around the books store on your Fire and try to find the books you want and not the 20 or so featured books they want you borrow. Very annoying and the lack of usefulness of this feature is good reason to not order Prime again.I have not really tried watching the Amazon Prime video on the HD as there is no way to set closed captioning (other than on/off) yet.  I think I would prefer to use a Roku than try to watch on a screen where I can't change the fonts, colors and sizes.  While I could have bought an HDX to use its miracast feature, I would have then had spend more money on a device for the miracast to put it up on my tv and more money for a warranty.  I am not sold on the miracast feature and strongly prefer an hdmi cable connection for simplicity.One of the reason I picked this model is that it has no front facing camera. The lack of camera is one of the better features of the first Fire and the HD.  It is one of the reasons  I did not get HDX.I am very frustrated about the volume and power buttons being inaccessible. They should be on the edges not the back.this of course means I can't use any of my existing cases!!  I am constantly flipping it over to find the buttons because there is no easy way to the tell the top from the bottom and so I keep ending up pressing the wrong button if I don't actually look. It is annoying and totally poor design. There is no slot for pushing in a paperclip to reset the Fire, instead you have to use one or two different reset methods that involve holding down the power button for 30 seconds. And getting to the safe mode apparently requires pressing one of the volume buttons and the start button at the same time! There is no expandable storage at all so if you are going someplace where you don't have access to wifi, you better clear some space on the tablet.Like other reviewers, I have found that the HD does not always respond to swipes and other motions well.

Reviews.Title: Not quite the same thing as an e-reader but absolutely wonderful
Reviews.Author: thinker
Reviews.Content: Good small tablet. I would prefer a bit more customizable an interface, or maybe I just need to spend more time working out how things work. I do wish the Silk browser would work with Netflix; I was a bit peeved until I found the Netflix application at the app store. Making YouTube.com work can be a bit of a challenge. I really would like a simple way to see which ebook content is a sample; the Kindle e-reader says 'sample' on the title line and I wish the Fire would have a small symbol or something. I do like being able to get the cover art.I purchased this as a replacement for my Kindle e-reader when part of the screen went blank, on Memorial Day. The Kindle Fire, registered, charged, and running, was in my hands on Wednesday afternoon of the same week. The tech support and replacements team people get Five Stars from me.I'm going to eventually purchase another Kindle strictly for reading at some point, because the e-ink versions have longer battery life and reading is for me easier when I can have a screen that can be read in direct sunlight if needed. The Kindle Fire is otherwise about as good as it gets, and it's a good argument for having both types of Kindles. The only thing I'd like to have as an application is on-line access to the Oxford English Dictionary--but maybe I haven't yet found it.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle HD 7
Reviews.Author: JerriPi
Reviews.Content: My new Kindle HD 7 is a wonderful tablet. It has good battery life and the prices of the books are lower than those of other tablets. I am n ot having any trouble reading it in bright sunlight and I love the app store. This satisfies all my needs.

Reviews.Title: refurbishe dHD KINDLE
Reviews.Author: Sherryl Winans
Reviews.Content: I can't use it say my storage is full I need to remove but I removed alot and it wont let me get on web. It has double storage my other one has........ HELP!!!

Reviews.Title: Had to replace my original Fire
Reviews.Author: Reg Nordman "(K)nights on the Road"
Reviews.Content: This unit more than replaces the original fire - which has an issue with the charging plug . Its too hard to fix so

Reviews.Title: Biggest advantage over previous generation is Bluetooth
Reviews.Author: No snappy nickname
Reviews.Content: Honestly I haven't observed a huge difference between this and the previous-generation Fire in terms of screen quality, though that could be that I have rural Internet that isn't likely to give me true HD.  But that wasn't really the reason I bought this.  It's meant as a work tool for a professional researcher who needs to mark up books and PDF-format scholarly articles, and for that, it is awesome.  I wish the old Fire had had Bluetooth and I could have saved my money, but a real keyboard is essential for turning this into a valid college or grad student tool (for when your real computer is a massive Adobe-ready desktop that isn't going ANYWHERE).  The pairing is wonderfully easy.  I like the lighter form factor, though the new locations of the buttons can be annoying on a reading stand.

Reviews.Title: My kindle fire HD and why I love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love it, what else can I say it's a wonderful buy, I can do so much with it, watch movies, read my books, t.v., play games. It's very much like the tablets that I gave to my grandchildren for CHIRSTMAS but can do so much more on it! Going to save my money so I can maybe buy a larger one maybe the kindle fire HDX!

Reviews.Title: 8GB advertised, but that's not what you really get
Reviews.Author: Sabrina Kuznecoff
Reviews.Content: There are 8GB of storage on the device technically, HOWEVER, only about 4GB are available on the device for you to use. The other 4 are taken by software that is preloaded onto the Kindle that you cannot remove.I ordered this for my son for Christmas and I thought that 8GB should be enough, but even though he only has 9 apps downloaded, 0 music, videos, pics there is insufficient storage to download updates for the 9 apps he has... I feel like Amazon should advertise this more clearly so that people know what they are REALLY getting for their money.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing... an apple convert
Reviews.Author: A. Fink
Reviews.Content: I have an Ipad mini, hubby has a normal sized one with retina display and we own an Imac and Iphones. I got this kindle for my 6 year old's birthday. I liked best that it had parental controls and was NOT going to shell out another $350 for an ipad that he will likely abuse. I've been playing with this thing for a day and I LOVE IT!!! My school has a learning app that is only available in the apple app store so I am stuck with my ipad, but if I had a choice out of both for pleasure and entertainment, then I would choose the kindle hands down. It is so easy to navigate, and amazon prime makes it so easy to put movies and thing on it. I love the main screen because all the thing my son will use are right there, he can just swipe through them and pick what he wants to do.... LOVE THIS THING!

Reviews.Title: battery life
Reviews.Author: Freda L. Garcia
Reviews.Content: The battery life on this kindle isn't great. On my older kindle I wouldn't have to charge the battery for weeks, and I read quit a bit. On this kindle I have to charge it every day. Otherwise it is nice

Reviews.Title: Gifted
Reviews.Author: Jessica Glorioso
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my mother-in-law who is not exactly 'up with the times', and she uses it with ease. She says it is very fast and although we had to show her how to download apps and use them, she learned very quickly and has been stuck to it since. I already own a bigger and more expensive tablet, so I won't need one for myself, but if mine broke and I quickly needed another that's not as pricey, I would definitely add this to my list.

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars
Reviews.Author: GGGlista
Reviews.Content: Had a regular kindle when they first came out. This one is great has all the bells and whistles. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Feels cheap, far less capable than the old generation Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: DrSmile "RSJ"
Reviews.Content: I have the first generation Kindle Fire HD and liked it so much I figured I would buy the newer model for my girlfriend. Boy was that a poor decision! The new model feels cheap by comparison with its angled plastic edges. The buttons feel like they might fall off any second. Whats worse 3 major features are missing on this new version: There is no display out port and far more importantly, there is no camera AND no microphone. This new model should be priced at 1/2 of the old one considering the lack of features, yet it costs more.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Eva Toth "plantlady"
Reviews.Content: I bought this kindle after my old one broke .I loved my first one so I decided to go with another one.I got a good deal on Amazon but a few days after I got it I realized that it didn't have a camera so I can't use it for pictures but more importantly I can't use it to Skype.I contacted Amazon and they told me that this model is not equipped with a camera.Really??? Even flip phones have cameras today!! Very disappointed with it but I kept it for games for my grandson.I think I'll buy some other kind of tablet.

Reviews.Title: Love it except for...
Reviews.Author: Murphey
Reviews.Content: When you recharge it, there is no illuminated battery light, so you don't know when it's fully charged.  It seems to take longer to chard and battery life seems a bit shorter.  Other than that, I really like it.  It is replacement for the original 1st generation Fire which lasted 2 1/2 years.  Don't know whether that is good or bad.  It's faster and easier to navigate...

Reviews.Title: DON't BE FOOLED into thinking this Kindle Fire HD is just like the one you already have!
Reviews.Author: Happy Housewife
Reviews.Content: The problem is that there are so many reviews for this item that I never saw the ones where people posted that this item is NOT the same as the original Kindle Fire HD. I bought it for my husband thinking that it was, and excited about giving him one just like mine. He could use my old case, and we could share screen protectors, he could take pictures and have a duplicate of my beloved Kindle Fire HD. BUT DON'T BE FOOLED! This casing of this one is smaller, and the on/off button is on the backside of the Kindle. So it won't fit into anything you might already have and the screen protectors, unless you buy one specifically for THIS Kindle won't fit it. And one of the most disappointing features that's been left off of this one is that It DOES NOT have a camera either!I am so disappointed in Amazon for not pointing out the differences in this one and the one with the EXACT SAME NAME THAT IS NOTHING LIKE IT!

Reviews.Title: mothers day gift for mom
Reviews.Author: K Young
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my mom, who has been an IPAD user for years... she "borrowed" mine a few weeks ago and in order to retrieve MY Kindle, I purchased her one!  She LOVES it.  Go Mom!  One person at a time, I will convert the world to Kindle!  :)  I think one of the best things about the Fire is the ease of use.  I had one that was a first gen.  I now own the bigger HDX.  It's just a huge improvement from the first gen version for some small and some bigger reasons. The power button AND volume buttons are so convenient.  I haven't used the camera a lot yet, but I will.  If you're sitting on the fence, go ahead.  Jump in.  I am pretty confident you'll love it too.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a gift for my mom
Reviews.Author: SusieQ "Gadget Lover"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 7" arrived right on time.  This is my mom's third Kindle, and the setup was quick and easy.  All of my mom's books flew right into the device after we set up the wi-fi connection.  Everything went without a hitch.The Kindle Fire HD 7" (2013 version) is lightweight, and the screen is beautiful.  Having volume buttons on the edge of the device is much easier than having to go into the settings to change the sound level. The charging block has folding prongs, so it's compact and easy to carry without worrying about damaging a bag.Mom had two Kindle e-readers before getting the Kindle Fire HD 7".  Now, she is using the new Kindle like a pro!  If you have any doubts about whether or not a senior citizen might be able to adapt to this technology, I encourage you to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: A very nice Android tablet
Reviews.Author: Matt Durgavich
Reviews.Content: I'm a developer, so I bought this for testing apps. It's a really nice tablet for the money though, with a bright clear screen. The construction is solid, the OS snappy, and works as a target device out of the box. I'm immensely satisfied with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: ok for what it is
Reviews.Author: Richard Fleury
Reviews.Content: if your looking to get your feet wet in the world of apps and hand-held pads, this is a pretty decent way to do so.  the device itself is fairly light, with a good size screen and a graphics display that is top notch.  Amazon has done a great job of making it very user friendly, and integrating it with your amazon account - making apps and movies that you purchase (weather from your device or your PC) available to your Kindle.shockingly though, they did not FULLY integrate with other services such as their cloud storage (not the "cloud" that is your account purchases, but a separate service amazon offers called "amazon cloud storage"). an app is available from amazon, but it is INCOMPATIBLE (what?!) with kindle - amazons flagship mobile device.  while movies that you have purchased via digital download from amazon are easily accessible, there is no native way to import other movies, or clips that you own.  the only way i was able to play other media was by putting them onto my PC, then transferring them over manually with the kindle connected to my machine.  then, i had to download a third-party video playing app to access and play the clipps. way too much hassle for something that should be a basic function.BUT THIS IS NOT WHY I TOOK OFF TWO STARS!!!!THE reason i gave it the lower rating is because there are a few real problems with this device that have yet to be seriously addressed by Amazon.1)  there is a small chance that your brand new kindle (right out of the box) will have a defective screen - that is, it will be totally unresponsive to touch.  this happened to me, and upon searching the net i found i was not alone.  the only thing that can be done is have it sent in and replaced.2)  there is a chance your kindle will lock up and become inoperable, stuck in a loop at the boot screen.  this is a well documented problem that has plagued all of their kindle models, and also happened to my mothers kindle.  when the problem first arose, i looked to google for a solution, but only found repeated recomendations to "reboot" the device by holding in the power button for 30 seconds to a full minute, then leaving it off for a while, and turning it back on again.  when that failed, i called amazon for help - and they immediately asked if i had "tried rebooting it".  he walked me through it, and when it failed he sent me to someone more experienced... who then prompted me to "try rebooting the device".  AGAIN he walked me through the process, and again it failed, so then he sent me over to a kindle tech expert of some sort (sorry, its been a while).... who then introduced himself and asked me (NO, SERIOUSLY!!!) "have you tried rebooting the device?"...if it weren't happening to me - if this was a character in a movie or something i would have just busted up laughing at this point. unfortunately, it WAS happening to me, so all i could do is silently shake my head in disbelief.the sad truth is, if anything happens to your kindle the only tool these guys have is to have you reboot it.thats it.thats all they got.no file patching, no way to get inside and clean things up.  all they can do is ask if you've tried rebooting it.if that fails (and from what i've seen it rarely works), the only other option is to send it in and have it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Love it...
Reviews.Author: Elena Moreno
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th kindle..,I bought it because of the text to speech. I'm now able to connect my Bluetooth to it and it's great for listening to a book while I clean..

Reviews.Title: Great for what I need it for
Reviews.Author: Paige
Reviews.Content: I wanted just a basic kindle, but I also wanted color and touch screen capabilities. When the Kindle Fire HD 7" went on sale I knew I couldn't pass it up.Overall, it is a great reader. I don't use it for anything else, but reading in really nice and I love the battery life. It's much longer than what I would get through my kindle app on my ipad.The only thing I don't like about the Kindle fire HD 7" is you can't organize your books unless you purchase an app. And although Amazon game me welcoming coins for my kindle purchase, the apps are not very good for organization.

Reviews.Title: Works fantastically for scientific paper reading.
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: I use this to read science papers (molecular biology PDFs) at the gym. It's great. The display is super crisp and it works even better than paper because the text and images are high definition and I can zoom in so I can read even while using a machine. Definitely recommended! Worth more than the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING customer service/tech support...!
Reviews.Author: Sarah A. McDermott "Sarahndipity"
Reviews.Content: I had an issue I couldn't resolve with my Kindle, to mySHOCK AND AMAZEMENT AMAZON REPLACED THE KINDLE with lightening speed/today's TUES,by THURS...!Upon analysis of this whole situation, in summary, I'd say1)either I'm getting cynicalOR2) Amazon has exceptional customer service & tech support  I am an optimistic realist, therefore, its definitely #2...YES,AMAZON HAS EXCEPTIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE AND TECH SUPPORT...Sarah from Maine

Reviews.Title: Love this item!
Reviews.Author: Flirtee Girl
Reviews.Content: Absolutely irreplaceable in my life!  It's my right hand most days! My kids live it too! I have to fight them to get time on it for me lol.

Reviews.Title: wonderful item
Reviews.Author: Ida Grace Mauser
Reviews.Content: I never knew how much I would use this electronic device but I have not missed a day since I purchased it.The games seem endless and fill many hours daily.  I have read more books since purchasing in the past six months then I had in past years.

Reviews.Title: Nothing Better for the Money
Reviews.Author: Brilliant
Reviews.Content: For reading and media, there is no better value.  This is my first review posted on any product.  This is the best.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Cecile McKernan
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my kindle fire. It is a lot of fun to use. It is also easy to set up. I have had no problems.

Reviews.Title: Gift for granddaughter
Reviews.Author: ladyx4
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for another tablet my granddaughter had that malfunctioned.  She has hardly put it down since I gave it to her.  The perfect gift for anyone.  I made sure to set the parental controls as my granddaughter is only 7, and she never tires of finding new and fun apps to play.

Reviews.Title: Terrific deal !!!
Reviews.Author: Is it good or is it WTF ?
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my mother as a gift, I helped her set it up and she loves it.  As an owner of an Ipad Mini I couldn't believe how much it was like it only at lees than half the cost.  While I love Apple products, I don't understand how they can charge more than double for basically the same device.I would definatley recommend

Reviews.Title: Great product and cheaper than ipad
Reviews.Author: charlene Marasco
Reviews.Content: Everyone in my family has a kindle including my 4 year old. It's cheaper than the ipad and does the exact same things that we would use that for. I now use the kindle instead of my laptop. I have had mine for over 2 years and have not had any problems.

Reviews.Title: A terrible tablet for kids
Reviews.Author: Aiden Berg
Reviews.Content: Parental controls for this tablet are extremely rudimentary, especially regarding apps.  There are only 2 controls that parents have regarding apps.  You can block in-app purchasing, and you can completely shut down the ability to use apps at all.  That's it.You cannot, for instance, password-protect the ability to download apps.  Either your child has no ability to use apps on this tablet at all, or else he has total access to every piece of random violent and/or pornographic app available via the app store.  There is no rating system.The only way around this horrific lack of forethought on Amazon's part is to leave wifi disabled on the tablet.  When you want to download content for your child, you have to go into settings and create a new wifi connection each time, download the content (a book or age-appropriate app), and then delete the wifi connection again.This device is a total and complete fail for parents on the part of Amazon.  If you don't want your kid watching porn or playing assassination games, and don't want to constantly have to create new wifi connections on the device to download new apps/books, I suggest you get an iPad for your child instead.

Reviews.Title: More like an ember
Reviews.Author: Christopher B. Martin
Reviews.Content: Low rating mainly because of Amazon's 'walled garden's Appstore, which is more like a ghetto. Amazon's refusal to play nice with Google is why we can't have nice things like Drive, Maps, etc. which even a fierce competitor like Apple allows in their app store. Many popular apps available in Google Play are not here, starting with Instagram, Facebook Messenger, and too many to list here. Instead, a plethora of crappy puzzle games. Free app of the day? I now have three different calculators. Thanks, Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Mania
Reviews.Author: Earl Summers
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire is an excellent device for reading, movie watching and internet access.  My son uses the Fire everyday.  Moving the USB connector to an angled position helps to keep the Fire charged and is a much better design.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as the previous gen
Reviews.Author: IT Telecommuter
Reviews.Content: Only bought it because the older one was (a) failing to charge and (b )had no way to replace the battery. The new model is (a) faster; (b) has better graphic rendering; and (c) is inferior in all other respects. My complaints in Worst-IFO order: 1. Can't find the bookmarks tool for web use2. Power and sound buttons are on the back of the unit, masked in black, and basically useless as a shortcut to the software controls3. Unit size is the same, but the arbitrary movement of control buttons forces us to buy a new protective case4. Overall, suffers from the Seattle Tech Hubris: "Where else you gonna go, sucker?"  Smart people are entertaining themselves developing "consumer products" without ANY contact with actual consumers.

Reviews.Title: Should have shopped around
Reviews.Author: Darrick Sing
Reviews.Content: Should have shopped around, paid way more buying from Amazon than I could have locally. My son saved all his birthday and Christmas money to buy a Kindle, he wanted an HDX but couldn't afford it. Unfortunately we didn't shop around, could have bought an HDX locally for more than $100.00 less, lesson learned. Bought my other son an HDX locally, nicer tablet for way less money. The HD is a nice tablet as far as picture and graphics but lacking in features, only moderately impressed otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Love my new kindle
Reviews.Author: gail
Reviews.Content: I had the first kindle fire and I upgraded to the Kindle Fire HD I loved the first one and this one is even better and downloads much faster.I don't need all the extras I just use the basics and it is perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: jackie
Reviews.Content: I gave it a 5 because it met, and sometimes, exceeded my expectations.  I would highly recommend this product.  I have taken it to the pool and to the beach with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: A. Federici "tonyf1964"
Reviews.Content: I purchased a kindle fire hdx, however i had little luck with this (see my other review), i was advised by amazon technical support department that i might be better off, returning my kindle fire hdx and instead, purchasing the kindle fire hd (which i ended up doing).  By doing this, i saved several hundred of dollars and i am very thrilled with my kindle fire hd, as it does what it says, from "read to me" to allowing me to download my itune music and using this as a music player also.  Very impressed with the kindle fire hd.  Thank you

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: sandnsea
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  I received it quickly and it was so easy to set up.  I began using it and downloading almost immediately.  I'm kind of dumb when it comes to setting up any electronics, but this was simple, even for me.  Love, love, love it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Sharon W.
Reviews.Content: I love it.  I wish I had gone with the 16 GB though.  But, I am enjoying it very much.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is not the same product as it was a year and a half ago.
Reviews.Author: Linda Price Hufford
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed, because the Kindle Fire HD we bought this year has fewer features than the Kindle Fire HD we bought a year and a half ago.  The new Kindle Fire HD does not have a camera, yet the old Kindle Fire HD does have one.  I don't think our new tablet has a microphone, either.  We are still discovering what else this model does not have.  The print seems smaller, too.  If Amazon is going to sell a different model, it should have a different name.

Reviews.Title: Total upgrade from the first Fire
Reviews.Author: r.kersen
Reviews.Content: I love the slimness of this Kindle and that it automatically recommends books to you under the book that is up in the carousel.

Reviews.Title: Great replacement for my old Kindle
Reviews.Author: Atticus Finch
Reviews.Content: I've looked at dozens of tablets, And really none compare to the iPad.But for what I use a tablet for, at least these days, this is clearly one of the best and an absolute bargain. It has worked flawlessly for me since I bought it. Made my life a little easier if I want to take a break from reading and surf, hit facebook, or shop.For the price point of a woeful android tablet, this thing is spectacular. It's not a real full function tablet, and it's tethered to Amazon, but so what? I find myself buying through amazon more and more. So for what I needed, it's the best thing going.

Reviews.Title: Not a favourite.
Reviews.Author: dawn
Reviews.Content: Slow start up. Doesn't'  shut off when cover is closed.  Other than that it is ok. Should have gotten the larger one.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as hoped!
Reviews.Author: stephk0430
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle Fire HD for about 2 weeks now and I love it! I debated buying it for a while, deciding if I should've just gotten an e-reader instead  (was afraid of reading on this kind of screen vs. the e-ink of a regular Kindle, but with an anti-glare screen protector it's been perfect. Even in the sun at the beach.Also been nice to stream Netflix, browsing online, etc. I would highly recommend if you are considering, especially since they are on sale now (further discount for purchasing with an Amazon Prime trial). Not a huge investment and it's something that will get a lot of use.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: J. Montgomery
Reviews.Content: I would always use my iPod in leu of the computer, especially if someone else was using the computer, and the screen is just TOO small. The Kindle Fire HD makes it soooo much easier!! The picture is so much clearer and uploads/downloads are fast. Reading books on my Kindle Fire HD is so much better than my old Kindle. I've only had one problem so far and that was randomly the Kindle Fire wouldn't turn on (at least the screen, the sound would). But that was an easy fix, I just plugged it in and let it charge a bit and tried again to turn it on and it turn on just fine!

Reviews.Title: Well pleased
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've had two Amazon readers before I purchased the Kindle Fire and I love them.I'm amazed at all the functions that this tablet is capable of .Good job Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD7
Reviews.Author: Patrick Morgan
Reviews.Content: A friend got one and I decided it was definitely a step up from my old B&W; Kindle and offered internet which was easier to see/use than my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Marcia Faircloth "deal seaker"
Reviews.Content: Have been wanting a Kindle Fire for a while now and got and AMAZING PRICE!!! Because it was a 2012 model it cost less than $100

Reviews.Title: Can't use outside in the sun
Reviews.Author: patricia callinan
Reviews.Content: Disappointed that unlike my old Kindle, I cannot see the screen in the sun!  Is there a way to correct this?

Reviews.Title: awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: mimi13
Reviews.Content: This Kindle is one of the best purchases I have made!! I get to download my books and watch my Amazon movies, my kids play games, so easy to take anywhere, and the price is perfect.  The size is portable for my purse, the kids backpacks, etc....I can search the web, shop, check my mail, purchase tracking, ..And not to mention a great babysitter for long car trips.  Highly recommend, I have 2!!

Reviews.Title: Great Item
Reviews.Author: KEN LEWIS
Reviews.Content: Am really enjoying it.  Great product for the money.  Just too many advertisements crop up, but I just delete them.  It is a shame you have to spend too much more money not to be bothered by them.

Reviews.Title: Awesome until it stops working
Reviews.Author: Reed Bates
Reviews.Content: Great battery life, good software but a bit clunky. (To toggle on and off WIFI you have to dig down four screens.) When the volume buttons stop working, the "screen adjustment" category on the menu is below the fold and one must scroll down for it. Surely something that is going to be accessed so often due to crappy buttons could be put closer to the top of the menu.Great WIFI reception.But it gets an epic fail when it won't turn on for days at a time. The on/off button is suddenly non-responsive, and even plugging it in won't start it. Then after a few days, it again works normally. A few weeks go by, it stops responding again. It becomes a useless  expensive brick... except at least a brick is thick enough to act as a door stop!

Reviews.Title: Great...when it works
Reviews.Author: Alan C. Gravelle "CTcamper"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I'm going to have to exchange my 2nd kindle. First one, the case separated enough to cause the volume buttons to work intermittently within first month.  Second (the replacement) screen failed (very distorted) within 2nd month.  The process is simple but still aggravating.

Reviews.Title: Too many problems
Reviews.Author: C. Whyte
Reviews.Content: I bought this product 2 months ago and now i am having problems with it :-( It wont power on even though I charged it up (it is fully charged). Ever so often it freezes so i have to turn it off and then turn it on again! #frustrated and very disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Buy
Reviews.Author: Brenda Phillips
Reviews.Content: This Kindle has a nice clear display and easy to use. It is very  nice and compact for easy travel.

Reviews.Title: I Love the KindleFire HD 7
Reviews.Author: Chaneena Banks-Redding
Reviews.Content: The KindleFire Hd 7 is a great tablet. I especially love the subscription options (Prime) provided through Amazon. I have young preschool & Kindergarten children so I use the "Kid Free Time" subscription. It keeps them entertain with plenty of educational apps & content. My first Kindle had a hardware problem with the speaker & headphone output but Amazon replaced it immediately with no issues.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: Jean T Siekman
Reviews.Content: This was for my daughter. She attends dialysis twice a week and wanted something that would enable her to surf the web, communicate with facebook and email,watch movies and create documents. It is small, light, easy to use, the picture quality is excellent. In fact, I wish I had one of my own!!!

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: mark densmore
Reviews.Content: the size  is right,,, the speed is good, but why make it without a camera is silly.... if only a front facing one and a mike it would of been perfect.... I think the size if perfect  . a woman could carry one of these in her purse without problems and kids could have one in a book bag just fine... keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This is the best tablet for the price. Love it. Both me, my husband and my 5 year old daughter use it. Easy to navigate.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS!!
Reviews.Author: Daisy Cee "big bend buyer"
Reviews.Content: Happy Birthday to ME!! I love this...exactly what I wanted. Crazy easy set up...had just the amount of bells and whistles!! Amazing price! Superfast shipping ~ Secure packaging! Thanks so much!!

Reviews.Title: DO not BUY for kids
Reviews.Author: Joel Howard
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend purchase for kids.  in concept it is great, however, functionally it is a poor design.In addition to that amazon makes it difficult to return and/or get your money back per my conversationwith customer support.  we often have internet disconnections, drive stalls, short battery life. the deviceis not as fluid as advertised.I recommend saving a little more and getting an ipad mini...

Reviews.Title: Proct great, Packageing and info not
Reviews.Author: Jsawmor
Reviews.Content: Love the product, very disappointed in how it was shipped. Carton was very flimsy compared to other Kindle products I have purchased in the past. There was no instructions at all and considering as I was giving as a gift it would have been nice if the girl could have simple instructions on how to register it ect. The last Kindle Fire I bought actually came with a small pamphlet that had these instructions.

Reviews.Title: Not a reliable device
Reviews.Author: Google User
Reviews.Content: I'm really surprised why this device has a lot of positive ratings, it's good to use for few hours a day, but if you really going to push it to the limit then you will be disappointed.One of the issues I've noticed is that when creating a profile"Child profile", under this profile you won't be able to install new apps, but you can delete them!! My three years old son was deleting things all the time, though it requires to press and hold then hit remove, in a way or another he managed to figure this out, I called amazon support and complained about this and they told me it's something to address to the developers. Since you are not able to install apps you shouldn't be able to delete/remove apps either.The other serious issue is the storage, it gets filled up and the WiFi starts to disconnect frequently, I had to reset it to factory setting to clear the storage though I download the exact same applications and any other type of contents was on it before.I'm returning my Kindle, I found it's cheap(er) for a reason compared to other tables.

Reviews.Title: Don't Bother
Reviews.Author: Beth H.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this Kindle in Dec, 2012, & now it doesn't work at all. I read the forum on this same problem that many other people have experienced since 2012 & it is obvious there is a problem with the Kindle & Amazon has chosen not to correct it in 1 1/2 years. When I purchased mine, it cost just over $200 & I put quite a bit of money into it with accessories, e-books, etc. I find it hard to believe that at the price this is basically a disposable unit & it won't last much past the one year warranty; I anticipated getting at least three years out of it. Customer Service offered to replace it with a discounted, refurbished unit which I found very disappointing. I really liked my Kindle & it suited my needs perfectly. But, I will not invest in another one because the problem has not been addressed & I won't throw my money away again. If Amazon would have agreed to replace it for free or a new one (not refurbished) at a substantially discounted price, I would have considered it.  I have been an Amazon customer for years & have never been treated like this. So, I can honestly say don't waste your money unless you're okay with having the Kindle last only about a year or so.

Reviews.Title: My kindle
Reviews.Author: Stella G.  Peterson
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I needed for my trips.  I can have my favorite books, games, music, access to internet, everything in one.

Reviews.Title: So glad I received this as a gift
Reviews.Author: Deborah Brown
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying my Kindle Fire HD very much. My grandson especially likes to interact with Caillou and Daniel Tiger. It gives me the oppourtunity to keep abreast of my facebook and e mails also when I don't have time to get on the computer.

Reviews.Title: Opens up a whole new world
Reviews.Author: SR JNtte
Reviews.Content: Best of all is the ability to adjust the lighting background, ease of maneuvering around the Kindle and returning to another area or back to "home".  I do miss the built in wi-fi that was on my old plain Kindle.

Reviews.Title: The right tool for the right job
Reviews.Author: Stephen Thergesen "B.A., M.Ed., TESOL, ESP (e...
Reviews.Content: As a user, I originally debated whether or not I needed a tablet to supplement my smartphone and desktop computer. As an educator, I found that my Kindle Fire complements my other devices rather than replacing them or making up for some perceived deficiency. Nevertheless, I would like to see more of the applications which run on my Android smartphone made available for Kindle Fire, as the larger screen and storage capacity are better suited to rich media and heavy data use.

Reviews.Title: The kids are happy
Reviews.Author: CandiCrush
Reviews.Content: My kids can't put this thing down. It serves multi-purposes in my home. They use it for school and entertainment. Definitely a good buy!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding tablet for only $99
Reviews.Author: OnlineReviewer "OnlineReviewer"
Reviews.Content: For $99 you just can't beat this tablet. I needed my Gmail, calendar, contacts, web browsing, cloud storage, to-do list and I added free apps for SMS and Feedly newsreader. This Fire is performing great. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Miller
Reviews.Content: Really like the book reading and tv, movies but wish it had a hdmi out put so I could put it on my tv when at home.

Reviews.Title: Charging port became loose!
Reviews.Author: Random Person
Reviews.Content: I purchased my kindle two years ago at BestBuy. It stopped charging because the USB port became loose over time. Called Amazon and was informed because it was out of warranty, they couldn't do anything. Very disappointed, my next tablet will not be a kinde. I was very happy with it in all other ways, but you can't use it when it won't charge.Update: spoke to an amazon Rep through chat who sent me a refurbished kindle for free even though it was out of warranty. Will update when I recive it in the mail

Reviews.Title: I Love my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Joyce Robinson
Reviews.Content: The screen is great for watching videos. Apps are easy to load. It is quick - great to search the web. Books are easy to read with the white page and great to read at night. Do not need a book light. Tremendous value for the money.

Reviews.Title: loved it
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my daughter. She loves doing educational things on it. It met all my expectations and more

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I read all the free books and purchase the sequels for .99. I can surf the internet, go on Facebook, I listen to Pandora, and I can sync my pictures. Very happy!

Reviews.Title: better than I expected
Reviews.Author: stacy
Reviews.Content: Love the size for portability, HD and sound are excellent. Free month for Prime rate when ordering is a great perk. I've used my kindle fire hd for one month now and any questions I had were resolved with one phone call. The service is incredible.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as my original Kindle Fire by far, except the display
Reviews.Author: barleypopmaker "Barleypopmaker"
Reviews.Content: I "upgraded" to the Kindle fire HD 7" when they had their special pricing promotion a few weeks back and have been very disappointed with it. Although it's supposed to be faster but mine appears to be very sluggish. Even just web surfing on Silk is slower. Simple apps like Facebook don't even load pictures and I get errors when opening, and that is from an app downloaded directly from the Kindle Store. The display is beautiful and crisp and reading of ebooks has not changed, but that is really the only improvement I saw. I tried to sideload some apps which worked in my old kindle only to find that they don't even load in this one. The bluetooth also will not pair with my jambox, which really sucks because it's one of the main reason's I wanted to switch, the old Kindle did not have bluetooth. I'm disappointed and kind of wish I didn't switch. I loved my old Kindle Fire and it seems that now they have "Improved" it to the point where it is is a worse product. I never even considered rooting a kindle, but it appears that may be a route I am willing to take now if it's supposed to improve the experience.

Reviews.Title: spend the extra money and buy your Kindle elsewhere
Reviews.Author: Maureen Henson
Reviews.Content: Read the fine print before buying this from @m@zon.  I had purchased apps from g00gle pl@y for my old device.  @m@zon won't allow me to get them from my cloud for the Kindle. They expect you to buy apps only from them, including ones you have already paid for.

Reviews.Title: love my kindle!
Reviews.Author: TAF
Reviews.Content: This was actually my second Kindle purchase. I enjoyed mine so much my husband wanted one. He is extremely pleased as well with the purchase!  We use them every day!

Reviews.Title: How did I get along without it?
Reviews.Author: mike
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this device. The battery died in my e-reader and was too expensive to replace. This Kindle Fire HD is so much more, and is an almost constant companion. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: hard
Reviews.Author: tiffany whitman powers
Reviews.Content: It is very hard to set up and get it going the first time and I still dont got it set up

Reviews.Title: kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Frances E Gary
Reviews.Content: Decided on a kindle fire because my daughter has one and really likes it.  Easy to access and quickly access than a computer.Everyone that has seen it like it and I would recommend it to all my friends and family

Reviews.Title: Quality tablet for low price
Reviews.Author: Lola
Reviews.Content: I bought it when it had a 30 off promotion because I thought wow, a tablet for a hundred dollars? I ordered the Fire HD 7-inch with 8 GB and special offers. Didn't open it for two months because I debated whether I really needed a tablet. Opened it and loved it. I haven't stopped using it since. I use it every day to check email, and surf the web, and play games. The web browser is not the best, but hey, it's not a computer. Also, make sure to switch the search to Google, instead of Bing. I use the parental control to prevent accidental in-app purchases, so that's a great function as well. There are a ton of free apps and books. The free books are mostly crap but once in a while, you stumble on something decent. I mostly download pdfs and just move them over to the device for reading.The home screen is very well organized, all the tabs are at the top which categorizes your apps. I've used Netflix and TED on it, it's very fluid, and the sound is great whether or not you use earphones. It's very light (so if you drop it on your face while laying down, you don't hurt anything) and the size is perfect, I can fit it in my very tiny side bag. With heavy use, my Kindle's battery lasts about a day and a half, always on or sleeping.It has not a lot of user memory, compared to the Nexus which is around the same price, but it is a solid device. I don't believe it comes with a manual, but everyone I've spoken to online for Amazon has been amazing. Compared to my boyfriend's Nexus, there's no camera or microphone though, so it's limited in that sense. In short, I've used it for about three months, have not gone a day without it.

Reviews.Title: I Really Love my Kindle Fire HD.
Reviews.Author: JENNIE KNAPP
Reviews.Content: I use it for reading, watching Netflix and so much more.  The battery lasts several days with is great.  I give it two thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: Great For the whole family.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It's just what I wanted so I can take bdisappoints. travel or laying in the hammock in the front yard on a warm summer day. I would recommend this to people lookong for a reader or for movies.  I use it almost every day and it never disappoints.

Reviews.Title: No insult intended
Reviews.Author: Susan Hayward "lady of leisure"
Reviews.Content: I think this is probably a wonderful device for people who are really enthusiastic about technology and who are devotees of the Mac visual universe.  For those of us who aren't turned on by technology per se, and just want something to help do what we want to do (rather than to discover new universes), it seems to me to be overkill.

Reviews.Title: A device one cannot beat
Reviews.Author: AlkoKato
Reviews.Content: got my Kindle mostly for reading, but have found it to be an effective multi-purpose too.... HD is superlative.... what can I say, Ilove it!

Reviews.Title: where is the instructions
Reviews.Author: Steven A. Stefanik
Reviews.Content: Love the Kindle  Hate that I can't find out, for example how to brighten the screen. searched your site searched the internet after being frustrated I called, support was wonderful but come on

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Debra Barnes
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get another Kindle Fire HD 7" when it was offered with payments so I purchased one. I thought that being a newer generation, from the one I purchased earlier, it would be better. WRONG! I can't use some of the apps I have previously purchased on my new one because they require Adobe Air and I can't get it on the new one. BOO! So I can't use the apps on the new one that I have and love on my old one. What's up with that? I'm sorry to say that newer is not always better. I like the older one better.

Reviews.Title: I bought 3 for my grandkids.
Reviews.Author: Kent N. Voorhies "His wife Jill"
Reviews.Content: I bought these based on price and reviews.  I have not been disappointed.  My grandkids love them and play with them ALL the time. Ages are 15, 9 and 10.  I did good!!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it !!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: My children love their kindles and so do I!!!Easy to use,I can parental code it so I can watch what their doing !! My son uses his for school which is great! They don'y have enough books for everyone so now he can follow with his kindle. I can't afford to pay 8:00 bucks for every book I do wish amazon had a code schools could use for their homework so us parents didn't have to pay for for a book that was available at school in paper book for free. If they had enough copies. Amazon is great other than that! I don't regreat buying this at all and recommend Kindles for all and a great price!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Lorraine Trabalka
Reviews.Content: Fun little tablet. Great picture and so easy to use. Now I wish I would have ordered a bigger size!

Reviews.Title: GREAT PURCHASE
Reviews.Author: Louise
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THE KINDLE FIRE FOR MY 8YO GRANDDAUGHTER PRIMARIALY BECAUSE SHE LOVES TO PLAY GAMESAND I FEEL THE KINDLE PURCHASES ARE SAFER AND EASIER FOR PARENTAL CONTROL OVER THE INTERNET.SHE LOVES IT.

Reviews.Title: We love ours.
Reviews.Author: David I. Schultz "davlin99"
Reviews.Content: We originally had Kindle Touches. Those needed book lights that ate batteries. I was looking into getting Kindle Paper Whites, when I noticed for about the same price we could get Fires.We love them. The Kindle came already activated. I just had a little trouble getting them to work with our WiFi. A call to our cable provider solved that problem. The setup of the email accounts was quick and easy.I don't know what is with the negative, one star reviews. All I can think of is USER ERROR!We are completely satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful images
Reviews.Author: radrig
Reviews.Content: I really like my Kindle Fire HD for many reasons:The images are so clear,I really like to see the cover of my books and LOVE the page numbers,If I'm just waiting for something I can play games but mostly I read.I love the back lighting so I can read in bed with out another light.I'm so glad I bought it and would do so again.

Reviews.Title: Missing Features
Reviews.Author: Marcia Wooten Page

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet
Reviews.Author: Chudwad1
Reviews.Content: I like the sharp resolution.  I like the apps that are available.  I like the price.  What I don't like are how long it takes to turn on when I'm at the gym (sometimes literally two minutes).  I also sometimes have trouble accessing movies that I've downloaded.  This could be a result of the internet speed of where I'm using the tablet, though.  At home I rarely have issues.  However, I did think the tablet was defective when I first got it because I did not realize (for the first two weeks) how to shut it down correctly.  If you press the button and wait for it to ask you to shut down, this is the proper way to shut it off.  I didn't know this at first, though, and must not have been shutting it down correctly (perhaps was only putting it to sleep).  At any rate, the battery kept dying and I had to recharge it daily.  Now that I've discovered how to shut it down correctly, the battery lasts longer.  I mostly use this while walking on the treadmill at the gym.  I watch hour-long episodes of classic tv shows which I've downloaded.  I also use this at night in bed to read a few newspapers and to check Facebook.  I've also used it to watch QVC in the mornings while getting ready for work. I've downloaded a Solitaire game and a Sudoku game and I'll also play these at night before going to sleep.  There's even a police scanner app that I've downloaded so whenever I hear sirens in the neighborhood I'll turn this on.  I  have an 11" netbook which I use daily for what I call "heavy-duty" use, but this tablet does come in handy as well.

Reviews.Title: A Good Entry-Level Tablet...
Reviews.Author: dwood78
Reviews.Content: My mom purchased this on my account last month. I waited until now after she had & I got a chance to play around with it to write a review on it.That said, this a good entry-level tablet. My mom, got this mainly to read E-books, while I use it to go online. In terms of features, I'm highlighting the following:E-Books- The screen is very bright for reading E-books. When you 1st buy it, it already comes with a number of e-books-mainly dictionaries. You can choose to add them to the Kindle proper. Otherwise, they'll stay in your Kindle account located in your Amazon account & you can't removed them. If you're planning to use this mainly for reading, I'd recommend getting the Kindle with as much storage space as possibleE-mail- My mom & I haven't used it yet, but the Kindle also has an account with G-mail.IMDb Movies & TV- Kindle Edition. If you're into movies & TV shows, this a great feature. You can find info on actors, movies, TV programming & even watch movie trailers.Web- In comparison to the 5-year old PC in my home (from which the Kindle's getting its net access via a wireless router) the internet is very fast. I can watch videos from YT in HD without having issues with the flash player.Music- The music from your Amazon Cloud Player can be played on your Kindle plus you can buy MP3 music from Amazon By the way, there's also an Amazon icon where you can go to the main shop for non-music oriented items.Apps & Games- The Kindle can also play apps & games, but like e-books, make sure your tablet has the space to store them.Overall, my mom & I like this tablet. My only issue is that the Kindle battery life is a bit short before it needs charging. Other than that, this is one of the better entry-level tablets out there.
