Reviews.Title: Power problems
Reviews.Author: Jennifer J
Reviews.Content: So I love my kindle, it is great when it works.  Sadly it has major power problems.  I'm on my second kindle and it seems obvious I'll be on my third within a week.  They just turn off.  My first one was turning off all the time and then having trouble turning back on.  So they sent me a new (refurbished) one.  The new one turns off too.  I'll just be reading or working on an app and it turns off.  The second one immediately turns back on but then is in reboot mode that takes several minutes to complete.  The costumer service is rather nice and they've been working with me and I am quite confident that they will send me a third soon.  But meanwhile they wanted me to try restoring it.  That didn't work.  Then I restored it to factory settings, that hasn't worked.  I feel confident it is a hardware, not a software problem, but they are required to try all the software fixes before they'll send me another.  Each of these resets means that I lose all my data.  My books and my apps are on the cloud and they can come back.  But everything has to be downloaded again, one at a time.  Each app has to be downloaded one at a time.  Each app that needs you to log in or get a password needs to be redone.  I lose all the data I've put into the apps.  I lose all my scores on my games.  Even the games that are supposed to save your score with the amazon system lose my scores.  It is really frustrating.  I had just downloaded a library app and sorted all my books this weekend and the new reset lost all that sorting.  I have to start over.  I would hope I will eventually get a kindle without power problems.  I assume they must make some that work.  But I'm on my 4th complete reset in 3 months.  My kindle is not exposed to any harsh treatment.  No children are playing with it.  I am an adult woman who mostly uses it to read.  I think maybe a little attention to quality control in the manufacturing plant might be a good thing.  If I could get one without power problems I think I'd love it.  Crossing my fingers.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Battery life a big problem
Reviews.Author: toni mickus
Reviews.Content: I had my Kindle a little over a year.  I only used it on trips so it didn't get lots of wear.  One day I was charging it for a trip and it wouldn't charge.  According to Kindle support (which was always helpful in past) there isn't anything they can do about this except give me a refurbished Kindle Fire for 89.00.  Fred Meyer is currently selling them for 139.00 with 30.00 Fred Meyer card so why would I do that? This Kindle had been well taken care of and minimally used. When I looked at other comments to find possible solutions to the problem I found that many others experienced the same battery issues.  Fortunately if it is within a year they will replace, but mine was about year and 1/2 so... I surely will not buy another one.

Reviews.Title: A lot to love, just a few tiny drawbacks...
Reviews.Author: Carla J. Patterson "I love reading and I'm al...
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of Amazon's 'try before you buy' offer and had the Kindle Fire for a month before having to pay for it.  I decided I would definitely want to keep it and paid the price (a quite reasonable one) happily once the month was up.  They gave me email warning that the time was approaching, by the way, which I thought was a good idea.  Lots of times, people forget they have to make a decision on some time-limited offer and only pay the price because they missed the deadline.  It's a good business model to make sure people mean to buy the Kindle rather than regret having bought it by accident.The Kindle Fire has much to love about it!  In many ways, it's easier to use than my iPad (which is saying something!) and, for that reason, as well as the fact that it can read e-books to me, that I wanted to keep it.  I have a cervical spine injury which makes it difficult (if not impossible) for me to read bound paper books without a great deal of pain but I have always been an avid reader.  I would do almost anything to be able to read several books a week like I used to.Along came e-books and audiobooks to save the day!  The thing is, anything that keeps me riveted intellectually or emotionally, leads to the same awful pain since I don't move much while in my head.  So, e-books must be kept to a minimum and audiobooks used more often.  The problem there is that audiobooks are usually only available for the most popular books and, truth be told, they are often not my favorites.  Luckily, most books I want to read are available as e-books so what I needed was something which would let me read e-books with my eyes as well as hear them with my ears.  The Kindle Fire is the first solution to this conundrum I've found which works well enough to suit me.The electronic voice which Kindles use to read documents and e-books to you is remarkably good.  It's not perfect, but it's good enough that I can bear hearing it read to me.  It does well with grammatical pauses and the pacing of the reading is good.  It stumbles over acronyms (like CIA, NSA, RIP - anything written without periods after each letter) or things like 'shhhh!'.  In those cases, it says 'sigh-ah', 'en-sah', 'rip' rather than initials, or 's' 'h' 'h' 'h' 'h' instead of 'shhhh'.  But, once I got used to that, I was able to understand everything the voice said.I am also assuming that Amazon, being Amazon, will continue to improve the voice(s) and the current one is good enough for the interim while I also look forward to whatever innovations are next.The size and weight of the Kindle Fire are amazingly useful to me and the screen size is good for reading and playing games.  The resolution of the screen is excellent.  It holds a charge really well - lasts for a really long time if it's in use, or turned off.It took me a while to get used to navigation on the Kindle Fire as I was used to the intuitive layout and navigation on Apple products.  They still win in that department.I am an Amazon Prime member and have been for many years.  I was looking forward to borrowing a book a month using the Kindle but, I have to admit, that it's been less than fun to find books I could borrow in the Kindle Lending Library.  Most of the things I want to borrow aren't eligible.  OTOH, it may help me expand my knowledge of authors I like through forcing me to choose between authors I'm not aware of yet.  lol  (I always see the silver lining.)The Wi-Fi is good but my husband had to give it a dedicated router before it was consistently great.  We had an old one lying around so that was okay for us but I hope people without that luxury (a spouse or oneself in IT) don't find it annoying that one can't always get a connection.The mini-USB charger works well.  It's easy and comfortable to watch videos and films or TV series on the Kindle Fire (the resolution is as good as on my iPad and iPhone - high praise).  As would seem obvious, anything to do with Amazon works the best.  Using other sites (like Netflix, Xfinity, or channels like HBO, ABC, etcetera) isn't always as simple.

After Thanksgiving, when all the Kindled went on sale, I bought a Kindle Fire HD.The library book rental has been a total bust. My library has a program to download to the Kindle and the two are incompatible. I will download it and nothing happens or I'm prompted to download it again. After wasting an hour of my time trying to make the systems work, I now stop by the library to pick up books to read.The Silk browser is constantly stopping and I have to restart the Kindle.  Today it decided to quit working entirely as I was watching a video on YouTube. I'm asked if I want the tabs restored, I say yes, it takes me to the Silk browser which is still locked up.On the whole, I'd recommend you buy an Apple product.  The Kindle isn't worth the hassle.

Grandmothers get to spoil their grandchildren and this was the perfect opportunity.  Tears were dried when my grandson helped to order his brand new Kindle Fire. Reviews.Title: Best entry-level tablet
Reviews.Author: LoveMyKindle! "Amy"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to replace a higher cost tablet with this one, you'll probably be disappointed.  If this is your first tablet or you're looking to buy one for your child, you will be very impressed.  After playing around with different entry level tablets, this one definitely takes the cake.  The HD display, sensitive touch screen capabilities (no tapping 2 or 3 times to get it to do what you want) and speed sets this above any other that I've tried in this price range.Pros -*Web pages load quickly on the Silk browser*Touch screen is very easy to use*Price*Clear display*Parental Controls (love kindle freetime!)*Easy to use user interface*Can store things on the cloud to free up space*Many options for covers (just make sure you buy the right kind, the power and volume buttons are on the back of the kindle rather than the edges, so you need a cover that leaves them accessible)Cons -*Tends to lock up while in sleep mode (have had this happen 8-10 times in the 3 months I've had it)*No spot to add an sd card to create extra storage (you do have the cloud but that's worthless if you're not connected to the internet)*No built in microphone (so if you're using skype or an app like duolingo, you will have to connect your own microphone, if that's even possible, haven't tried)*Smaller appstore than google play (there are a few things I wish I could get that just aren't available!)Despite the Cons, I would still recommend this to anyone for their first tablet or for their children.  Just learn how to restart it when it's locked up while sleeping so that you don't freak out thinking it's dead :)

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Julie Johnson
Reviews.Content: This model was just what I needed. I wanted a book reader, but not a tablet. It's nice to be able to check email if I need to  - but I'm not one to spend my time on apps, so I didn't need the full HD version and didn't want to be tempted to watch movies instead of reading.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding performance, hindered by Amazon software
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: From a hardware standpoint, this device is exceptional; great wifi reception, super clear and brilliant image, outstanding sound for the size, and ergonomically correct. Unfortunately, Amazom opted for putting a really short leash on it, restricting access to many great apps and content.  A lot of great Android apps will never be available on this device, and that's a shame, given the devices capabilities. Another very annoying thing; even if you have Amazon Prime, when in FreeTime, you can't access prime free content unless you pay for the FreeTime Plus, thus negating the "free" content included with your Prime membership. It's too bad Amazon can't be content with giving you easy direct access to their digital store, but had to try and force you into buying extra services. Great device, but please remove the leash!

Reviews.Title: I Love My Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Content: I love everything about my Kindle Fire It was simple to set up and super easy to use.My only criticisms are that I wish it had the paper white lighting option and I wish I could use the Google chromecast. I recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Buy a Kindle Fire HD 7

The graphics are great and it is user friendly. I am in my forty's and have hard time with change, but i would recommend Kindle to everyone.

Reviews.Author: Elena
Reviews.Content: I loved the platform and price... But my first Kindle tablet stopped charging, and the replacement only lasted a year before the screen gave out. The amazon team was nice and very prompt on sending the replacement, unfortunately the quality of the product isn't satisfactory to my standard.It works great if you have Amazon Prime and use that for your video platform. Now more and more apps are available so that is also good. Thats why it gets an extra star.Life cycle of a 12-14 months (just over the waranty) is unacceptable, especially considering that I took good care of it.

Reviews.Title: An Issue with Kindle fire Book Store
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I loved my first Kindlefire!  I particularly enjoyed shopping for new books and purchased frequently.  It was even better than an actual store because I could not only read a synopsis but I could access customer ratings and reviews which were very helpful.  Scanning through long lists of titles was something I commonly did while looking for new authors or titles in subjects of interest.  I could click on a title, peruse it, then essentially put it back on the shelf if it did not appeal to me.  With a back arrow I could revert to where I left off in the list of titles and continue to search.  This function was much like the placesavers our elementary librarians use to hold your place , while looking for one of interest, so that whatever you had select can be returned to its rightful place.  On the new Kindlefire HD when you replace the book you are thrown back to the very first book on what might be a 200 book list.  Very annoying and time consuming, not to mention a waste of batteries.  I liken this to being dragged back to the bookstore door every time you choose on of the shelf.  I liked everything else about it.  When I contacted Kindle support I was told it was a software problem and that they would work to resolve it.  They anticipated about 5 days. After two weeks of waiting and no change I returned the Kindle.  I'm planning on upgrading hoping that might help but so far I'm not finding one to meet my needs.  Hope future Kindles remedy this!

Reviews.Title: this was a gift and the 10 year old LOVES it!

Reviews.Content: I have an older kindle fire and I still love mine but I bought this for a special girl turning 10 years old (cousin) and she just loves it and uses it all the time.  she is teaching me new stuff for it too!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire-great price & easy to navigate
Reviews.Author: maria vaughn
Reviews.Content: I really love & enjoy my kindle fire. It's easy to navigate,great apps for kids & adults alike & excellent customer service support.

Reviews.Title: Intuitive software, ready to go right out of the box!
Reviews.Author: E. Williams "dew drop"
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th Kindle.  Finally decided to get the Fire for my 20-something daughter who, unlike her peers, is NOT technologically savvy but needs a tablet for an online course she's taking.  She is in love with Kindle Fire HD.  It was ready to go right out of the box.  The only thing she needed to do was connect it to our wifi, and she was off...surfing the web, playing games, watching movies.  This morning she took it to the gym so she could play music while she works out.  She says it's the perfect tablet for someone like her.  I can't rate this on all the technical aspects, I can only say that it's marvelous for the user who will be using it for every day stuff like web browsing, games, movies, music, email, etc.

I bought a 99 cent guide which is stored on the Kindle; it is a bit too basic. Eight GB of storage gets used up pretty quick by a seven year old.

Reviews.Title: Happy with the Kindle Unhappy with the service policy.
Reviews.Author: J.G. Hamelin
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle just before the holiday. Unfortunately for me I experienced a problem with it. Amazon was quick to replace and replace it they did. Unfortunately even though I bought the extended service plan I failed to read the fine print that states that should there be a problem or defect with your Kindle Amazon reserves the right to replace it with a remanufactured unit. Hardly what I would call fair. I feel that if I had wanted a remanufactured Kindle I would have bought one. I guess the old axiom is still very true. LET THE BUYER BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: Great product

Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet it is my first one and the colors are amazing the photos look real good.

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Love the Kindle. I had a small problem with the Kindle and Amazon help me to solve the problem very quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great discount price

Reviews.Content: I was glad to get this on sale and it meets all my reading and internet needs, as well as gaming.  Screw Apple ! :)

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Kimmy
Reviews.Content: I love that I can read all of my books without the benefit of a lamp and that I can search the web whenever I want. I also like the fact that I can put a lock on it. Overall money well spent!

Reviews.Title: My son loves it; I kind of like it...?
Reviews.Author: Safety Guy
Reviews.Content: This was a purchase for my son so I could use Kindle Freetime and allow him his own device without worry about him making accidental purchases and/or getting on the internet without me knowing.  For this purpose, the device is great!  Apple doesn't allow this kind of personalization for a kid user and my son loves all the PBS, Disney, and other apps that Free Time gives you access to.Now the downside, if I was using this device (coming from an Apple iPad 4th gen) it would drive me nuts.  Let me explain why...it is slow compared to the iPad.  Now maybe that's not a fair comparison because of price points and what the devices are primarily for but I could not switch to a Kindle as my primary device as I use it for work (enterprise email, etc) and this just wouldn't meet my needs.So let me end with its a great entertainment device, great device for kids (parental controls), and has a great price!  Just not for those power-users that need Apple's (or Samsung's if you like the Galaxy tablets) specs and power.

I love the idea of being able to take it with me where ever I go. I have downloaded books and just put it in my purse to read whenever I am in a waiting situation or any spare time.

Reviews.Title: Computer is great

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!!

Reviews.Content: AWESOME !!!! NOW IF I CAN FIGURE OUT ALL THE FUNCTIONS IT HAS TO OFFER I WILL BE GOOD .

Reviews.Title: Lack of Storage Space
Reviews.Author: Cristian Ungureanu
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised when I got this in the mail, a whole day earlier than estimated (awesome). Everything is perfect, the display is awesome, I was really shocked when I played a video for the first time, and the sound quality was much better than my next gen iPad. I only have a few problems with it. The fact that when I purchased this product, it said it would have 8 GB available, when it only had at most 4.6 GB of free storage space. I understand the the OS take up space but why say it has 8 GB of free storage space, when it clearly doesn't. My last issue is with the app selection, and then fact that there's hardly any. I hope that will change as time passes, but as it is now I will most likely stick with my iPad when it comes to games and apps (not that I have any space on my kindle for them anyway).

Reviews.Title: Nice unit, why buy an iPad?
Reviews.Author: John Darling "Jack Point"
Reviews.Content: This is a small but very adequate tablet that is far superior to the regular Kindle.  It has all the browser capabilities of an iPad as well.

Reviews.Title: 2 months and it did not work
Reviews.Author: darla
Reviews.Content: After having this kindle for 2 months, it didn't charge anymore.  Since it was a "refurbished" kindle, there was nothing amazon could do but suggest I buy another "refurbished" kindle.  I THINK NOT!!  Lesson learned DO NOT BUY REFURBISHED!

Reviews.Title: Kindles are great, amazon not so much!
Reviews.Author: kfitz
Reviews.Content: I bought three of these.  2 for kids at Christmas and one for my wife just recently.  I like the kindle.  Kindles are great, but the way amazon handles the account info and viewing/sharing needs to be changed.  I set up a separate account for my kids so our libraries and amazon needs will not get crossed and to basically keep our stuff out of their stuff.  my wife's Kindle is under my account.  i have since become a prime member, which is great, but only one account can use the service without paying for it twice.Why not use one account for all 3 kindles?  I order a lot of stuff on amazon.  if i put my kids on my account so they can use prime, than they can easily see what i am buying as well as every single thing I have ever bought.  Imagine a 7 year old figuring out that every present Santa ever brought was bought and paid through dads amazon account.  Kindle free time is a solution, but is really limited to what amazon thinks is appropriate.  my children's schools send home interactive websites and online learning tools.  if using kindle freetime, you must log out of freetime to view any online content, which brings me back to the whole account ownership, sharing and purchasing.The "one click" purchasing amazon features is an absolute scam to get you to buy more stuff.  On the kindles you can enact parental controls which require you to enter a password to purchase.  on my laptop it takes just one wrong stroke of the crumby mouse pad or touch screen and within 2-3 seconds you own it.  Usually only finding out about it when you get the credit card bill.  Unless amazon comes to my house and shows me how to shut 1 click off, it can't be done.I love amazon and will continue to do business with them, but the way they have it setup now will ultimately make me purchase fewer items and services from them and force me to go to the competition.

Reviews.Title: 8GB?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Uncle Bo"
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 kindle's and the last one that I had was stolen So, I ordered the 7" Fire HDand was really excited about the purchase. When I received it I when into the storage and onlyhad 4.7GB's of space before I even put any of my items from the "cloud" on it!I do like the upgraded version but it doesn't have the space like the "Kindle fire" and no (text-to-speech)feature. Not upset just disappointed, I plan on returning it.

Reviews.Title: the power button
Reviews.Author: M.Matula
Reviews.Content: The power button is put in a horrible place. if you just bump it, it turns on and it wastes your battery. This is also not the device to buy if you want to primarily use it for reading. there is a horrible glare on the scene.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: frank smith
Reviews.Content: I like the Kindle for reading at night, but I was greatly disappointed to discover that I cannot read it on the beach or by the swimming pool--any place that has bright sun.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Dustin Hanigan
Reviews.Content: I would give the kindle fire hd 4 stars because it does not have an hdmi hookup. If it had that feature it would have gotten 5 stars. Also the screen while looking at a dark image has a little bit of light escape around a couple spots on the edges. I've read this is common and I probably shouldn't send it back in because I could get one that has worse light leakage than mine. Overall performance is great for this little tab. It's very easy to use. Much easier than any Windows tablet I've seen. I would say for the money it is definitely worth it, and I would happily buy another. Amazon being such a pleasure to work with tops it off.

Reviews.Title: Good value, know what you're getting.
Reviews.Author: Sir Aerokii "Video games and plushies and swo...
Reviews.Content: This is not the end all-be all of tablets, but for the capabilities and price it's not half bad. The screen is nice, it's very simple and easy to use for people of all skill levels and age ranges, and its light/fits nicely in most people's hands.Speaking of hands, on the other one, the operating system is based off of Android but it feels like it's being held back from doing all the cool stuff. Even if you pay to get rid of the lock screen ads, you can't change the lock screen to something custom YOU want it to be without doing some serious work in the file system that most people should NOT be doing. Also, no Flash. I like Flash! But that's not really within Amazon's control.It's still a nice tablet and I recommend it, but make sure you know what you're getting and what you need it to do vs. what it can do.

Reviews.Title: Not very impressed.
Reviews.Author: Allan G. Feldt
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Kindle and I must admit to disappointment with the improvements over earlier models.  The color is mostly irrelevant to me since I use it primarily for reading.  The controls usually provided are still there but they seem less easy to find than on earlier B&W;  Kindle models.  On top of that  the first instrument I received died after 40 hours of use.  The replacement is working ok so far but it seems to stall occasionally as well.  Maybe I'll get used to it, but so far I find my B&W; Kindle 2 for $67 much more reliable and user friendly than the fancier new ones at $137 and up.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet for my daughter
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Robbins
Reviews.Content: This tablet has a very clear and sharp picture, and at $120, it is a steal! My 10 year old was always downloading apps and games to my smart phone, and now she can download them to her kindle. She absolutely loves it! She can also watch Netflix on it, which she loves!

Reviews.Title: Overview of Kindle Fire HD 2013
Reviews.Author: Lizette Wiggins
Reviews.Content: I am using the Kindle periodically and enjoy having it as I am new to the tablet scene.  My disappointment if that the Kindle has at various time shut down while in use (battery life at 60%) which I don't believe that should be a factor.  Wish the sound was a bit higher.I don't like all of the advertising that pops up when on standby mode, but I am still learning the nuances but for now I am pleased for this tool.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: L W Dowdle
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product and works very well.  The cover works well as it turns the tablet on and off.  This is a great usefull product. I don't enjoy the pop-up ads, but I don't want to pay $15 to turn them off. I like the tablet overall and would still suggest it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Problems in the sun
Reviews.Author: Kristine Bruins
Reviews.Content: My only problem is I can't read my Kindle in the sun!  I could read my old Kindle in the sun!!??

Reviews.Title: I love this thing.
Reviews.Author: Sarah Khan
Reviews.Content: perfect for reading, games, or just plain passing time by, this thing is amazing, I wouldnt trade it for anything_ maybe a newer one lol

Reviews.Title: Great Value perfect tablet for our grandson
Reviews.Author: Desert Dweller "AZ Desert Dweller"
Reviews.Content: Our grandson is an avid reader and also likes to play games so a tablet was on his Christmas wish list this year.  After researching the various options, we selected the Kindle Fire HD 7".  On Christmas morning, he opened his gift and was thrilled.  We were instant rock stars.  The Kindle Fire is the perfect size, offers great quality and value and is an excellent tablet.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Bought as a auction item
Reviews.Author: T. Kemp
Reviews.Content: My husband has a Fire and he mostly plays games at night on it when he goes to bed.I find that the set up and navigation through the kindles is more cumbersome than a iPad. I myself own 2 iPads one full size and one mini. When looking to purchase a smaller tablet I considered the new Kindle Fire HDX but still went with the iPad mini and apples for apples at the price point the Mini was the same purchasing it in the Apple Refurbished storeThe ease in use and setup with the iPads is wonderful. I purchased on for my Mom and at 75yrs she uses it every day. FaceTime is the best thing ever and has made their going south for the winter much more bearable

Reviews.Title: Could not be happier.
Reviews.Author: Philip Grabenhorst
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this as a gift for my parents, and so far it could not have been better.  It is light enough that it works very well for reading (and netflix).  All of the apps that have been tried (angry birds, jw library, angry birds go, netflix, etc.) have worked flawlessly.  Thus, for its purpose (media consumption), and its price tag, one cannot complain.  :)

Reviews.Title: Very good device
Reviews.Author: terryfy
Reviews.Content: I enjoy my Kindle Fire .  Use it for everything.  Very happy to have it. I have recommended it to other people.

Reviews.Title: Winner
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Savolainen
Reviews.Content: Bought the Nook first, and I have an iPhone, so I was familiar with what the other two competitor's were offering. The Kindle has a better selection of books at better pricing. Very happy. Seamless interface. Easy to navigate. Wish it didn't have ads, but other than that it is superior in every way.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD`
Reviews.Author: Tammy Kaiser
Reviews.Content: I won this product as a promotion at work. It is not something I would have bought for myself. How did I ever live without it?? I use it daily...checking email, facebook, playing music, games, taking notes. Great product!!

Reviews.Title: disappointment with new Kindle
Reviews.Author: KLQ "doing it myself"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle keeps freezing up, then returns to the home page in the middle of reading.  You have to start again, and most annoying of all, it doesn't remember where it turned off so you have to scroll around until you find your last page.  I understand this is a common problem, and so far no solution seems to have worked.

Reviews.Title: Nerve racking many a day!
Reviews.Author: Cherry's wife "bacccked up!"
Reviews.Content: My Kindle won't work properly on certain websites, usually by not scrolling. Many times it will say Silk has stopped responding, would you like to wait and that will happen multiple times. The battery life is a joke! I pretty much have to keep the charger in at ALL times. Also many times I cant watch a video or even see a zoomed picture on a website, it will say plug-in not supported. I often get the message that something is not supported. It will tell me to download flash drive but when I try nothing happens!  I will be happy when I can afford a Windows tablet. I'll keep the kindle for reading only!

Reviews.Title: Wasted my money....worse user experience than Windows 8 .
Reviews.Author: Andrew F.
Reviews.Content: Got this for our kids primarily. It is a very poorly designed user interface. I can never remember where to swipe to get the menus, let alone where to go once I find the menu. Sad as it is to say, Windows 8 puts this to shame. The Amazon app/book/music store is very poorly integrated and hard to navigate too.It's great that it's cheaper than the iPad, but since it just sits and collects dust, that really doesn't matter.Get the iPad.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful purchase for 86 year old!
Reviews.Author: Paul Edwards
Reviews.Content: 5 of us great grandchildren went in together to buy this for our 86 year old grandmother. She grew up rural southern farm life - never touched a computer. It's amazing. She spends hours playing card games (solitaire, mahajong), she now has a Facebook account (haha the family is much better behaved with what they post now) and earlier this week she pulled up the app for a local news company to check the doplar radar! We do put the apps on her kindle for her - but she really uses the kindle and all of her apps and games by herself. I think she is proof of how user friendly this tablet is. She just touches whatever she wants - no moving and clicking a mouse. And if she gets stuck somewhere, all she has to do is touch the home screen icon. Yesterday she said she wanted to get an ancestry.com account..... I think we have created a monster :-)

Reviews.Title: A great upgrade to replace your kindle reader.
Reviews.Author: deepdiver57
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace my kindle reader and decided to try the Fire 7", It's easy to use, and I find myself using it as my "on the go" laptop. I find the screen a better size for my fat fingers than smart phones. The only things on the downside is the weight (compared to the reader) and the battery will need to be recharged more often.  P.

Reviews.Title: Sent it back
Reviews.Author: Wes McFee
Reviews.Content: -Web navigation is terribly clumsy on this device, including zoom, which is critical on such a small screen.-The device is designed to show advirtisements more than allow functional use of apps or features.-Received blackscreens repeatedly after clicking on apps, had to use customer support.  They were very responsive, but unable to resolve.-All in all, might be a good device for a very young child to play games, but its value in this world stops there.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Elaine Lawrence
Reviews.Content: I gave one of these to both my husband and my son-in-law.  They both love them.  However, it tends to shut down occasionally.

Reviews.Title: Can do so many things.
Reviews.Author: Nell Ericksen
Reviews.Content: I really like it, but my power is so slow, that I have to keep it plugged in all the time.  May be because I am in between two schools that use Wi-Fi all the time.  Going to talk to my internet provider to get some answers.

Reviews.Title: Its good for reading
Reviews.Author: Tommy
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this kindle for reading comics and graphic novels. Amazon made it kind of confusing by leaving the name of the HD and the actual upgrade from the HD is the HDX. So no dual cameras for skype and whatnot. The battery life is smaller and the processor is slow compared to other tablets. It does fulfill all of my comic reading, and quick game playing experiences, but if you want something more, I recommend the HDX.

Reviews.Title: amazong.
Reviews.Author: stauter
Reviews.Content: I rate this as 5 stars because it's out standing performance , and it handles tasks well I didn't expect it to be this good it is better then my iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: Its good but...
Reviews.Author: helen ag
Reviews.Content: I choose this rating because the product is good but i think there is something left on it.The appstore is so poor, you cant find any good app, i would give the kindle away without thinking it twice if someone offers me an android tablet just because of the apps.sometimes my kindle is turned off (not by me, by itself), and I have to do a hard reset to get it working again. The first time that happens i almost die, but now im used to it.another thing I hate is having to use the obligatory black background, i really really do hate that, as if it were a smartphone  from the stone era. You can buy a chinese android tablet with all the benefits of an ipad (includind the camera) and buy this tablet for twice the price and you do not get even a shoddy camera.The truth is that if I could turn back the time i had bought another tablet. but I understand that the kindle is a great device and has many benefits such as image quality, speed and that stuff.But this is just my opinion, if none of those things are going to bother you, then you can purchase a kindle and will be perfect for you

Reviews.Title: All my kids have one
Reviews.Author: RxMilner "RxMilner"
Reviews.Content: When did I become that guy? Not sure. We love the books and educational games (yes I call Minecraft educational).A few times one has reset for unknown reasons, but easy to use parental controls and other settings to limit content.RECOMMEND for parents with young kids!ALSO would add a "Jackery" or other portable charging device as these buggers only seem to be dead on that car trip or doctors appointment you want them to use if on!

Reviews.Title: Fragile?
Reviews.Author: Phil Berman
Reviews.Content: I liked this device.  I was getting used to it after a few weeks use.  When my protective enclosure for it arrive I took it out for a spin in the real world.  The first time I tried to use it with a student to demonstrate something it just died.  Four weeks, gentle use and it died.  Will I get it replaced?  I do not know.  I want a digital companion that is there when I need it.  This is a cheap device and so I got a cheap lesson.

Reviews.Title: Programmers beware
Reviews.Author: Terry Holdbrooks
Reviews.Content: The newest version, is not yet able to be flashed.  The bootloader is not yet unlocked, so you are going to be stuck with the default ROM.  If you want something you can flash and such, get a Nexus or a Nook.  However, I am rather fond of this product, and happy that I bought it.  My phone can serve as my Android, my Kindle is my library.

Reviews.Title: Like any new gadget, fun to play with!
Reviews.Author: Adina
Reviews.Content: Fun to play with, but having trouble when I put music on through USB and it does not play. However, Kindle does save files so you can see them on your computer when you plug the Kindle in. Unless you literally use the Kindle to download your music from amazon cloud, it will not play. My only issue. Other than that, reading, lighting, and everything else is great. Even gaming.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly great!
Reviews.Author: Aimee Jolie
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my mom as I didn't want the expense of an iPad, and I was actually blown away by how great it is.  She is on the internet all the time now, quickly responding to emails, and she loves reading books digitally.  It's smaller than a regular iPad and very user-friendly.  Totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Its Good
Reviews.Author: Spokane2819
Reviews.Content: Over all great product. However not as fast as my note 3.  Great deal for the price. Would recommend to family or friends

Reviews.Title: issues were resolved
Reviews.Author: Dagni
Reviews.Content: After a month of very light use, the Kindle stopped working.  It would freeze at the lock screen.  After more than 20 times of trying to do a reset on my own then a couple hours on the phone with customer service and them having me reset it at least about 6 more times, they told me they'd need to send me a replacement Kindle.  The replacement was sent via expedited shipping and arrived in 2 days.  Customer service resolved my concerns quickly and I am pleased with how they handled everything, although I am a bit disappointed the first kindle broke.

Reviews.Title: Great device, but not meant to last.
Reviews.Author: Bruce Hicks "Bruce Hicks"
Reviews.Content: When the device performs correctly, it's wonderful. That being said, the device starts to have issues mysteriously after falling off of warranty. My kindle stopped accepting a charge after about 13 months of use. The best amazon could do was offer me a refurbished device for $127. Lots of money is spent adding content (movies, music, and books) to kinndle devices. For it to poop out after 1 year of use, in my opinion, makes the device not worth it.

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: Kathy Brown
Reviews.Content: It's compact. I can take it anywhere with me. However there are some apps I can't download to my kindle. And I can't download cloud drive.

Reviews.Title: Will not purchase more, as I had planned on before.
Reviews.Author: Alex M. Nusser
Reviews.Content: Always losing signal. Pausing and quitting constantly. Have to power down at least several times while playing a simple 20 minute children's t.v. Show. Disappointed to say the least. Already returned our first Kindle, for issues that our current one is also having.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: The best device ever. I can read again. My RA made it hard to hold a book for very long.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Laura Robins
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire! I find my self not able to put it down. I can download books from my library for free and I'm reading like crazy now. I am able to take it everywhere and it is so compact compared to a book.

Reviews.Title: Grad Student with Hundreds of Pages of Reading per Week
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: For school, we have a ton of scanned articles and books to read through for each class.  The Kindle Fire has been a God-send, it is easy to navigate in and around poor quality scans.  The Kindle will automatically sharpen blurry lines or words, and it's nice to have my study music playing on Pandora while I'm doing my reading.  I also take breaks on Words with Friends during study sessions and the best part is that all of these are on the same tablet.  The biggest part for me, however, is that it is much easier on the eyes than my computer screen, or an iPad and with the amount of reading I do, that is significant.  It can be a bit sluggish when you first turn it on and some of the issues with playing Flash were frustrating but for what I need it for it works perfectly.  It is a great reader and a great product!

Reviews.Title: As A Gift
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My husband was hounding me for always 'playing' on my tablet. I purchased him the Kindle Fire HD when it was on sale as a Christmas gift. Now we play on our tablets together. Easy for a person to learn how to use. I would recommend this tablet.

Reviews.Title: For the most part good
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: Well I bought the kindle for my wife for Christmas and when we registered it ,on the kindle itself it is saying Dons kindle, we tried to change it and we cant figure it out , the instructions aren't very clear when you want to change things and when you down load some things you cant find it and also when on face book you cant seem to watch some clips that  some people post.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Evelyn P.
Reviews.Content: It works great.much better and lighter than original fire.  I kept the last star because I would like to use other apps like Apple

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire provides excellent value for quality
Reviews.Author: Ronil Patel
Reviews.Content: I am the previous owner of a Google Nexus 7 which I gave to my brother because I didn't think that I needed a tablet in my life. However, I soon began to miss the ability to use apps like Pocket (which has the TTS feature that I use everyday on my Kindle) as well as the ability to quickly search things without having to turn on my computer. In addition, I realized how much I love to use my Kindle tablet in the gym to or to some light browsing before I head to bed. Overall the quality and durability of the Kindle Fire HD 7 is excellent and provides the best value for a average tablet user.

Reviews.Title: Unable to use for the purposed I bought it
Reviews.Author: blondie
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle fire in order to be able to get the app for FirstIssue. After the purchase I learned that the app had been removed from Amazon so I was unable to purchase First Issue. I was very disappointed to lern that this app will most likely nevery be available.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: 5 STAR APP
Reviews.Content: I really like the Kindle Fire better then my Ipad. It is easier to carry at work, and it dose everything I need it to do. Wish I had gotten one sooner. I have had it for a couple month and so far I haven't had any problems with it or any of the apps for it.

Reviews.Title: love
Reviews.Author: Cupcake
Reviews.Content: Favorite Christmas present-hands down! This far exceeds my expectations. I love that in books it not only tells me percent completed but  numbers associated with paper copies. This is has great for bible study so that we can all still turn to a corresponding page. It also calculated the time it will take me to complete a chapter maybe I'm just a nerd but I love this!

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended, well worth the price, easy to use and navigate, well made
Reviews.Author: Gift Card "Review Nation"
Reviews.Content: A little socking stuffer for hubby for his man cave and now I lost him, well, most of the time when I'm busy. He is still attentive when needed. Anyway, he loves it, keeps him up to date on his emails, fb, music, apps, books, movies, etc...He even downloaded a Netflix app.Great quality, was surprised for the price, durable, and easy to handle. Perfect size for travel, and large enough to see the screen. Sleek design, looks really nice.Highly recommended. I might have to get one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: love the water
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my mom but as soon as I turned it on the set it up with her, it kept powering down in the middle of set up. We charged it fully and all the basic stuff of course. After 10 plus unsuccessful attempts to complete set-up, I contacted the seller for a refund. It was a quick and easy process and I was refunded in full in less than one week. I would not purchase a Kindle in the future nor recommend purchase.

Reviews.Title: Why Not?
Reviews.Author: The Facts
Reviews.Content: - Unbelievable value when you consider a large use of tablets is for media consumption (basically technically versatile toys for kids and adults).  This tablet pulls this off beautifully, with intuitive controls and a beautiful display.  Yeah, iPads are a nice product and tap into Apple's ecosystem (iTunes, etc.).  However, unless you really need the Apple ecosystem, don't get dragged into the "if you get a tablet, there is no other option than a iPad" syndrome or the "every other kid in school has an iPad so my kid needs one too" syndrome.  This tablet can do so many things well with the exception of tapping into Apple's ecosystem.  You will save yourself hundreds of dollars.  Just visit Amazon's app store to ensure they will have the apps you are looking for before purchasing.- Save your money and get the version with ads.  It is completely unobtrusive and only shows up on the lock screen when you first turn the tablet on or wake it.  Furthermore, the ads are in high definition and really help show what this tablet's screen is capable of.

Reviews.Title: Greatest purchase for price ever
Reviews.Author: Laurie C. Kruczek
Reviews.Content: Can't get enough of how well these work.  They do everything you need except your dishes and laundry, I swear.  Our kids each have one and use them for everything, too.  Best purchase price out there and excellent quality.

Reviews.Title: Expected user friendly
Reviews.Author: mary rusticus
Reviews.Content: I wanted a Kindle for reading purposes.  Decided to upgrade to Fire to have additional benefits.  I find KF difficult to navigate.  Icons aren't very helpful.  I slap and tap and find myself in other apps that I don't want.  Then I can't get out of them.  I expected it to be more user friendly.  I do like the size and portability.  If I had it to do all over again, I could definitely live without it.

Reviews.Title: A book by any other name . . .
Reviews.Author: lonebeaut "solitary dancer"
Reviews.Content: The resident techies have pretty much reviewed to death the bells and whistles of this baby, so I won't go there.  What I want to do in my review is wax philosophical about exactly why a Medicare-qualifying,  library card-toting, printed book-hoarding, lousy-visioned quasi-Luddite would buy a slippery, metal-and-plastic, skinny-minny, teeny-screened Kindle.Why?  Well,  I've had Prime for the past few months, and with it I get one free borrowed book per month that I hadn't been availing myself of.  Don't like to waste those bennies.  So I've been thinking about this a while.  Not to mention that I just read the whine by George Packer in the New Yorker (to which I subscribe, to my occasional chagrin) which accused CEO Jeff Bezos and his relentless.com of single-handedly destroying the publishing world as we've known it by walmartizing books (the ultimate insult, to an East Coast liberal).  Having been a loyal Amazon customer (off and on) since the early aughts, I immediately took umbrage.  Packer pushed me over the edge.  I  ordered a Kindle.  There are worse things to do with discretionary income. I'm a liberal too, and it's my ardent belief that democratizing books--making it easier for people to read, learn, think--is not an evil plot at all.  Besides, Mr. Bezos's long-time wife is a novelist.  How could he possibly think of books as nothing but widgets?So back to my new Kindle Fire HD 7".  I was planning to swing conservative and just get a basic Kindle reader, but my computer-savvier  partner twisted my arm to order a more tricked-up model with more cool stuff included, along with an AmazonBasics stylus, I might add, to avoid the smudgies.  For the last couple days, I've been storing it in a spare makeup case enrobed in bubble wrap because I fear my fumbly fingers will drop the Fire before the faux leather Fintie Folio protective plain brown wrapper that I just ordered arrives.I really think that all books should be free.  Good ones impart knowledge, information, even wisdom, in whatever form they happen to be.  I have an enormous number of print books collected over many years that will stay with me until I die.  I'm also a regular library patron and will continue to be.  A lifetime ago, I did a gig as a schoolteacher/librarian in a third-world country, waiting months for boxes of books to arrive from American donors.  I can only imagine that it must be so much easier for needy students nowadays to get their hands on the written word, with the awesome resources of the Internet, devices like the Kindle and standard computers, and websites like Amazon.com available to them.UPDATE 2/24/14:  I've been playing with this Kindle for about a week, now with a spiffy and protective Fintie covering, and I've gotta say that the learning curve for some of its functions is a bit steep.  I spent quite a bit of time trying to figure out how to bring up the 500,000+ books that Prime members can borrow in the Kindle Owners Lending Library.  Even visited the Kindle forum as well as watching a few instructional videos.  Every Kindle owner seems to have her pet method of getting there from here, and I'm still learning.  I almost considered returning the thing to Amazon the other day out of frustration, but I'm going to hang in there.  My senior brain just takes a little longer to pick up stuff.One question.  What's with the two dictionaries gratuitously stashed in my Kindle library?  Just curious,  Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great  Companion
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: This item was a Christmas gift. I've ow ed it for over a year and it has been a wonderful companion. I borrowed books from the library. The kids played games during trips in the car. We've watched movies on Netflix and surfed the internet to complete homework assignments. A must have for this little trooper is a case to protect it and double as a stand when you want to relax while  watching videos.Recently it's been acting weird. On a full charge it will shut down and tell me the battery is not charged when I turn it  back on. When I restart it again the correct battery capacity will show. This is beginning to occur more frequently as the days go by. I guess it's getting tired after constant use.

Reviews.Title: Works great for Mom
Reviews.Author: nerdfighter
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my elderly mother.  She is getting up there in the years and her eyesight is not what it used to be.  She has macular degeneration and can not read the small text in the regular printed books.  With the kindle she can set the font to a larger size and also adjust the back ground color.  This has enabled her to read again.  She has downloaded a lot of the free books from amazon and has used the lending library.  She uses it primarily as a reader, not so much for web browsing or movies.  She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Mandy W
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my Kindle Fire HD.  I have been wanting one for over a year.  I bought this when it was on sale and my only regret is that I probably should have gotten one with more GBs.  The screen color is great.  I use it as an e-reader as well as surfing the web.  I also have games and books for my children.  I have downloaded several free e-books from Amazon.  My kids have Nook Colors as well and I definitely prefer the Kindle Fire HD over the Nook.  I am not a "techy" person, but it definitely suits my needs and I have found it very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Kimberly V.
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these as gifts for my kids.  Both of my kids had the older gen and have gotten several years of great use out of them so I knew buying the newer version would be a good investment.  My kids LOVE their Kindles.  My son who's 8 loves downloading games and books while my daughter who is 5 enjoys downloading educational games and watching movies with my Prime membership.The display is crisp and clear with vivid colors.  The sound is great.  The thinner profile and lighter weight was a bit of an odd transition for the kids but they got use to them rather quickly.  I liken it to trading in your old flip phone for a thin, sleek smart phone, it feels weird at first but once you get use to it, it's great!I love the fact that the Kindles are resilient.  They have taken a beating and have held up exceptionally well AS LONG as they are in their cases.  My daughter dropped her older version while she was going down the brick stairs with the cover open and of course it cracked the display.  It was and is still usable but taught her a valuable lesson for when she got her new Kindle Fire HD 7", she now knows to always walk with it closed in it's case and only use it when seated.I love the new power adapter/cord that comes with this version.  The older one had a tendency to have issues with connectivity due to internal soldering of the port.  This version seems to be very well made in comparison.Overall i'm very happy with our purchase and my kids have had countless hours of enjoyment.  I highly recommend Kindle Fire HD's to all my friends with kids.  I feel that it's a great alternative to a more expensive "tablet" such as an IPad and provides my kids with the same opportunity to play games, read books and provides them with hours of activities during long road trips or Doctor's visits. Really a great investment for our family and a purchase i'd make again!

Reviews.Title: Senior Citizens and Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: PS Wiwel
Reviews.Content: I am a senior citizen that has little patience for the electronic age.  However, I want to be able to read books with larger print so that is why I purchased it.  I had great trouble hooking it up to my ISP and had to work with them several times to get the settings right.  I don't like that AMAZON tracks my reading preferences.  But I do like the email feature.  I guess I will just have to get used to it.  I really wish that I had someone at your help desk that knows how to help us older folks with more patience and slowly lead us through the setup.  I think it would appeal to more older folks if there was someone at Amazon who knew how to deal with them especially those who have no family with electronic knowhow to figure things out for them.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Colleen Evans
Reviews.Content: Not much more to say except that it does what I need.  Easy to move around and the screen colors are very crisp.  I even bought Tech Armor screen protector and to me it did not dull the screen.

Reviews.Title: amazing reader...ads overload
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I gave this 3 stars because they add ads on unlock screen and between opening apps. I had no idea it had this when I bought it and to get rid of them you have to pay amazon $15. I had the old school first gen kobo so this is fantasric. Apps are good but not a large variety as Google play. Books you already have that are mobi are super easy to put on and if they are epub just convert them with calibri on your PC and transfer them. You cal also transfer videos over but they show up under photos. Page turns on books are super fast and love the HD screen quality. Just an FYI this does not come with an instruction Manuel to do anything because I'm guessing they expect you to buy all books but I DL them all for free through a torrent. So minus the ads its a great e reader with all the we features as a tablet

Reviews.Title: No instructions with it...
Reviews.Author: Kathleen B White
Reviews.Content: Good gift to me at Christmas. But it took going to Best Buy to be walked through registering it and learning the basics. This seemed a useless waste of time when written instructions would have been greatly useful.

Reviews.Title: Best overall tablet!!! I use it for everything
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I ve had this tablet for 2 years now pretty much since the HD version came out and i must say it is my saving grace and mybest friend! I take it everywhere I have never read so much in my life i love the books and how cheap they are! I have magazines on my kindle, games, apps you name it !!! A MUST HAVE for any age!!!

Reviews.Title: So Much Better than my 2 year old Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: jen804
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle! Lots more features, clear picture, great sound! The $109 deal I got for it was the best part!

Reviews.Title: Bought this as a gift for my wife....
Reviews.Author: Photo Al
Reviews.Content: I purchased the original Kindle for my wife a few years ago and she loves reading from it. It began to show it's age and give her some minor issues so I decided to give her a Kindle upgrade for her birthday this year.After she became accustomed to the Fire HD she loves it. She likes the fact that she can read, browse the web and play a few games all on the same device.Her only complaint is the glare from the screen in certain situations, overall she's happy with it.

Reviews.Title: fire fodder
Reviews.Author: Kerensky "ak"
Reviews.Content: The problem is they become practically worthless after one year with Amazon's annual upgrade. A good device especially with Amazon services.

Reviews.Title: It meets our needs
Reviews.Author: Dee Kay
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize it didn't have a camera but we don't need one.  Love to play solitaire on it and other games.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Meokinnc "Nana"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 for gifts last year and two of the new model this year. Then went and bought a new one for myself when I used one of newer models for me. I just love these fabulous little "machine". Yup not a real computer person but it does everything. I pick up my mail, go on face book, share books with friends, email, read my books.... I love it!!!! Ready to move up to the bigger model.

Reviews.Title: My 3rd KINDLE
Reviews.Author: Tiger
Reviews.Content: I started with a reader then bought a Kindle FIRE and gave the reader to my Mom. I loved the Kindle FIRE so much that I gave it to my Mom too and bought my 3rd one - the Kindle Fire HD! YOU CAN'T BEAT THE PRICE!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD7"
Reviews.Author: Deanna Oakley "BookBug"
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this, I have one for my self and I am more than happy with it.  She likes hers to read, watch movies and television shows.

Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle
Reviews.Author: Carol Kaminer
Reviews.Content: I have had the basic kindle for 3 years and loved reading books on it.  I was worried that I would not like the Kindle Fire as much.  I am not a "techi" and am not fond of all the hoopla with electronics.  But I am learning to love this model.  Glad I took a chance.

Reviews.Title: Good product, clear screen
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Does what it is supposed to do, needs storage options for large books, to remove and replace with other items

Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE HD 7"
Reviews.Author: chacha
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle for Christmas from my daughter and youngest son.First thing I noticed was how much lighter it was than my old tablet.I don't like them way it SHUTS DOWN while writing emails, playing games etc. It is also hard to unlock. I am very disapointed in it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: cynthia k gialanella
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this purchase.  I am attached to it and can't put it down.  Had one minor glitch wherein the screen jumpted back to the floating kindlefire page and I couldn't get it to turn off or go away or do anything.  Read online how to reboot it by holding down the on/off button for 20 seconds and it seemed to do the trick.  Other than that, it works great. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: amazing from amazon the BEST tablet hands down!!!
Reviews.Author: Kiblers'n'Bits
Reviews.Content: The graphics are amazing the sound is crisp and loud it is light, fast, and great quality and did I mention the best part the price it a awesome value I love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Laurie Swain
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Kindle Touch and really love the new device.  The color is great and the price was right.  I added a keyboard case and am good to go when I travel.  I don't mind the special offer pop ups.

Reviews.Title: Best Gift Ever!
Reviews.Author: Smart Shopper FL
Reviews.Content: My kindle was given to me as a Christmas gift from my family and was a total surprise.  From the moment I opened it and got it set up I loved it.  I was able to use it right our of the box with no complicated set-up steps.  I love the wi-fi access which allows me to access the internet and email.  I wasn't sure if I would enjoy reading e-books on it, but I really enjoy it.  I rarely read paperbacks any more.  I have downloaded over 50 books and enjoy having so many choices at my finger tips.  It is convenient to take it with me to appointments and not have to take along anything else.  I thought I would surely miss being able to highlight in the books, but I soon learned that highlighting is available on the kindle.  I like taking notes when I read, so I downloaded a free notes app that work wonderfully for that purpose.  Both of my email accounts are accessible as well as Facebook. I have nothing but good things to say about this product and I would highly recommend it.  It offers what I need and much more.

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: Missy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 9yr old for her birthday. Although it does not have a camera, she isn't concerned with that at all. She wanted the Nabi but after looking at the reviews, we decided to go with the Kindle and I am glad we did. I do wish the parental controls were more specific so I could adjust certain things, but I do realize the Kindle isn't made specifically for children. Overall, I would get it again and my daughter enjoys it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire HD
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Bright display; rapid downloads.  An excellent basic unit.  Highly recommended.  Have used the unit for one month with no problems.  Has met all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: SAME OLD CHARGING ISSUES AS THE ORIGINAL!
Reviews.Author: Sandy Cens
Reviews.Content: I had bought my daughter the original kindle fire, 5 months later we had to return it with best buy and they upgraded FOR NO COST to the HD because of all the charging port issues, 6 months later the new hd did the same thing and unfortunately Best Buy could no longer help because their terms with Amazon changed. We contacted Amaon and their CSR said there was nothing they could do because Best Buy exchanged it. So now my daughter is without a Kindle. I am so disappointed with Amazon for not helping. I will be putting in a report with the BBB

Reviews.Title: Bought it for my wife.
Reviews.Author: Kennyjll
Reviews.Content: I bought this device for my computer illiterate wife. I taught her how to use it, which was fairly easy, and she hasn't hardly put it down since. My daughter liked it so much she bought one for each of her two children ages 10 and 6. They both love it. I would recommend this to everyone. And the price was also right.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: MIAMI VICE "SONNY CROCKETT"
Reviews.Content: Got this for my daughter and she loves it. I love it cause of the price. I have a ipad mini and this is almost as good in my opinion. Yes the ipad has a little bit better interface but for the price this tablet was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: LSH
Reviews.Content: I have'm had my computer on for days.  I bought the Kendle Fire cor games, books.  But I have been using it for all my computer needs.  Another amazon hit!

Reviews.Title: LOVE MY KINDLE!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: When my other KINDLE would no longer charge, this was my replacement.  It has a few new features that I like and much easier access to the internet.  I find myself reaching for this KINDLE much more than my old one because of the ease.  I check my email, post to Facebook and do many internet searches instead of pulling out my laptop.  When using my old KINDLE, I pretty much just read.  I haven't figured out how to print from it yet.  The description said that you could so I'll be disappointed if that's not true. But so far, I love it. 5 stars all the way!

Reviews.Title: love, love, love!
Reviews.Author: LB
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to this kindle when Amazon was running a promotion. So glad I did! I mostly wanted it for reading but I have started playing some silly games on it. The kindle is fun, compact but has a great screen. Great beginner tablet!

Reviews.Title: love my kindle!
Reviews.Author: angel hands
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle! I already said that but I really mean it! It's everything they say it is in their ads, believe it!

Reviews.Title: good backup
Reviews.Author: karen sandstrom
Reviews.Content: My computer was down for a week, but I was able to go on my kindle to check charge account and checking account statements as well as emails.  Main purpose for purchase was to read books, but also got into playing games with friends.  Great purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Karen Wiley
Reviews.Content: Daughter loves it.  Got a bluetooth keyboard and uses it to take notes in her college classes.  Much better then hauling around a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Rip off!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Gamache
Reviews.Content: My children 10,10 and 12 worked very hard all summer to each purchase one of these. When contacting amazon shortly after there warranty date, with all of them having the same problem. The port the charge hooks into is loose and the device will no longer charge. ALL 3 HAVE THE SAME PROBLEM! Which conclusion, should be accurate, shoddy production. However. Amazon is not willing to do anything for this nothing at all. They in turn offered a "deal" a refurbished one for $79.99 a discounted rate for our inconvenience. Which is total lies, any consumer can purchase one for that price on their website. They also offered a credit should we send all 3 back, when deciding to go that route, we were told that is actually not available. My children take very good care of items they purchase as they know I do not have the means to replace them. 2 thumbs down to you amazon and your customer service.

Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: scared reader
Reviews.Content: I had an black and white kindle and really liked it but I love the new Kindle Fire.  It is very easy to figure out how to use it.  If you have trouble you can use Help  or email, phone or chat with a  live person.  The internet system is Silk and is very fast.  It is  a lot faster then my laptop.I haven't downloaded any movies or TV shows yet but I will get around to it.  I play lots of games-it is so much more fun in color.  It fits in mypurse.  I also read lots of books.  I love that I can now see illustrations in color.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" HD
Reviews.Author: neville simpson
Reviews.Content: The unit is very nice with very brilliant picture.  However I was very disappointed because it did not come with a set of written instructions.  The manufacturer assumes that everyone in the universe can find the instructions hidden in the unit itself and then feel comfortable trying to read and understand the sequence of operating instructions specially if you have to constantly refer back to a diagram or picture by "sliding" the screens rather than being able to page back and forth with real hard copy.  I would be willing to pay a reasonable price for the hard copy of instructions.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 7" HD NEEDS A CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Scottie
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire HD is missing one thing...a camera. Otherwise it would be a 5 Star.I was surprised to find no camera.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed--a rare amazon misfire
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: I've had my kindle fire hd for 15 months now and was entirely satisfied with it until several weeks ago.  Suddenly the battery would not hold a charge.  Battery now goes from 100% charged to zero in about 24 hours when the device is not in use.  Called customer service, who were as helpful as could be under the circumstances, but the troubleshooter told me that the problem was most likely a hardware issue and, because I'm 3 months out of warranty, the only option was  they offered to sell me a USED replacement at a discounted price (though not very discounted, as it turns out--only about a $20 savings over the current list price).  No thank you.  I see no point in throwing good money after bad.  Next weekend I'm going to buy myself an i-pad mini, which is what I should have done in the first place.Look, I'm a huge amazon supporter.  I love the kindle paper white, am a prime member, and I'm even a stockholder in the company.  Until now I've never had any cause to complain with any amazon product or service.  But when I spend this much money on a product I think it's reasonable to expect it to last more than 15 months, and if it doesn't I expect more from amazon than to offer me a used replacement for $120.  I strongly recommend NOT buying this product.

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle hd!!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Pitts
Reviews.Content: Amazing tablet that fits my need to read, look at email,  Facebook  and surf the net.  Very pleased  with my kindle.

Reviews.Title: in love
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I am in love with my kindle fire HD I wanted it so I can read my books but I also use it to write my own book Amazon you rock I'm so looking forward to what's next my father who owns an iPad is not wanting one of these I have a laptop but I am always on my kindle actually I'm on it right now

Reviews.Title: so many things to love!
Reviews.Author: Jill Meendering
Reviews.Content: Love my new Kindle fire hd....  seriously, love it!  Holds a charge, durable, and I don't worry about fighting for laptop time.  I can do it all on my Kindle!

Reviews.Title: like using it. able check my email and listen to my music and read. does a great job hearing playing games and searching web.
Reviews.Author: Charles Todd
Reviews.Content: it is nice being able to search the web at places instead of caring my laptop everywhere. battery life. and playing games instead of using my phone to do it. amount of books able to down load.

Reviews.Title: Not my favorite
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: We have two kindle fire and one HD. we are constantly having to turn it off to connect to the internet .  we cannot watch  anything on it and the games dont download. it is not my internet service as they suggested when I called. I would actually like to replace the HD with a regular fire.

Reviews.Title: Easy and ready to go
Reviews.Author: Eric Napoli
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity now to compar with other tablets. But the ease and usefulness, perfect scale and high definition of everything is a wonderful asset to my every day life. There isn't a day I don't use and take it with me. I probably would have gotten more memory, but there is yet so much I can do with the memory I have. And an entire library sits in my palm.en

Reviews.Title: Too many issues, even for a low end tablet
Reviews.Author: Brian Curtis "bcc81475@comcast.net"
Reviews.Content: I love Amazon in general but I am not too impressed so far with this new Kindle Fire.We got this for the kids over a Nabi or other kids tablet because of our heavy use of Amazon video and my love of my Kindle Paperwhite and all that goes with that.However, my order started off originally as one for a year old, refurbished model.  It heated up so much I couldn't give it to my kids to play with.Amazon agreed to credit me the difference between that unit and this one, the 2013 model.I am noticing it also heats up, and we have a Origami case.I've had one instance where the link to the online bookstore wouldn't work.  (REALLY?!  ON A KINDLE??)We just had an instance when my kids were playing with the Kindle Free Time and the whole damn thing just reset.  I had to enter new passwords and relink to Amazon and everything.  During Free Time, the kids obviously don't have access to do any of this so how is it even possible??????Then, I think the final straw was the next time my child was using Free Time, it completely froze up and wouldn't let her do anything.At this point I hate to say but as much as I love Amazon, and their Customer Service in general, the Kindle Fire is a fail.Assuming Amazon can do nothing for me, I am going to sell it and get an ipad Mini.Enough is enough.This review only gets the two starts because Amazon has tremendous service and support.  But it doesn't do a lick of good if the product sucks.I love my Paperwhite and will continue to use Amazon but this is a real downer.  Not good.

Reviews.Title: bad battery, can't keep charge
Reviews.Author: Linda A. Lovett
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the product but I've been having issues with the battery. It doesn't seem to keep a charge and sometimes the prongs get bent therefore the charger won't fit. I have a co-worker who also has the kindle fire and hers won't even charge. This is a huge problem.

Reviews.Title: Was little dispointed
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: do not care about when you are reading with the kindle fire. It is easy for the pages to jump way back and try to find your place  If you are listening to the book, (often I do while driving). It is hard to bring up the voice. You do not have a choice of male or female voice. Just the female. I would prefer to have the choice. I am having a hard time to figure out how to turn off the Kindle from my web connection when I am home.  It stays on all the time. I do not like this. I would prefer like my old Kindle to have the access of having the web on or not.the picture is awesome. but be careful one little turn and the picture does switch quickly on you.

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Sarah Kearn
Reviews.Content: The title really says it all. The Kindle Fire HD is a great tablet, especially considering its price tag compared to similar tablets. I mostly use it to watch videos, and for that purpose, it is absolutely perfect; just had to download a video playing app for it to play .avi and .mp4 files and it was good to go. The screen size and resolution is pretty fantastic, and the battery lasts a reasonably long time.The Silk browser is alright, though it would be better if there was some sort of ad-blocking tool that could be installed to it (like AdBlock on Chrome and Firefox), as the ads can be distracting, annoying, and make some pages more difficult to read and/or take a long time to load. The browser is great if you need to do something quickly, like look up movie times or check Facebook pages, and I like that it keeps track of all of your opened tabs, even if you exit the browser or power down your Kindle.Lastly, I would love if Kindle Fire owners could customize the splash screen(s) that display(s) when you are unlocking the Kindle. Some of the images are nice, but the ones that are advertisements are decidedly not and can get really old after awhile. Yes, it is a small irritation, and perhaps trivial, but Kindle Fire HDs aren't exactly cheap (yes, cheaper than comparable tablets, but still not cheap), so is it really so much to ask for a little customization options? Just sayin'.Overall, I still give the Kindle Fire HD 5/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: liked it till it quit working
Reviews.Author: Janet Lamb
Reviews.Content: I I really liked my kindle until after only 26 days of use it quit working.  I did call IT and tehy coould not fix it over the phone so they are sending a new one .  We will see how this one works

Reviews.Title: best present ever
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Was given Kindle Fire a month ago and I use it so much it's in my dreams at night.  Initially I just read books on it, but now I use it for everything.  I play games, check my email, use social media and surf the web.  I have neglected my laptop shamefully because the Kindle is so much quicker and easier.  It also recharges amazingly quickly.  I keep it on my coffee table and whether I'm reading, watching tv, or talking on the phone, if I have a question about anything I just reach down, pick up the Kindle and find the answer.  It's also the perfect size and weight.  I have carpal tunnel syndrome but I can hold the Kindle in one hand for hours comfortably.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Vicki Fox
Reviews.Content: Love everything about it. No problems at all and I use it all the time.  I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Sadiqah Keys
Reviews.Content: I recently wrote the message below to Jeff Bezos, Amazon founder, using the link in the provided in the letter that is on the carousel. He invited purchases to keep in touch and let them know we like our Kindles. I wrote the message maybe a week ago and haven't heard a response yet.I've given it 1 star because of the recurring problems. If there were no problems I'd give it a 5.  I'm so over this Kindleexperience.Greetings!I wish I were writing to you with positive feedback about my Kindle Fire HD 7". My son bought it for me as a gift. He tried to encourage me to get an ipad instead, but after lots of research I thought this Kindle was perfect for me. I have already exchanged one Kindle, but after several incidents of the new one freezing up, etc. I may be returning this one as well. Since I've had this problem I have discovered that a lot of people have the same problems. Some are already on their 4th replacement device. This leads me to believe that you all KNOW this product is defective, yet you continue to sell and replace non-working devices with the same bunk devices.This is unconscionable! You should send out email notices to everyone who purchased this model to let them know that this is a known problem with the device, and send everyone a new, next generation Kindle. You all send out emails, for everything else, and this would be the right thing to if you want to maintain relationships with your loyal customers. What I want you to personally do for me, is to replace my current Kindle Fire HD 7" with which I continue to have problems, with the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 and provide me with a case comparable to the case I purchased for my current Kindle. I haven't seen reviews showing it has the problems my current model has. If you knowingly continue to sell the defective Kindles, as well as continue your current replacement practice with defective Kindles, I believe you all deserve a class action lawsuit. If I don't hear a reply from your office with suitable resolution, I intend to post this in the Kindle reviews. I'm sure there are more frustrated customers out there.
