Yes, you all have excellent customer service, and I enjoy the shopping convenience, but it doesn't make up for the game you are playing with the Kindle, the inconvenience of returning the product, setting up your replacement device again, and just having to deal with the issue PERIOD! I'm so over it! Sadiqah Keys

Reviews.Title: The ipad is a million times better!
Reviews.Author: Megan E Donlick
Reviews.Content: I really don't like the kindle fire hd. First off, why does it need ads? We payed 170ish for it, let us personalize our tablet. I know you can pay to remove it but we shouldn't have to. Secondly, I always have to restart my kindle in order for my apps to work. I've taken it in to get it fixed and they said nothing was wrong, it's just how the kindle worked. I run an app or two, and every time,no fail, by the third app I have to restart the to run it, otherwise the screen goes black and I can't open or close anything else. The reading portion is nothing special and honestly the books cost almost as much as the paperback copy. Get the ipad, it's a little more expensive without the problems. You can even download the kindle app on your ipad so you can read the kindle books that you bought on this wasted product.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Quality Issues
Reviews.Author: William T Walters
Reviews.Content: I am on my third KindlevFire HD. The first two would freeze up and reboot continually. The device was designed to download books for reading. Which I couldn't do. I was given a 50 dollar gift card for books which I spent for Kindle books. I have not been able to read the books until I recieved the third Kindle which seems to be working. It seems Amazon has a quality issue with the Kindle that they won't be transparent about.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for kids
Reviews.Author: Y. Wolter "sporting aunt"
Reviews.Content: In using the Kindle Free time app, I would love to know how kids can access downloaded music.  Otherwise, I really like this tablet as do my kids (the 6 and the 9 year olds the most).

Reviews.Title: worst tech disappoitment ever
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: I cannot download anything I do not want to be seen thanks to the cloud being permanent on my device. Books are easy to remove from device but a simple touch to the cloud and there it is permanently. I've spent hours multiple days on the phone with customer service trying solutions and nothing has worked except setting the kindle back to factory settings, not something I can do every time I read a romance book with a questionable cover I'd rather my children not see. Also, since it was meant to be a reading device you would think there's not a book you cant download....very wrong. I have searched several books to read to my class and found them not available. Very disappointing. I wont even go into how many popular games are unavailable! My kindle also has a nasty habit of just turning itself off while I'm using it with a full battery. Annoying!

Reviews.Title: garbage
Reviews.Author: Eric Matthew Nei
Reviews.Content: If I could return this and not lose money I would in a heart beat. Shity tablet right here. So disappointed

Reviews.Title: replaces our tower and laptop
Reviews.Author: James E Patterson
Reviews.Content: Since first purchasing a Kindle Fire for my wife, son and myself, we have replaced it for 99% of our internet usage.  About the only time we use our laptop is if we want to print something.  Our tower computer has sat idle for months.  We all like the ease of usage and multiple things we can do with the Kindle.  And for half the money of an Ipad, it is good investment!  I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Lorna Bryan
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas present for my granddaughter, who is 17 years old. It was a pleasure looking at her face when I gave her the Kindle Fire HD 7. She smiled from cheek to cheek while gasping, I wanted one!!, thx, thx, thx!!!.Now she downloads books, movies etc.:-)Thanks AmazonLorna

Reviews.Title: Wish I knew that this was a new generation when I bought it
Reviews.Author: Marcie Reakes
Reviews.Content: My daughter has the second generation Kindle Fire HD which included an HDMI output.I was disappointed to see that the new Kindle Fire does not include that feature and that you must purchase the HDX in order to get this feature.The newer processor is quicker and so far I like the tablet overall.

Reviews.Title: I might get another one.
Reviews.Author: Marc Burford
Reviews.Content: I got this for my daughter and she loves it. It s very easy to use and I don't worry about her seeing things on the internet that she shouldn't. I keep it on the freetime app provided by Kindle. Better than Nobi

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Connie Riche
Reviews.Content: I love it, small, light, convenient downloads are fast. I simply love it, I take it to work with me to read on slow times it fits right in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Ronald A. Buzard "buz"
Reviews.Content: We gave this as a gift to our 11 year old grandson at Christmas.  He loves to read, especially science books and was thrilled when he opened his gift.  He also immediately set up an email account.  Very happy little guy!

Reviews.Title: Great stuff!!!
Reviews.Author: Francis Morales
Reviews.Content: I’ve always thought that reading on a tablet would be very uncomfortable and refused to make the transition from hardcopy to digital. Well, I finally decided to take a leap of faith and try it and bought myself this baby, and wow! I just can't believe I waited this long. The Kindle Fire HD 7" is a very comfortable device. I use it to read, to watch movies (Boy, they weren't kidding about that HD, the image is fantabolous!), to play, search the web, and I'm going to stop the list here to make this review short. I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: kindel fire
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: I got the kindel for my wife for christmas and she loves it. She looks up face book, reads on it and shops on line.

Reviews.Title: Very reasonable price for a great tablet.
Reviews.Author: Franklin J Jensen
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire HD at the current price ($139) is an excellent deal for what you get.  First, I believe its dual Wi-Fi antenna is especially noteworthy.  It puts the antenna on my Galaxy tablet to shame.  Although you don't have the selection of Android apps as you would on an android tablet, Amazon Prime has a lot of merit.  And, of course, once you're surfing the internet, it's just as functional as a Galaxy.  Despite its obvious limitations compared to an iPad or a mainstream android tablet, it still is a fine piece of gear for the price.

Reviews.Title: You love to read?? This is for you!!
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: OMG I shockingly love it!! I'm a old school reader, so I like to Physically have the book in my hand. shockingly I love the way the Kindle works and I love how you still get the "feel" of that the books but you get them sooner! Just one click and the book is yours. I love the apps, and the battery life is great! Like I said I love reading so I was afraid I'd always have to worry about charging the battery but not in this case

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Skylar Corbitt
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift for my bookworm mom and she absolutely adores it! One of the best things I've ever given her

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: KDee
Reviews.Content: I got kindle fires for my 9-year old twins for their birthday.  (I know-- how will I ever top that?)  I got them because my 3rd graders are constantly reading, and all they ever ask for are books.  Their favorite outing is to the bookstore. I decided that allowing them to get ebooks would be a great gift.  I read a zillion tablet reviews.  I think the kindle is by far the best bang for the buck.  The only downside is the lack of a camera.  One of my daughters is into making animated movies-- well that can't be accomplished with the kindle fire HD.  No skyping either, but frankly, that's not why I bought them the kindles anyway.They love their kindles.  Happy kids, happy mom :)

Reviews.Title: Buy it
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Sometimes it freezes and then the screen goes blank and back to the homepage. Other than that, I love it!

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle!
Reviews.Author: rose gray
Reviews.Content: Love my kindle!  This is my third one and I love each one more than the one before!  Love,love,love my kindle!  Love it's portability and the size making it easy to take with me and keep handy especially for time spent waiting.  Love, love, love my newest kindle!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: lani
Reviews.Content: My husband has Alzheimer's Disease and I got it for him for Christmas hoping he'd use it and play good "brain games" on it.  He enjoys it and uses it 4-5 times a week.  Next project is to get him to read on it!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7"
Reviews.Author: gina
Reviews.Content: I had wanted a tablet for a while and my 13 year old niece told all about the Kindle Fire and all the different things on it so I ordered one.  The only and best thing I can say about it is that I love it and I'm very happy with it...

Reviews.Title: Can't add library books to FreeTime!
Reviews.Author: RP
Reviews.Content: This is a big disappointment.  The whole idea of the Kindle and FreeTime seemed like a perfect fit for what my family needed to keep up with all the books my kids read.  They go through books so fast that I needed a device to download the library books on for the kids to read, but still have the security of parental controls.  I am so disappointed that Kindle won't allow the library books to be added to FreeTime.  The books can be loaded onto the Kindle, but not into the FreeTime section.  So if I want my daughter to read her books, I have to do it out of FreeTime, thus giving her full access to purchasing, internet etc.  Free Time was the reason why I bought the Kindle so that I could require my kids to do their 15/30 minutes of reading first and then have the reward of the apps. The fact that I can download the books to the device, but not into FreeTime means Kindle is just refusing to click the necessary box to allow it to happen.  I don't want to buy the book she is going to read in 2 days and then want another, that's what a library is for.  Essentially the device is useless for me because I can't use it for what it was designed and purchased for.  Big Disappointment.

Reviews.Title: I gave this a 5 star rating because it truly is a 5 star product
Reviews.Author: Posh
Reviews.Content: My husband talked me into buying this so I could check email through out the day without leaving my laptop on all day.I'm not much of a TV or movie watcher but after owning this lovely device I'v found so many very good movies to watch for free (prime members) that I find myself looking forward to watching them while knitting.The only thing that I wish this one had on it is a camera.  Some do and some don't.

Reviews.Title: Returning yet again
Reviews.Author: AmazonQueen
Reviews.Content: Anyone else's just not turn on? My daughters comes on when it feels like it, it's not dead, and it charges all night. We have never used the wrong charger. I'm getting ready to return it again. My son's is starting to do the same thing..

Reviews.Title: Amazing product
Reviews.Author: Justin Gaudet
Reviews.Content: I love everything about my Kindle Fire. I am able to read, catch up on social media, do my school work and play games. My kindle makes getting homework done with my ebooks, for online classes, easier. My 7 month old nephew also enjoys playing games. I would recommend a Kindle Fire for anyone.

Reviews.Title: The 1st gen is better! NOT well with netflix!
Reviews.Author: alaskahad
Reviews.Content: I bought the 1st gen and it is great with everything. I then bought a new one for my daughter. I got it so she could play games, use Netflix, and Skype grandparents. The new one has no microphone or camera. I do like the freetime for kids but some games do not work when it is in freetime. Netflix is a hit and miss on when it will work for her. (the same app on my first gen works every time.) I have to sign out, turn off, turn on, then sign back in almost every time she wants to use Netflix.(again never a problem with my other kindle fire hd) I would not get the 2nd gen ever again. My wife wants to throw it away. I have only stopped her because of the cost.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Malinda Loy
Reviews.Content: Got mine for Christmas and have enjoyed every minute of learning how to use it. It's great for reading and surfing the web

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: Christina Packard
Reviews.Content: At first I wanted a Paperwhite for the front lighting.  Then a store clerk showed me the Fire and Wow!  Seriously the look for reading to me was the same.  I really could not tell the difference and I am sooooooooo picky!  Then he showed that I could see writings in color also if there were pictures in the books I would see them.  Then with the other features of the Apps which I knew nothing about, but now have downloaded a bunch of free ones so far, and they work fine and are usefull or fun.  I especially wanted to read books.  I successfully downloaded my first book and Amazon has just bunches of free books to download and any book that you purchase and is enabled to loan you can loan that book one time to a friend!  I can hook up to Facebook and play my games or get my mail.  I read a lot so I don't play with it much for the others, but someday I will even download a movie and music!  It will hold a couple of thousand books and I think the 16 GB will hold close to 500 hours of movies.  I especially like when reading to use the black background with white print.  That setting is so easy on my eyes.  The Paperwhite does not have that feature.  The only thing I miss is not having the vocabulary builder where any word I look up is stored for me to work on learning better.  Maybe someday they will add that in an update.  For only $10 more than the Paperwhite I got this Fire. Such a Deal!  I never thought I would ever use one of these gadgets... I love paper books, but I really like being able to read in the dark and I can also make the print as large as I want and I now find myself pressing on words in paper books trying to get the dictionary meaning.. LOL.. having that feature is fantastic.  I read many hours a day, and I find I have to recharge about every 4 days.  Give it a try! (Note:  I had said only $10 more than Paperwhite.. actually I paid $20 more because I upgraded when I found it on sale a day later.)

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: L. Dahl ""book magnet""
Reviews.Content: Handy and what a wonderful gift. Got it from my wife for my BD- I am learning my way around it...

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with a Kindle!
Reviews.Author: Janneth
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kindle as a Christmas gift. When you buy a Kindle, you know what you are getting - a great product and access to a great collection of books. No wonder the Kindle was at the top of my sister-in-law's wish list... and her 7 year-old daughter's wish list!

Reviews.Title: great price
Reviews.Author: Beverly P.
Reviews.Content: love my kindle fire,and the free shipping was a plus.it was a great gift easy to use and get apps

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Laurie Payne
Reviews.Content: I got this kindle for my 85 year old father, because he loves to read his westerns but stopped because he couldn't read the small print anymore! So the font came in handy and now he can enjoy reading again! My mom also sneaks it away from him and plays games on it! Thank You so much!

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: Edward a fuentez
Reviews.Content: The price is great and the quality is even better, I am very satisfied.  Would recommend to other people.  One.

Reviews.Title: I was a big lover of only books I could hold in my hands....
Reviews.Author: K. Mantel
Reviews.Content: but a special deal price caught my attention and I purchased this Kindle.  I now am reading more on the Kindle than hard or paperback books.  It is easier to slip into my purse and easier to read in bed at night (without the lights on).  There are a few choices of background color and a couple different fonts to make it easier.  Not easy to read outdoors in the sunlight, but just find some shade and it's not a problem.  One thing that was a huge and happy surprise:  every single CD I have purchased has been holding in 'cloud' for this one moment and I can now also listen to my music!  Happy Day!  (I am a member of Prime)  can also check gmail, if you have an account.  Must have Wi-Fi available to upload anything, but can read your book anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: I have been very happy with my Kindle Fire, but not happy with the current customer service. I had one of the original Kindles and the screen froze a few years after bought it. When I called I talked to an American representative. She took me through several steps to attempt to fix the problem and when nothing worked they replaced the Kindle. Today when I called, because I can't get my Fire to charge with out turning it off and on several times, and sometimes not even then, I was connected to a representative I could hardly understand because he had such a thick accent. We turned the Kindle off and back on once and when that didn't fix the problem he listed the replacement devices I could buy at a "discounted" price. This is the first review I've ever written because I feel so strongly that this is an issue. I was so impressed the last time I called!!! If this is how Amazons customer service is going to continue I will think seriously about looking into other tablet brands next time I buy... which may not be long if my Kindle stops charging completely!

Reviews.Title: great kindle
Reviews.Author: tniris
Reviews.Content: we are now a three kindle family.  Our seven year old has his own so I can reclaim mine.  thanks, Santa.

Reviews.Title: Birthday Gift
Reviews.Author: Jaci
Reviews.Content: When I opened my birthday present, I was thrilled! It has more than met my expectations. I did get the Prime also, so I have been reading to my hearts content. It is clear and easy to read and I learn more and more, as I explore. Being technically challenged, finding my way around my Kindle in fun and easy. I love all the free apps. that are available to me. Best Birthday in yrs. thanks Amazon, for bringing the Kindle into my life.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Jonathan G.
Reviews.Content: I got the Kindle fire HD 8.9" for christmas and fell in love with it right away (it was my first tablet). I found that my girlfriend was also using my kindle so frequently that I wished we had two of them. So I bought this.... all I can say is the Kindle Fire HD 7" is our favorite of the two. The size is perfect for easy handling without the loss of the functionality of a big screen. We use it for reading, surfing the web, social media, and much more. The only time we use the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" instead of this one is when we choose to watch Amazon Instant Video in bed. The 8.9" is a little bigger which makes watching videos easier, and its sound seems to be louder. If you are in the market for a tablet and you are considering Kindle, as well as considering cost, then this has to be your first choice. With the variety of apps out there you can both work and play on this bad boy. So far the must have apps I have gotten are: OfficeSuite Professional 7 ($4.99 but I used my amazon coins to purchase it), Adobe Reader, Kindle Free Books, Bitdefender Antivirus Free, and then your standard entertainment and social media apps. As far as physical protection goes, my girlfriend tends to be a bit clumsy so I opted for a more robust case than the standard leather case and got the i-Blason 2nd generation Armor Box. It's a great fit, still allows you to handle the kindle with ease, and gives you a good sense of security.All in all I am happy with both of my Kindles, but if I had to do it over again I think I would buy two of the 7" and save myself the extra money because 85% of the time I preffer to use this one over the 8.9"Just one additional comment, I strongly urge you to consider getting an Amazon Prime membership if you buy this, otherwise you will not fully utilize the benefits and capabilities of your Kindle. It's totally worth it if you read, stream movies, or buy stuff online. With the 2 day free shipping, kindle lending library, and free streaming it easily pays itself off.Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: It's a Kindle
Reviews.Author: P. Owens
Reviews.Content: Really like this one - nice and light weight and lighting is good, haven't tried to do anything but read yet, if I have any other issues I'll post again later

Reviews.Title: First review ever!.....since the last one
Reviews.Author: mitch h.
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HD 7" Display, WiFi, 16GB for my son this Christmas. I could tell he was very excited to receive it because he said "thanks" (he's 14 so that's about all you get). I noticed he wasn't using it very often so I inquired as to why. "Son" I said "why aren't you utilizing your new Kindle Fire HD 7" Display, WiFi, 16GB?"  "Well father (because for the sake of ; the WiFi is always buffering and I can't watch the Netflix" he replied. I asked him if he tried getting closer to the WIFi magic box to which he replied in the affimative. He went on to say the picture was also blury.. Understand; I love my son, but he's a teenager and therefore pre-wired to obviscate the truth! I, in a very caring and respectful way, demanded he "proove it!" The lad turned on the Kindle Fire HD 7" Display, WiFi, 16GB and activated the Netflix. To my utter amazement, I discovered it was all true! The picture was indeed bluy and the video stopped several time in "buffering" mode. Now I don't really understand much about "technology" but thought I'd give the Kindle Fire HD 7" Display, WiFi, 16GB  a good shake to see if that would fix the problem. Turns out; not.

Reviews.Title: Good, but Smaller Screen & No Camera
Reviews.Author: M L W "M L W"
Reviews.Content: Great product, however, it does not have a camera!  I should have read the description more clearly, however was disappointed (and so was my child).  Smaller screen as well.

Reviews.Title: You haven't fixed the problem?
Reviews.Author: Cooper "Coop"
Reviews.Content: I ordered a new kindle and just received it. I do like the feel and weight of the kindle. I turned it on and set it up. Everything went smoothly. I was reading a book and it shut off. I turned it back on and a few minutes later it shut off again. I looked online thinking maybe it has auto shut off when not in use to conserve battery use. I see it has a history of shutting off on others. Why would you continue selling a product that has not hds this problem addressed? I know I can send it back and you will send a new replacement. That is not the problem. I wanted a kindle that doesn't have issues.

Reviews.Title: Not for families, not for children :(
Reviews.Author: Arnaldo
Reviews.Content: I am so disappointed in Amazon. All the things I read about Kindle FreeTime made me sure that these were the perfect devices for our family - and boy was I disappointed.A bit of background: We are a family that is a big fan and avid users of the good, old-fashioned local public library. We typically bring back a haul of parent-approved books for my kids after a library trip.This year for Christmas we thought it would be nice to move our family into the 21st century and get e-readers for our 3 most avid readers. After reading about how you can check out books from the library for your Kindle, my biggest remaining concern as a parent was internet safety. I didn't want the price of an e-reader to be giving my kids unlimited Internet access - especially not access to browse the Kindle store, which is loaded with adult content. When I saw the videos about Kindle FreeTime, I was sold, and we bought 3 Kindles: 2 Paperwhites and an HD Fire.The Bottom line: I discovered that if you want to give your kids e-Readers, *without* giving them access to the Kindle store or the Internet - *and* you want to be able to check out e-Reader titles from your local public library, do *NOT* get a Kindle Fire - the Kindle Paperwhite is definitely the way to go.If you purchased a Kindle Fire HD for your child, here is the big disappointment: Kindle FreeTime does *not* work with library books. This leaves a parent with two options:  A) only have your child read books that you have *purchased* from Amazon, or  B) don't use FreeTimeEffectively, this makes Kindle FreeTime on the Kindle Fire require a monthly subscription fee as you must pay money *every* *time* your child wants to open a new book, and if your kids are avid readers (mine are) that monthly fee can be quite high.Our other option is to turn off Kindle FreeTime and let our kids browse all kinds of adult content on the Kindle store - but protecting the kids via FreeTime was the reason we purchased these devices in the first place.Parents beware: these devices are not for kids - unless you don't mind purchasing every book your child reads.The good news: The Kindle *Paperwhite* gives parents the option to completely block access to the Kindle Store without using Freetime. So if you want to use the library and block your kids access to the Internet and to the Kindle Store, the Kindle Paperwhite should serve your family's needs.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed and now wishing I hadn't bought one
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Purchased one right after Thanksgiving on special. Owned it about a month and went to turn it on and ... nothing. Read through support and tried a hard reboot and still nothing. Let it charge overnight and tried again with no results. Contacted Kindle Help and they also walked me through a reboot after I told them I had done that. Then they offered to replace it. I thought..Great! They even did 2 day shipping. When it arrived, I opened the box to find it was a refurbished unit (with no cable or power adapter or box or book, etc). I immediately contacted them only to be told they could do nothing for me. That they have no control whether a new or refurbished unit goes out. Plus, the warranty on the refurbished unit back dates to the date I bought my original Kindle Fire, not the date the refurbished one arrived. The only thing they did do was offer to ship me new cable and power adapter at their cost, but only after she made me feel that it was my fault for not saving the original ones. Had I been told to keep them, I would have but since I was only told they were replacing it, I boxed everything back up. In fact, had I been told I was only getting a refurbished one, I would have just returned mine. I bought a brand new Kindle Fire a month ago that had a defect and now I am being compensated with a used one. Terrible customer service. I used to be so happy with Amazon's customer service, but now, not so much.

Reviews.Title: a lot of issues
Reviews.Author: Rhonda Hale-Bellinder
Reviews.Content: I bought my son this for Christmas and it worked great for a week and then it keeps disconnecting from the wi-fi. I have tried everything to get it to work and connect but it still will not work. I have very good wi-fi at home and a kindle of my own that works just fine. I'm returning his and buying him another and going to try it again.

Reviews.Title: Durable
Reviews.Author: Scarlette N Streeter
Reviews.Content: purchased for 14 year old. hasn't put it down since Christmas. Takes it everywhere he goes. never with out it.

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: Jordi Anzik "Jordi"
Reviews.Content: I love this product. I am thrilled with the multi uses it has. I purchased this product, which is on the lower end, and plan on upgrading to a higher end Kindle in the next several months. If you like reading, apps, games, Photoshop, and many other programs, this is a great product. I recommend a higher end Kindle for those who will use it for all the above tasks and more.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Brenda Hancock
Reviews.Content: Love it but only negative is they revised the size with the new 2014 model, which means it is very very difficult to find a case that fits.  I have spent much time shopping both in person and on line.  Finally found a case that fits it, but I did not have any choice of color or style.  I think they should not have changed the design size.

Reviews.Title: My New Kindle
Reviews.Author: Pamela S. English
Reviews.Content: I never thought I would enjoy having a Kindle, cause I am not much of a reader... However, I have learned how to play games, email, search the internet and read the Bible through my new kindle. So happy that I got it for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: Downgrade from older Kindle
Reviews.Author: karen hamstrang
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that this Kindle Fire, although it is a newer version, seems to be a downgrade. It is a different style, which is fine. The big downfall is that there is no camera. Everyone in my family has a Kindle Fire, so we bought this one for my youngest son. He is the only one without a camera and I have no idea why they would make a newer version, with less things. It is kind of dumb if you ask me. To be honest, I didn't even want to keep it, but I could not find the older versions anywhere and I am not spending the extreme price for the better version for an 8 year old. I guess it is ok, but downgrading a product if it is newer makes no sense to me.

Reviews.Title: Very irritating shut down issues, Amazon lending library disappointing, FreeTime disappointing
Reviews.Author: Alison_says
Reviews.Content: This tablet was fun to use when it was working well, unfortunately that was only around 75% of the time.  I would be in the middle of reading an online newspaper, playing a game, or reading a book and it would randomly power down (while fully charged).  When I would push the power button to turn it back on it would come back on most of the time.  But sometimes it would not, and I called customer service for help when it wasn't turning back on.  I was told to press and hold the power button for 20 seconds, then press it again for 3 seconds.  This worked to get the device back on but was frustrating for a device that was 2 days old. I tried to put up with this for another week or so but ultimately decided not to.  When I asked about getting a replacement unit, thinking this one was particularly defective I was told they are all like this so while they could provide a replacement it wasn't likely to remedy the situation.I am an Amazon Prime member (with the Prime membership bought partially in anticipation of being able to use the lending library) and expected to get one free book from the Kindle Lending Library per month.  I was extremely disappointed in both the selection offered for free there.  Most of the books offered there were older and available (also for free of course) via ebook using the Overdrive app in conjunction with my public library.  There wasn't a great comprehensive list of what was available for borrowing, so you have to look up the books you'd like to read and see if they are available.  Of the 102 books on my "Want to Read" list on Goodreads exactly zero were available (the books on my list tend to come from NPR Fresh Air reviews and NY Times reviews so they aren't exactly off the beaten path.  I now understand why Amazon makes it difficult to see what is in the lending library prior to purchase of a Kindle.I had been planning to share this tablet occasionally with my 3.5 year old via Freetime but after I realized apps downloaded in Free Time don't show on your main list and are therefore difficult to delete I decided not to use this as they can clutter up your tablet quickly, especially considering you only have 8BG.  Instead I played with her on the main page but quickly realized Amazon makes that very dangerous as they can easily buy apps without even realizing it.Additionally this device makes it very easy to use Amazon content but not very easy to download music and movies from other sources.I returned the unit and have ordered the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 for the same price as the Kindle with ads (the Samsung will not have ads, which will be a bonus).  Once I receive that and have used it for a bit I will return to this review and update with a comparison.

Reviews.Title: Problems from the start and return policies are not to your advantage
Reviews.Author: RICHARD MORRIS
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas present for the wife. Within 3 days of using, the screen became unresponsive and the power button stopped working, so no way to reset the Kindle as specified in their troubleshooting tips. We decided to return for a replacement. That process went smoothly with good help from Amazon Kindle support.When the "new" Kindle arrived, it turns out that it is a refurbished unit. If it had gone out after a few months, we feel this would be ok. However, a brand new Kindle with 3 days of use being replaced by a refurb is ok by our standards. We called and talked to Amazon. At first, we were told by several people in the chain that we had, in fact, received a new one, even though it came in a plain brown box that is marked refurbished. We finally talked to a person that agreed that it is their policy to replace any Kindle with a refurb. When we asked who we could talk to about the fact that we had just paid for a brand new Kindle price for a refurbished unit, we were passed on to a woman who is the head of the Kindle returns department. She said that the warranty states that they can *at their choice* replace the unit with either a new or refurbished unit. We asked that they either replace it with a new unit or refund us the difference in price between a new and refurbished unit. She told us no, pleasantly, in about a hundred different ways.We have been loyal Amazon Prime customers for some time and have, up to this point, been very happy with Amazon service. That is until now. Evidently, it is their choice for us to pay new the new Kindle price for a refurbished unit.What is especially not okay is that the refurbished unit seems to have an issue now. We will likely return the unit for a refund. I wonder if they will refund the full price or the refurb price.If you don't mind the chance that you will pay new prices for used consumer electronics, go ahead and buy.

Reviews.Title: 3rd kindle
Reviews.Author: rod meyer
Reviews.Content: This is our third Kindle - it keeps the grandkids from fighting over who gets to use it!  The picture is great and the sound much improved compared to the first one we purchased.I wish the power cord connectors were interchangeable....

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This product is very durable.  After falling into a snow covered parking lot, being plowed into a snowbank and left there for over a week in sub zero weather, the Kindle started right up and still worked.  The only problem was the screen was cracked in the corner.  Customer Service was very helpful in solving my problem.  I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for the Price
Reviews.Author: Paul A. Culter "pculter"
Reviews.Content: I received my Kindle Fire HD 7" as a replacement for my original Kindle reader.  I love the colorful screen and ease of use as a tablet.  I've downloaded books and apps - it is seamless and quick.  I love how it recognizes my existing Amazon account and downloaded the Kindle Books I'd already purchased.  The only drawbacks to this model - it lacks a camera and it takes a decent amount of time to boot up from the completely off position (it won't recognize the Wi-Fi for about a minute/minute and a half after turning it on).  It also doesn't have all of the apps that you can find in the Google Play store or iTunes store - although it does have most of the popular apps in the Amazon App store.  I am well pleased with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: new venture
Reviews.Author: bigpoppy
Reviews.Content: So far so good. I purchased this to have access to my prime movies. The visual and sound on the HD is excellent. I watched a movie today and it was like watching tv. The battery life is not as good as I would have liked but acceptable. Its lite and easy to use. I have 3 other tablets,one cheaper and one more expensive. The Kindle is as good as my $300 Nexus. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a new tablet.

Reviews.Title: Nice size to carry around
Reviews.Author: B. Salhany "Paloma Picasso"
Reviews.Content: I own an iPad and wondered about getting a mini one. Decided to try the Kindle Fire instead.  I am very satisfied with it, especially the money I saved.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: armydoc

Doesn't bother us at all and I'm glad I saved the $15.The bad is it shuts down about once a day (battery is still fine) and you have to hold in the power button for 30 seconds to get it to re-boot. URG!!!! I saved money not buying the Apple product (the iPad) but seems I have to put up with this as a consolation. Very frustrating and all it did was remind me why we buy Apple products. Yes, they cost more but we never go through this with them.I would recommend it because based on the price and what you get.

Reviews.Title: Jack of All Trades, Master of None
Reviews.Author: Jason Greco
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I was not looking at the Kindle as a "tablet" but more as a media consumption device. I'm an Apple enthusiast and have a 15" MacBook Pro I am more than happy with for anything beyond what the iPhone will do. I was however looking at it for my daughter, who is currently 3.5 yrs old. She enjoys the few educational games I put on my iPhone for her, but without separate user profiles turning the restrictions on and off to ensure she didn't accidentally "panic click" something was getting tiring.  I had looked at the "children's tablets" such as the LeapPad and Nabi - but for the price I was thinking of paying for a dedicated children's tablet, I might as well be able to use it as well. Other tablets considered were the Nook HD, Nexus 7 and Galaxy Tab 3. One having an iffy future, one not having enough parental controls and the last being priced much higher than the 2013 Fire HD 7" though always led me back to Amazon's Kindle.- Free Time  This was the single largest consideration for me; being able to set a separate user profile for myself and my daughter. The Kindle lets you not only set time limits if you so desire, you don't have to, but allows you to choose exactly the applications that your child is allowed to access and have more than one child profile for different ages/interests/time limits. And for older children you can just enable the Parental Controls from the drop down menu and restrict things like web access, videos or apps from the standard OS side of things.  Free Time Unlimited is available for a free trial and I strongly recommend everyone try it out before buying any apps for your children. There is a much larger selection of games and books available through Free Time Unlimited than there is on the standard app store. Parent beware however that it does NOT ask for a passcode or parental permission to start downloading all the games/books in the children's "store." This is not so much a security issue as the store has little to no questionable material that I could find, but poses a storage problem. My daughter was very excited to see so many new things to try out that she promptly downloaded a rather large handful before I realized the implications. You can always go back and remove items from the device or supervise "Kindle Time," but I'm just giving a heads up.- Hardware  As some of you may or may not know, the 2013 Fire HD 7" does NOT have a camera, or a Mayday button or HDMI out (wireless or wired) and it is NOT the old Fire HD, it is really just an updated Fire "standard/regular." Now that we have that out of the way -  a camera, Mayday button, HDMI, front facing camera, ect. were not really a concern for me. I have an iPhone for pictures (smaller, always with me) I have a computer for Skype and HDMI and by my understanding Mayday is not tech support, just customer service.  Now what it does have is an amazing screen. Side by side with the HDX in the store I could hardly tell a difference on the home screen, even less on reading and just a little on the sample movie. Some may be better at spotting this as I don't have a television and the laptop is pretty much my TV, but I felt the screen more than adequate for my requirements. Colors are clear and bright and edges are crisp.  The speed is plenty up to snuff as I don't have any prior tablets to compare it to. It does however seem faster than my mother's iPad 3. Apps download at at decent clip and loading times are minimal for those with just a little patience. The speakers sound great for such a small tablet, they completely put my iPhone's to shame and make watching movies on it rather enjoyable as your hands amplify the sound and give it more body (it seems, I'm not really an audiophile). I did opt for the 16GB version as there is no expandable memory and apps and books cannot be "streamed" from the cloud drive.- Software  One of the biggest complaints I have seen is the limited app store. Perhaps I'm being coy, but I don't need twelve different free calculator apps and seven paid versions. The app store has many things on it, such as every one of the games I had on my iPhone for my daughter, among several other nice utilities like banking, social media, Netflix and Twitch.tv.  The biggest complaint I have about the software is the lack of native Google support. No "real" YouTube or Google applications are available. That being said, the email app is no worse than Apple's for me and does support Gmail accounts and YouTube can be accessed from Silk - the Amazon native web browser. Silk is decently fast, while not Chrome fast it is acceptable and does display many websites in the desktop format rather than the mobile that some tablets default to, this was another thing I liked about the Kindle.  While I do prefer reading on an E-Ink reader, I can read comfortably on an LCD screen and the Fire is light enough to hold one handed with the bevel providing a nice surface to hold onto without touching the screen itself.  I do have the "Special Offers" on mine, however I do not find them obtrusive at all as Kindle screen turns off while locked you only see the ads for seconds before unlocking the device and you can always pay the extra $15 later if you truly don’t want them.  The Kindle does come with a charger, however not the 9W “PowerFast” charger it does still charge at an acceptable rate. The plug does stick out at an angle from the device, but it is pointed up when the Kindle is laying on its back so I don’t foresee any issues. Battery life is good, even when watching movies or playing games I get several hours from it (I don’t have an exact time, I’m sorry).  All in all a very nice device for the price. It’s not a surface and it’s not a power tablet with access to every app known to man, but it is a lightweight, inexpensive tablet that your child and you can enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love - for work and home
Reviews.Author: Julie Graff
Reviews.Content: I would have loved to have an iPad, but it just wasn't in the budget, so I purchased the first gen Fire. It was great but had one major problem - no capability to ad an external keyboard. So I upgraded to the HD and purchased a keyboard case. For me, this has been almost as good as a laptop, and for certain things, better. I've taken it into work meetings to take notes using Google drive online. When working on team projects, I can edit documents on the fly. For fun of course there is the reader. But perhaps most impressive is the video playback. I joined Prime and have been watching TV episodes and am super impressed with the picture and sound. Now when the TV is monopolized by husband and kids, I have another option. Worth every penny I paid!

The might as well keep speaking Tagalog. So very frustrated with Amazon. Maybe it's time to go with a Nook and Overstock. Amazon is getting to big for it's britches.

Reviews.Title: We love this Kindle
Reviews.Author: apoem "apoem"
Reviews.Content: This is a great Kindle. My daughter wanted something for browsing the internet, checking email, and playing games. This works great for what we wanted it to do.It easily hooks up to the internet. The only problem we have run into is how to hook it up to the internet when the internet needs a code (such as in a hotel room). Otherwise, we have never had a problem with our kindle hooking up to the internet. It is very intuitive to use. It is easy to open up the box and use this item. There is not a complicated set up, back up, or a huge learning curve.We really liked the size. It fits perfectly into my purse. This fact tied to the apps that you can pick up make this a very useful item.We did get the quick charger because it uses up battery faster than I anticipated. This helped in how fast you can charge the Kindle.The other thing that you should note is that it does not have a camera. This did not seem like a big deal when we originally purchased it because we have a separate camera. However, many times we have wished for a camera on this kindle.Others have given more in-depth reviews with information about the speed, the display and all the bells and whistles.All I can say is this: if you are looking for a simple pad that can show movies, play games, and cruise the internet a little bit, this is a great option.Worth the money.Enjoy.

I literally rediscovered my love for reading after purchasing my Kindle! So HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Reviews.Title: A simple tablet that's quick and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Drew A.
Reviews.Content: I got this for my dad to replace the 1st generation Kindle Fire I got him. I got it early and had a couple weeks to use it so I could see for myself the difference from the 1st generation Kindle Fire. I have to say that this is a great upgrade from that previous generation. I like the changes to the shape of the kindle with the contoured edges plus the audio and power button on each side on the back of the Kindle, both of which are easy to find with your fingers while viewing the main screen. Reading is fun and changing settings (i.e. text size, color of background, etc.), moving from page to page back and forth, navigating from chapter to chapter and making notes as I read was a breeze. I have a subscription to Golf Digest and reading the digital version on this tablet was great! Watching videos with this tablet was a great experience: I watched the James Bond film "Skyfall," TV show videos via the hulu app and some Amazon plus videos on this Kindle. All videos were crisp and clear and I had no streaming problems over wi-fi. Audio from the built in speakers is surprisingly nice whether watching videos, listening to an audio book or music when propped up in the Origami Case in landscape (long side down) which is how I mainly used it. Setting up email on the Kindle and reading and replying to emails was easy and quick. I really like the fact that you can do all I just mentioned on this small tablet and take it with you wherever you go! It’s very compact and lightweight and the Origami case protects the Kindle well without sacrificing audio quality or sound output. To sum it up: If you're looking for a compact, lightweigt tablet for reading, watching videos, listening to audio books, listening to music and reading and writing email, the Kindle Fire HD is a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: When it works....
Reviews.Author: B. Rudder "Bong"
Reviews.Content: Like most tech items I have bought this kindle was a bit underwhelming...the hype around it was too much and after my nephew was so enjoying his earlier model (Kindle Fire bought at another website), I jumped and bought this on a Daily Deal (despite having my iPad retina, Nook, and another android tab).  So the display was crisp and initially seemed to be fairly responsive with slight delay only in opening categories...then tried to download a book and it took forever...(no it was not my internet as the rude Amazon customer service guy tried to imply since my iPad Retina and Nook HD had no problems downloading the books)...I had to return when the back panel when the battery probably sits started getting really hot (like "move your fingers or else" kinda hot).The replacement faired better and got my books, movies and what not downloaded in a zip. The Silk browser is like any other cheap android tablet kinda browser - you know where the font is really small and the tabs really hard to touch.The real convenience is being able to get the movies I buy downloaded to take with me...Otherwise I actually prefer my Nook HD+ 9 inch ...better resolution and reading books is a joy....So with 70% battery life, I powered down the Kindle Fire only to pick it up 2 days later and it is dead..yup....

Reviews.Author: melw2
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as a back-up to my ipad. I have to say -I LOVE it. I use it almost as much as my ipad. The color is great. The tablet is extremely well made. With the cloud I have plenty of storage. The sound is very nice for a 7 inch tablet. It is plenty fast for YouTube and streaming movies and videos. It is a little slow downloading all my hoarded emails. Since the only camera I care about is a front and back camera (like that on my ipad) I don't care that there is no front facing camera. I don't think you can get a tablet of this quality for the price.

I had wanted to get a basic Kindle but I'm happy we got the Fire because it has all the great reading functionality I wanted with the full range of media and connectivity applications that are really useful.

My husband was in the hospital and I thought I will give it a new chance to work.  It would not work at the hospital wifi. I said Kindle, she said "people with Kindles don't have any luck getting on".I am tired of messing around, this was a gift, I am not high tech but this product is not enjoyable, especially when I cannot use it for what I spent my gift certificate on.  I am sending it back to Amazon which is another hassle, they don't send any paperwork or labels etc.  I have to go to the library to print anything I need.  I sure this concept saves Amazon money and inconvience for the costumer

Reviews.Author: Noche
Reviews.Content: I am completely disappointed in the kindle fire. From the beginning the fire was restarting and shutting down without me doing so. Had it not been for the defect it appeared to be a great item.

Reviews.Title: Some flaws, but still a good value
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Carter
Reviews.Content: I bought a Kindle primarily to read and browse the web. It's quite good for both of these things and I would recommend it. The web browser is very good, quite fast and the image quality is great. For reading, it's awesome. I've watched some videos and found the sound and video quality to be good as well. Typing with the on-screenscreen keyboard is fairly easy too. However, there have been a couple of issues with it that I would mention. First, this is my second Kindle. The first one was junk in the box and would turn on, display a screen with multiple lines across it with text displaying backwards and then shut off again. Amazon replaced it with no hassle and sent a replacement via overnight shipping. The replacement Kindle works fine with the exception of intermittently shutting down. I haven't had this happen while reading, only while using the web browser. I researched this issue online and it seems to be a common problem, although not one I've found a solution to. I haven't contacted Amazon about the issue but plan to, as I've had my Kindle for just under a month and expect it to be free of issues of that kind. I also haven't been impressed with the battery life, but it's not awful. Overall, as an alternative to considerably more expensive devices with similar functionality, I do think this is a good value. I have some concerns about how long it will last before needing to be replaced, but for the price, I'm willing to take the chance and would recommend the product to others.
