The DX is still available though more expensive and I think they are phasing it out.  Since I don't want to deal with Christmas shipping crowds, I will wait until next week to decide.A negative point I forgot to mention was the battery.  I completely charged when I received.  The next day it received heavy use downloading books and music and the battery was drained by he end of the day.Fully charged the next day and then turned it on for about four hours with little use and left it on over night.  The battery is already 52% depleted.  I just turned off the wireless and hope that the battery will last a little longer.Five hours later the power had dropped to 30%.  At that rate it needs to be charged every day even with the wireless off.  Not great when travelling.  Definitely more like a lap top than any kindle I've owned.

Reviews.Title: advertisements on kindle...
Reviews.Author: Julia T.
Reviews.Content: Why in the world should we have to pay NOT to have obnoxious ads on our kindles??  This is nuts.  $15...unbelievable.Wonder jf i go into a book store and buy a book if ill be given the opportunity to buy book a with ads for less or book b with no ads.  Whose stupid idea was this??

Reviews.Title: Owned This Kindle Almost a Year Now
Reviews.Author: Gankaku "Lisa Akari"
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I absolutely love my Kindle and I'd get another in a heartbeat. These are wonderful, sturdy tablets with very few limitations.Here are my gripes with this tablet:* No back facing camera (if you want that, you need to go up to the larger, more expensive version)* No SD card - I'm a big app downloader and podcast listener. However, there is the Amazon cloud and if you're careful what you download (use only ONE calendar app instead of having 5 loaded *LOL* or uninstall the apps you don't use much) you will be ok. The cloud keeps your books, music and unused apps. The problem I have is daily podcast downloads that are taking up space. I really LOVE BeyondPod on my kindle to handle podcasts but am going to have to drop those onto my mp3 player.With that said, those are my only beefs with this wonderful tablet.  Some folks may have a problem that you can't put google appstore apps on here, or use stuff like Google Maps or Voice. You CAN get your Gmail in the main mail application, and I just go to my computer for voice and maps. You can download 1MobileMarket if you need other apps that aren't in the Kindle store (just be careful and scan them with a tool like Lookout).Everything Amazon is wonderfully integrated - the music, Prime videos and movies, magazine subscriptions you can purchase, and books. You get a free app of the day. My favorite first thing to do each morning is to check today's free app.There are tons of free books (just Google "free kindle books" and peruse all the lists you want!) as well as your purchased Amazon books that are digital. The Music cloud player is great - I'm finding pretty much all the obscure music I want on Amazon, purchase the digital version, and don't have to worry about losing the CD or losing the digital copy on a crashed hard drive - it's all in the cloud and plays great on the tablet.The high definition screen and dolby sound is so great for games and movies. But it's also an excellent reader. It handles books and media extremely well. One thing I do wish though is for a better organizational shelf. All your books are in alphabetical order or by most recent (same with apps). I'm old. I forget the name of all these apps. Amazon would do well to allow us to create organizational folders or shelves to organize our apps and books. It would be so easy to find all my business books if I could just throw them into a Business shelf, and my cookbooks on a Cookbook shelf. Right now they're really impossible. It's the same with the Cloud. They just are a whole list of books, and if you get over a certain amount, good luck finding the book you want.Make sure you purchase the quick charger with your Kindle. Plugging in the cable to USB on the computer and charging it is ugly. It's slow, and it's just not intuitive or nice. It needs plugged into the wall, and the charger you can buy separately will charge it very quickly. Please make sure you plug the charger into a wall surge protector. I fried my wall charger and we thought it was the kindle because it wasn't charging. It ended up being the charger because it was plugged in directly to the wall, and I was told they are very sensitive. I bought the Belkin 6-outlet wall mount surge protector for this purpose: B004CLYJ0UThere are many great cases for the HD7. The silicon cases are great, inexpensive, help you get a grip on the tablet, and offer some protection. Cover cases offer protection during travel. This 7" is a great size for travel in a bag.This Kindle is easy to learn, easy to see, and easy to use. I recommend it for all ages - from young to old, experienced techies to people who've never had a computer or tablet before.Amazon has great support and they seem to want to make you happy.

Reviews.Title: NICE !!
Reviews.Author: Dr Fareed Rajack FRCS (Glasg) Ophth
Reviews.Content: I live outside the States , and now , thanks to my new kindle , I can get all  the books that I want downloaded instantly to my kindle. I use it for facebook , youtube , email , and shopping on amazon with my prime account. This is a great device . I hardly use my galaxy tab anymore !

Reviews.Title: No camera, No purchase
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Connolly
Reviews.Content: I was a button click away from buying 2 of these - one for each of my kids - when I learned this new version does not have the camera and microphone that the old one had.  My kids LOVE to make videos and record themselves. This seems like a basic feature in most other tablets.  I will be purchasing a different product with camera.  As an Amazon Prime member I am disappointed not to be able to utilize the lending library.  I hope we see an enhancement to this product in the future and they add back the camera feature to this affordable model, not just the expensive ones.

Reviews.Title: No choice of software
Reviews.Author: Alan Wood "always on the lookout for good run...
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this.  Amazon recently destroyed the Silk web browser (which is the only browser they allow on the device).  It loads every web page in frames.  When you reach the bottom of one game, the next frame starts to scroll up and the display shakes terribly, rendering this function virtually unusable.  If they fix their browser or let me download a good browser I'll change my reading.  Until then, you're better off with just about any other tablet.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Brian Sherman
Reviews.Content: Works better then my ipad.  I was concerned how it would work and also for books, I'm more of a solid book person, but I have enjoyed the selection/prices.

Reviews.Title: Joseph (RI)
Reviews.Author: joseph
Reviews.Content: brand spanking new. less than a week old..SLOW AND FREEZES, AND SLOW AND FREEZES, AND SLOW AND FREEZES, AND SLOW AGAIN AND FREEZES AGAIN. And then it freezes and slow again. The only good about this device is BUFFERING...took me almost 5 minutes to watched a 2 minutes song.

Reviews.Title: Problems with sound
Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: I have received 2 now and both have had the same problem. On the first one I received (as a gift) the sound would go out randomly beginning the second day of use. The sound comes back on when either exiting and reentering an app, or sometimes has to be powered off and back on for it to work again. I promptly returned it and received a replacement. The second one's sound stopped working randomly on the third day. I am very disappointed. I looked it up and this seems to be a common problem.

Reviews.Title: Decent tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Melissa Powers
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I love my iPad and didn't want to risk taking it to the gym. It's a fine entry level, iPad mini knockoff, but my biggest complaint (and this is what brings my rating down from 4+ stars to 3) is the amount of space the OS takes up. It's an 8GB device, with only 4GB usable space. That is just ridiculous. iOS7 does not take up half the space of my iPad. On the other hand, I paid considerably less, expect considerably less and if it falls off the treadmill, I won't be in hysterics.

Reviews.Title: Head Ache
Reviews.Author: philip brophy
Reviews.Content: Not worth the head aches.Downloaded (purchased ) content will play off line for a few hours then all of a sudden device says needs network connection to play.Support is terrible 3 days no fix, except hard reset of device and re-download content, every day 2 times a day.parental controls for purchases , well my daughter was able to one click a $74 entire season of videos with out using them, I tested and no password required, supports answer was to deactivate the card used!!!,device is being returned for a more reliable solution.What an expeirence.they did offer me $5 for my troubles, I wanted a device that works, not money or credit, what good does that do if it doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: Needs Improvement, not as advanced as it claims to be!
Reviews.Author: marypaige33
Reviews.Content: This device is the slowest one I own. The browser claims to be fast, but just waiting for this page to load took too long. The typing always lags as well. It seems the more I use this device the slower and more unresponsive it gets, it's ridiculous! I was pleased with it at first, but then i also got a look at the app store. There isn't even all of the essential apps! Not to mention you can't download flashplayer and most video will not load with this browser. It doesn't even let you chose your browser, you are stuck with the one it gives you! The reading view on this thing also seems to spazz a lot. I try to scroll down and it goes back a page instead. Im so annoyed with this, I've had it now for a year and I have been let down. By the way, none of the apps get regular updates either, if at all.

Reviews.Title: not a charm
Reviews.Author: nene
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle and I have had it up to my neck with it . It won't charge properly to start second when playing a game or watching a movie it blacks out ,it freezes up, it's slow, it gets hot, it slow when it comes to the web an in all It s kind of annoying . I am officially I think done with any type of Kindle. It's funny how all this happened and I've only had it for maybe 3-4 months.  Summary: it is the worst

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: John Hanna
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a much better experience.  Slow, non responsive touch screen.  The WIFI access was also sluggish.  I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the reader that might want just a little more.
Reviews.Author: ST
Reviews.Content: I bought this because it was a cheap tablet (special offer brought it down to $70). I had been wanting to buy a tablet for sometime, but didnt know what to get. I wanted an ipad, or ipad mini but they are pretty pricey for what you get, especially the mini. After reading and watching many reviews, I decided that this wasnt a bad deal at all. I especially liked the Kindle borrow options. Of course with the promotion I had it was a no brainer.I got the Kindle unboxed it and loved it right away. Its definitely a pretty good tablet, especially for the price. Actually, since buying this Kindle, I've been more inclined to buy this for family members and even wanting to get the HDX version, since those have gotten even better reviews on Gizmodo, engadget, techcrunch, and cnet.There was one problem that I encountered though.The first few days I would power down my device to save battery life and after a couple of days the device would randomly restart on its own. It happened quite often, so often that I was having regrets buying the KFHD. I was about to call customer service it if kept happening, but decided to try to restore the kindle to the original settings since I had only had it about 4 days. I restored it and it worked just fine. I've had it for about a month now and I have no problems with it. I love my Kindle Fire HD.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: L.A.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE MY NEW KINDLE FIRE; AND USE IT EVERY DAY!!  One of the best parts is that I don't have to wait for books to come in the mail - along with their shipping/handling charges.  Plus, I don't have a continued issue with books taking up too much space in my house.  I also love that I can read a story, listening to soft music, and even get email updates.  One of the most fun things I've bought myself in a while.  Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Memories matters.....
Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: I returned it because it didn't have a camera on it and the previous Kindle I had ordered from Amazon had a camera. Unfortunately, I left it on a plane. When I ordered another one, I received this one and it doesn't have a camera. I must be able to take my pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: Good product, could be better!
Reviews.Author: ChefAlSki
Reviews.Content: Works well.  Fast browser. No way to add storage capacity. I am still learning how to use many functions but Users guide is short on info. Have to search a lot to find what I want to do.

Reviews.Title: HMDI cable
Reviews.Author: pete
Reviews.Content: I am disappointed that there is no HMDI cable available to connect the new kindle to my TV. Please let me know when there will be a way to do this.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Joyce Huber-Butler
Reviews.Content: Didn't even have it open and in minimal for a week and the screen went black and is still black. Tried all of the trouble shooting ideas and even went thru it with a customer service person from Amazon.  Nothing worked.  Was expecting a call back a 1/2 hour ago from the rep and he hasn't called back yet.  Very frustrated.  It was a birthday gift for my grandson and he is very disappointed also.  When I went on line to try and figure out what was going on with it, I saw that lots of other people had the same issue happen with this kind of kindle

Reviews.Title: FreeTime App Not What I'd Hoped
Reviews.Author: Susan Bischoff
Reviews.Content: So far, I'm kind of disappointed. It's not unreasonable to expect to be able to sideload content you want your kids to be able to access, but the FreeTime environment doesn't recognize any books loaded via cable or pulled from Dropbox. I've spent all day trying to find a workaround that will allow my daughter to access the content I've collected for her. (Please note that what you send to your account gets filed as a Personal Document and doesn't seem to show up as a book and is not accessible in FreeTime.) There was a time-consuming workaround involving converting books to epub, then uploading to a third-party app available via Amazon, but the 2013 version of this doesn't seem to work in the same way. And even if it did work, it would be impossible to give her extended (or unlimited) reading time because that really means unlimited apps (Angry Birds) time. Speaking of the time limits, anyone who hoped for a bedtime shut-down will be disappointed. Time limits seem to only be so many hours and minutes per activity, with not option for: you may only read until 9:30pm.The device is attractive, comfortable, blah blah, you've heard. I bought an Amazon device because I DO want to shop Amazon. But it's hard not to see these problems as something created to force Absolute Exclusivity, and that's really harshing my Christmas spirit.ETA: Pre-installed email and calendar apps cannot be shared in FreeTime. My daughter is allowed to use her email and I wanted her to use the tablet to start keeping herself organized, so a calendar... If I'm supposed to have the choice whether to share apps with a FreeTime profile, why not let me choose? Have spent a lot of time searching the Appstore for replacements since there's nothing Google here.

Reviews.Title: I would love to love it...but I can't
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to try out the new Kindle HD. I had previously owned the Kindle Fire so I was anxious to see the difference in quality. I got it on November the 18th and today is November 21st and I already have quite a few complaints. For the price I guess you could say it's not bad but personally, when I spend money on technology, I expect for the bugs to be out of the system...I mean that's what beta testers are for, right? For the second generation I actually noticed it was quite buggy. I could have just been mine but I noticed quite a few more problems than my original Kindle. A few things i've noticed, this thing kind of has a mind of it's own sometimes...For example, every time I try to open the app store, for some reason it takes me back to the Carousel and it seems to do this every time. When i'm typing on a website or writing reviews it also goes back to the Carousel and I lose EVERYTHING I previously wrote which can be very frustrating. I've also noticed when using the web browser (Silk)  it's hard to view pictures. When you try to zoom in it will only zoom in on certain areas (that's just if you click on an image to make it larger though) Most apps run pretty well, and if there are issues it's usually just the app itself but the Kindle it's self hasn't caused any problems (so far). I've had a lot of issues trying to view videos though, even the simplest format (such as Youtube videos). Sometimes it will say it requires a certain plug-in but other times it says nothing of the sort even though I haven't download  a plug-in. It also won't always switch to the webpage format you select (such as mobile or desktop)  It's got some quite irritating issues but if they could work those it would be a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: Its amazing what money can buy!
Reviews.Author: Karen W. "Karen W."
Reviews.Content: I gave my wife the Kindle Fire HD for her birthday, last night.  Connecting the WiFi was a snap.  We watched part of a movie on the 7-inch 1280x800 screen, connected her Facebook, Pandora, YahooMail, Pintrest, AllRecipes accounts, and searched for flights on the Travelocity web site with the Silk Browser.  I was a bit worried about the transition from her iPhone to Android, but it was so similar that she had no trouble at all.  All this for $154, and that is even with the upgrade to 16Gig.  Amazon had a $15-off special.  It is truly amazing how cheap technology has become.  Also, I have not tried this, but you can stream a movie on Wifi and save it on the tablet to watch later, off-line.

Reviews.Title: Broken internal power supply
Reviews.Author: scottz
Reviews.Content: Received Kindle Fire for Christmas 2011. Loved it! Worked great, works well with many apps and books. Great internet ability. After the year warranty was over I started to have a problem with the charge. The charge did not last as long as when I first got it. Thought it was the children using it and not charging it up after use. After awhile I began to notice that when I plugged it into charger, the light to show it was being charged would not light up. Only would charge if I "jiggled" the cord. Went online to see what I was doing wrong and noticed that this was a HUGE issue that many other people were having with their Kindle fire. Called Kindle and they determined that it was a problem within the Kindle and not a power cord issue, but they would not do anything since the warranty had expired. Very disappointed that Kindle did not stand next to their product since it is an obvious Kindle issue and not a consumer breaking the product issue. While I loved the product at first, do not like the problem I now have with a useless expensive broken tablet(it wont turn on at all since it will not hold any charge). Would not buy a Kindle product if this is how they fix their own product issues.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, horrible product support lifecycle
Reviews.Author: Aaron Armstrong "pctec100"
Reviews.Content: The Fire is one of the best tablet lines on the market for the $$$.  That said, I am highly disappointed in Amazon's OS update path.  Most other tech companies provide Software/OS updates for 2 to 3 years after the release of a product.  Software features that are being introduced in Fire OS 3.1 should be available to customers who bought the 2012 from Amazon since they were still selling it just 2 months ago.  I have very much enjoyed the Fire product line but my next tablet will probably be coming from a different vendor.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it!
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these. It is OK for playing solitaire. It is OK for reading books. As a computer, it is a useless piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: I Love my new Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I love it!  I had the Kindle Touch and upgraded to the Kindle Fire.  I like the fact that it has color and I am able to do so much more with the Fire.  I can read, play games, watch movies, get my e-mail and even get on Facebook with it.  It's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: apple vs. kindle
Reviews.Author: Gberg24
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my needs. As an owner of many Apple products I bought this instead of the iPad mini. Just wanted a quick tablet for the internet and email. Great price.

Reviews.Title: Does not have the mini Hdmi as the first gen had...
Reviews.Author: Crystal Alloway
Reviews.Content: I am giving this 3 stars due to the fact that my first HD fire had a mini HDMI out and I was expecting this one to also have it...... very disappointed that it did not....  other than that it is fine.

Reviews.Title: Many advantages over ipad 3
Reviews.Author: biggscpa
Reviews.Content: I still have my ipad, and many other apple products, but purchased this primarily due to the new feature of being able to download prime movies.  I also use it to listen to audio books while on the road, and it is a great feature to just pick it up and start reading the book addition where I left.  Also, the sound quality, both with earphones and speaker is a huge improvement over my 3rd generation ipad.  It also downloads a movie in less than 30 minutes, while my ipad  takes over 2 hours on the same connection.  Solid product. Just wish it had as many apps as ipad, and I likely would make the switch entirely.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet for a great price
Reviews.Author: Catherine Narciso
Reviews.Content: It's takes a little getting used to since I'm so used to my ipad but I love it.  It's small and portable and I can read my books, watch movies, play games while on the beach, at home, in a plane, etc.  I love and use Amazon a lot and the way everything is linked together makes it so convenient.  I like it!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: James A Warren
Reviews.Content: my kindle fire does everything I wanted it to do, and I few things I didn't know it would do.

Reviews.Title: Great Birthday Gift for my Daughter!
Reviews.Author: Megan G.
Reviews.Content: My daughter got this for her 6th Birthday and she LOVES it! Us parents like it to, it's a great learning device for her and we can control how long she is on it throughout the week!

Reviews.Title: Missing something!
Reviews.Author: Mandi Miller
Reviews.Content: There is no camera.. that.s the only down fall. I don't really understand why it wouldn't have one in today's market.

Reviews.Title: Great product.I'm thinking about getting one for my daugther
Reviews.Author: Nancy Hayes
Reviews.Content: My Grandson loves it, I'm really glad I got him one.Thank you.He has been using it for school, and reads more.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Paintmagnet
Reviews.Content: We gave my son the original Fire that my wife had loved since we bought it and upgraded her to the HD when we caught a sale. She's delighted in every way with the new one - faster, better screen, better layout, etc.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7" BEST BUY
Reviews.Author: Richard Kennedy
Reviews.Content: Everything was just as advertised. Very pleased... Good price and delivery on time...Best item I have ever ordered...  THANKS

Reviews.Title: I love my new Kindle.
Reviews.Author: K. Abrams
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Kindle 2 to a Kindle Fire HD 7".  What an improvement!  I highly recommend it to everyone

Reviews.Title: Great item
Reviews.Author: pat
Reviews.Content: Great picture, easy to use and great price. Enough said.Well, I guess I need six more words to say, enough said.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet with some serious flaws
Reviews.Author: Marty Z
Reviews.Content: Screen really crisp, and well built.  Unfortunately, shortcomings in app selections / functions are preventing me from recommending this tablet.1. You are limited to the Android App Store ecosystem which is drastically more limited than the open Google Play store.  To add insult to injury, some apps (thinking games) are available, but do not load properly, thereby providing greater frustrations for my offspring.2. The parental controls were a major selling point for this item, but the lack of flexibility in settings disappoint.  For example, there is no way to provide unlimited kindle book reading, but restrict games.  Also, there is no option to restrict access by time of day (after bedtime), or individually select apps to restrict.

Reviews.Title: Could have had better apps
Reviews.Author: Delian N. Naydenov
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I really like it. The lack of camera does not bother me and the processor speed, screen resolution, and speakers' sound are great. Free time is also very useful if you have kids as you can download specific applications in the child's account and each apps is independent from the other accounts. It is well-build and sturdy. The only problem is that in terms of applications, I found the Amazon applications store for Kindle fire to be very limited. Also, some applications would not turn around automatically when you rotate the tablet (ESPN) or seem buggy (a couple of games). I tried finding some Apple applications (iTunes and iCloud) but there are NO Apple aps available. I know that there is a way to tweak the tablet to download Google store apps but I have not tried it as I hear you lose the warranty if you do it. Finally, the battery life is on the short side and it takes some time to charge (more than a couple of hours). Overall, this is a great tablet to read, watch movies, and browse the internet and for the price of $139.00 is worth it until the next model arrives or it gets broken (whichever comes first). Overall:Pros:-Sound quality-Picture quality-Kindle FreeTime-Well-built-Price $Cons:-Very limited selection of apps-Battery life

Reviews.Title: I love my kindle
Reviews.Author: Maggie Murphy
Reviews.Content: Because it is awesome, can take it anywhere, can download at airports and even on the airplane, enjoy the backlignt, works even in the sun

Reviews.Title: Amazon finally hit "pay dirt"
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: December 2013  A little disappointed that Amazon Apps takes so long to get updates. I love the Kindle especially or mainly for a few games and reading. But, so far it'disproving to be a bit of a disappointment and my next tablet most likely won't be a Amazon Kindle no matter WHAT suffix they put behind it. You can d download movies to watch offline. It has yet to work but maybe twice. The apps when updated every other platform gets them first. This sucksis my fourth Kindle. I've had the basic keyboard reader The Kindle Fire, Kindle Fire HD 8GB and 32.  I was not impressed. The Fire was just too heavy. I gave them away. Amazon got it right with this one. It's light feels good works excellent has the best graphics. I love it. I downloaded a few TV shows to watch on my subway commute to Manhattan.you hit pay dirt with that innovation here in NYC we are always on the subway there is no way to enjoy anything underground unless you use your IPod. Now I can watch a film or anything. I love this idea. I love the design it's not too flashy but not "cheap" looking like Zeepad or Tagatal or Coby yet I don't have to be a target for a would be snatch and grab Thief.This is a nice dent looking tablet. This makes me more comfortable on the subway or bus ride and I can still look and feel good holding it in public. The processor on this is great fast the graphics and sound is  I don't have to hook it up to the stereo. I bought the 16gb with a bit of trepidation but I am gracefully surprised.  Thank you

Reviews.Title: 2 weeks in, battery issues have started!
Reviews.Author: Library Doc
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my husband. He had 2 weeks, when suddenly 11/8/13 the battery started acting crazy, he watched a single video the kindle was at a 100% charge. When the video was over it 20%. He thought was weird, but recharged it was fine. Today 11/9/13 the kindle was a 100%, he played an app for 10 to 15 minutes, the battery was less than 10%, however this time, it quit charging all together.  Called Amazon, they are sending a new kindle out. I really loved my kindle, great tablet. Just wish that these problems haven't started.

Reviews.Title: Beware - this model is a downgrade from the original Fire HD!
Reviews.Author: Yonatan "Yonatan"
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle Fire HD which a bought about three months ago which I love.  I saw the ad for the Kindle Fire HD for a considerably lower price on Amazon and bought it as a gift for my wife. It is still a bargain in an Android tablet but the first thing I noticed was that it is not the same as my Kindle Fire HD even though it has the same name.  For instance - it is missing the on-board camera, and the HDMI connector.  It does not have an automatic on-off with the closing of the cover.  As they carry the identical model number, you would think you were getting the same thing - but you are not.  I feel this is very deceiving and either there should have been a model number change or a clear indication in the sales description of the reduction in capabilities.  If either was the case, I would have given the product four stars.

Reviews.Title: You can't beat the price
Reviews.Author: David J. Serra "Functional Thinking"
Reviews.Content: A web browsing, movie watching, song playing tablet for the price of an e-reader!  I don't think there is a better deal out there. I love mine!

Reviews.Title: Curious about operations....
Reviews.Author: SGT "Ranger"
Reviews.Content: Ok! Well, I'd like to just first say that I have never owned a tablet of any kind and only bought this one after hearing to many "old dinosaur" remarks about me hauling around a laptop. OK! First off, I back ordered this and it arrived in good condition and on schedule. However, there is no operations manual but does have a little introduction program that kinda assists you on the operation... problem is... it leaves alot to the imagination. I have NEVER bought anything that didn't have an instruction manual with detailed info on the operation of said device. So I had a pretty big learning curve and am still trying to figure it all out.. but this is what I know so far...The screen is pretty impressive and does operate fairly quickly. YES, it does allow access to youtube, but it does not operate very well at all....it Buffers constantly...so no youtube really unless you like seeing that little buffer circle thing every 30 secs or so....(not for this ol' boy.) I was, however, able to get on the internet without much trouble and visited the general stuff that most people do....(eg. facebook (kinda slow to load though), google, and a few others without incident).Now for the things that most people are complaining about... no camera, no HDMI. No. this kindle doesn't have those on this model...if you had read the description of what you were buying this would not have been a suprise. I do now wish I'd bought one that had a camera to use with skype but oh well right?I honestly can't complain enough about not having a step-by-step instruction program or manual...it makes it hard for us die-hard laptop owners to adjust to this new(ish) tech. So if I had to complain at all, it'd be that it needs to be more User-Friendly to those who are not currently up-to-date with current tech. I am not aware of how "APPS" work... I'm more familiar with actual software and programs... I'm still a bit confused as to the operations of an APP and what exsactly it is. Also, how in the world do you download a video from amazon? I know i have to pay for it... but where does it go? I understand very little about the "CLOUD" thing and I suppose the purchased movie CAN BE saved on the devise itself...but how does all this work? What do I click? where does my movie go? can I access it online or offline? Same for music... can I sync it to my MP3 player? If the docs/media/movies are saved on the devise itself, where are they? Why can't I create a file so I know how to access them? And speaking of files, how to I create a file so I can save information I've found on the internet for future reveiw... also, HOW DO YOU SAVE INFO FROM THE INTERNET? where do the books I purchase go? device or "Cloud"....Ok... I know it sounds like I'm giving this thing a bad rap...but I'm not. I am just not yet comfortable with it and have absolutely no idea of it's operations and what I can and cannot do. So far, it's cool for social media, internet searches, I ASSUME works well with NetFlix (which I have but haven't checked it out just yet.) But I do have to say this...the device is cool if you want the newest peice of tech out there and it definatly has some cool features (as far as I know)... but unfortunantly, it cannot compare to the cheapest laptop on the market today. A cheap ACCER (or however it's spelled) can do much more than this device and cost about the same. A laptop, in my mind/experince, cannot be replaced by any form of tech out there. The ACCER I'm talking about only weighs a little more and a little bigger in size. NO I hate ACCER laptops and think they are cheap... but they, I think would be a better option...it's small, light weight, has every possible program and software, every connection, wireless, KEYBOARD, HDMI/extended monitor capabilities, and will do just about everything possible with the exception of the downloading of books and movies (which you can purchase the real one and save in computer.)Either way, laptop of Kindle, get what suites your needs... I may find later that this little thing can be really cool...but I like having more options and first-time user references to assist in initial operations for those not obsessed with every possible current/new tech to impress everyone with...PS: where is the compatible cases for this thing so I can protect it from shattering with the slightest bump??

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed - Not up to Amazon quality standard.
Reviews.Author: Nobel
Reviews.Content: I've purchased a Kindle Fire HD and before 3 months of light use the speakers stopped working. Called customer service and they kindly offered a replacement. When I received the device I was shocked. They sent me a refurbished device that was dirty and even had a scratch on the screen. The worst part is that customer service practically said that all I could do was swallow my disappointment, wait for another replacement and pray that this one will work. It was that or a refund, but not before going through the hassle of sending the defective devices back. I've been a loyal Amazon prime customer for years and I can say this is very uncharacteristic of Amazon. I hope they're not lowering their standards. Meanwhile I feel in disadvantage as a customer.

Reviews.Title: What a Joke!
Reviews.Author: Nathan G. Isaksson
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD for my wife's birthday. She has not had it for a week, and it is already malfunctioning! First it would not play videos (it eventually started playing some YouTube, but will not play Hulu, Netflix etc...), and now it has turned off and will not turn back on. We have tried charging it, holding the power button down etc... and nothing! What an embarrassment of a gift. I have to send it back now, and am truly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Will not support app for renting free library audio books
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my big Kindle fire however it is difficult to carry while walking 3 dogs and listening to an audio book on it.  So I wanted a smaller inexpensive device primarily for listening to audio books.  I purchased this new Kindle for $139.00 and I found out after HOURS of trying that it will only play audio books purchased from Kindle.  As audio books are so so expensive and as you can rent many of them free of charge from your public library with the One Click Digital app, I primarily get my audio books from the library app. So what did I discover after talking to several customer service reps (the ones in the Philippines had no idea what I was talking about and are complete waste of time in providing help so ask to be transferred to US rep for most things) is that the One Click digital app ONLY WORKS on the Kindle Fire Hd that I purchased at Christmas (2012).  Kindle's reps said that the app provider would have to make the changes in order for the app to work.  I talked to the folks at One Click Digital and found out that nope, Kindle has to make the changes, the way the app is now works for everyong else!  Literally wasted hours figuring this out, the Kindle customer service reps should know what Kindles work with the app and which don't but it is like getting blood from a rock to get them to tell you.If you review the ratings on the app you could find out this problem existed however it did not occur to me to do that until after wasting mucho time. I purchased the HP Slate 7 and while it is not as user friendly as the Kindle, I figured it out and am now happily listening to my audio books while walking my dogs.Remember new does not necessarily mean improved.And by the way how riduculous is it that the Paper white kindle does not even support audio books period!

Reviews.Title: Not as kid-friendly as Amazon would have you believe
Reviews.Author: J Spencer
Reviews.Content: My young daughter has been using our iPad for the past couple of years and was able to learn to navigate to and around her favorite apps.  Based on the ads and reviews of the Kindle Fire HD, we thought it would be an ideal gift for her sixth birthday, since we could control what she could access using Kindle FreeTime.  Herein is where the problem lies.First, FreeTIme allows access to apps, books, and videos, but not to music (?)  To get around this, we needed to download a third-party music player app into FreeTime, but the app was buggy. In addition to being unstable, it did not show album artwork, which would've made it impossible for a kid in the beginning stages of reading to find what they were looking for (this issue was true for 3 different music apps we tried).The second big issue we ran into was movies.  As Apple users, our entire library of digital movies is on iTunes, which uses a format for movies incompatible with Kindle.  So aside from investing in a format conversion program and converting them all over to a Kindle acceptable format, our iTunes movies were useless.Lastly, and this is less a criticism of Kindle than it is of Netflix, is the lack of "Netflix for Kids" as part of the Netflix app.  As stated previously, our daughter was familiar with the iPad version of Netflix in which she could choose the Netflix for Kids option when she opened the app. She understood it as "her" Netflix. The Netflix app on Android/Kindle has no such option and, as such, if my daughter used it in FreeTime, she faced the option of wading through shows that we had previously watched, such as Breaking Bad, to find a cartoon.I wrote this review to help other parents who may be contemplating buying this device for the same reasons I did to let them know of these major faults.  I have no doubt the Kindle Fire HD is a wonderful tablet that offers great value outside of the situation I described here.  As far as being ready-made for the kiddos, it's a work in progress.  We'll stick with the iPad for the time being.

Reviews.Title: Both of my Kindles have the same problem making them unuseable.
Reviews.Author: mm "Reen"
Reviews.Content: My first Kindle Fire lasted a fair amount of time, maybe 2 years or so. The charger plug on the Kindle got "pushed in" after some use and I could no longer charge the Kindle.  I bought a newer version just MONTHS ago and this one now has the same problem.  If I don't put the charger plug in "just right" it won't charge and it's only a matter of time (weeks) that this one will not be useable.Very frustrating.  I took the old one to the Geeks at Best Buy and they said this is a common problem not worth fixing.  I look forward to Amazon reading this message and responding to me. I'll let you know if that actually happens.

Reviews.Title: Really Amaz?
Reviews.Author: Aku0012
Reviews.Content: Really you have to pay an extra $15 to remove the ads. These stupid ads bombard you non-stop and are there even when you're not connected to internet. Forget this I'll just get an android tablet or something.

Reviews.Title: Buyer's Regret
Reviews.Author: Mr. Serpent "Mr. Serpent"
Reviews.Content: First off, the battery life is completely atrocious. 'Takes forever to charge, and power bleeds out like a stuck pig. Don't even think about streaming a video through the browser unless you're prepared for your battery to lose half it's charge. Comes with a few pre-installed apps like notepad and calendar. Apparently, after you select font for Inkpad, you can't change it, and you can't make a note in calendar unless you sync to some social media online or email. I should have bought the Samsung 7 inch tablet for 10 more bucks at Bestbuy, which came with Audible and Kindle apps pre-installed, but I was unwilling to drive 10 miles to an alternative store. I now regret that decision. Also, books bought through Audible online (but not through the kindle fire) took about one half hour to show up in my cloud/kindle list. (Yes, I refreshed a dozen times). Maybe that's not a kindle glitch, but this is the FIRST TIME I EVER had any trouble with Audible, as I usually download on my Razr Maxx immediately. An added note (that turns my stomach), I got about halfway through Amazon's feedback survey regarding my purchase, and it's was just glowing, back-patting leading questions to choose from, with few 'none of the above' options offered. I quit about halfway through because I'm not going to participate in a company lying to itself. VERY sour on Amazon right now. If I owned their stock, I would consider selling.

Reviews.Title: Passed down first non-HD Kindle and bought this one
Reviews.Author: Bergsma
Reviews.Content: I had a Kindle Fire first generation without special offers. Passed it down to daughter and bought this one.Disadvantages to me:1. I still have not gotten use to outside volume buttons. I prefer to access volume on touch screen. I understand why some would want an external volume access, but I don't like the buttons. I touch them when I am reading. Actually, I HATE the external volume button.2. The only way you can hold the kindle without continually touching the on/off button and volume buttons, is to hold it sideways. This really irks me. I should not be forced to have to buy a cover just to use this kindle. I don't even know if a cover would prevent me from touching the on/off button volume buttons. I will be reading on the kindle and shift my hands for comfort, when suddenly the prompt comes up asking if I want to power down my kindle...because I have accidentally touched the on/off button. Or the volume prompt comes up. I don't want to continually lock or unlock the screen because usually I am getting text messages; so overall, I absolutely do not like the placement of these external buttons. They should have left the button where it was and get rid of volume buttons.3. I dislike the special offers. When I save to buy another new kindle, I will not buy "include special offers". I will pay more for excluding special offers.Advantages:1. I love reading on my Kindles. This newer HD has even better brightness control and choices for reading in dark room. I love that I can rent/buy textbooks. When I save to buy the next Kindle, I will purchase on with larger GB....but I love this HD Kindle Fire.2. The color is not extremely different from my first non HD Kindle but the resolution is really really nice. I am very happy with this purchase.3. The affordable price is a real plus. I have friends with mini ipads who paid $300 more than my Kindle Fire HD. I am happy to have saved.If you have any questions, just ask :-)

Reviews.Title: JUNK!!!!
Reviews.Author: gemipisces
Reviews.Content: We bought 3 KINDLE FIRES all for Christmas for our kids and then one was for me from my husband. 2 days after Christmas we had to return mine to Best Buy because it wouldn't even come on. Also I registered the kids' Kindles to my email and then made some game purchases for them. Shortly after EVERYONES memory started to say not enough storage. I found out that while they are 3 SEPARATE DEVICES that they all use the SAME CLOUD/MEMORY space and that the only way to remedy was to make 3 separate email addresses for each person. So, I did that and had a TON of trouble RE-PURCHASING the two games I had bought for each kids KINDLES. So I got to pay for them 3 TIMES. The Kindles all like to shut off at random or fail to upload an app (from the AppStore). We constantly have to hold down the reset button for 20 seconds all the time. Next, my charger won't charge (again these are less than 6 months old) and my son's cord is frayed. I spoke to Customer Service and it was determined the cord to mine was not working. So, they credited my account for a new USB cord- or so they said. I went to my cart to order the cord and no IT'S THE ADAPTER IN THERE -NO USB CORD. I called back AGAIN. They finally got it right and added 2 USB cords and the adapter. SO SO SO frustrating!!!In addition I had expressed to the first Customer Care Representative about how much trouble we have had with all 3 (4 technically) Kindles and said that I would be writing a bad review anywhere I could find to let people know just how poorly made these expensive little junkboxes are. To which he replied- "That will be fine, maam. It's ok if you do that." Basically saying HE DIDN'T CARE that I spent the money to pay for a product we ALL expected to be QUALITY. Guess what? THEY'RE NOT! DO NOT BUY!

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk compaired to standard Fire
Reviews.Author: machinehead "Feed them to the Lions"
Reviews.Content: This is a hobbled POS compared to the standard Fire. Web pages can be zoomed but you can't scale the zoom. So when a page is zoomed, you have to drag the page all over the place to see the whole page.The standard Fire has Scalable Zoom this POS does not. It is useless as a web device and I regret buying it. This is the last time I will ever touch another Kindle. Too many ads and no Scalable Zoom. No font selection for web pages.I need +3 reading glassed to see the TINY fonts. Amazon, you have made a big mistake and you have lost a customer.Good riddance Amazon Kindle.

Reviews.Title: A tale of buyers remorse
Reviews.Author: Judd Connell
Reviews.Content: I bought this kindle around Christmas and it worked great for a little while( 3 months). But in march it started  not to charge very well. It would work a day and then it would needed to be charged again. Then it is down for two days and needed to be charged again. Now it is down for 3 days and then 4 days. If I see my kindle I think to myself "is today going to be the day it turns back on?" Currently, I do not know if it will ever turn back on.On and on  it has been like this.  The price was great and when the product worked it was good. I ignored some of the comments that were negative, because you know how negative people can be.  I understand they made the price so cheap so people would buy the apps and I was okay buying the apps, but now I can't get to the e books or apps I bought. Not only did I lose money on the kindle but I lost all the apps and e-books, because the kindle will not turn on.

Reviews.Title: Decent hardware with good value.
Reviews.Author: Simon C
Reviews.Content: My mother only needs 3 things: banking apps, a foreign chat app and a web browser/video player for a foriegn video site that doesn't have an app. This tablet can do all of those things and it does the video very well. The language support seems adequate so far, but this specific language had to be downloaded in the settings which is something that my mother could never understand. The foreign chat app is not on the Amazon appstore. I had to search around for a solution, which wasn't too hard, but it's frustrating that Amazon outright blocks the simplest solution: Google Play.It's beyond adequate for her needs and feels like a good value.Edit for 2 stars: I'm returning this within the 30 days for a full refund. Small issues kept popping up that I had to resolve, most of them related to Fire OS. The last straw was a browser plugin. I thought my mother wouldn't have so much trouble with adjusting to such a simple UI but I was wrong, and when I try to use it myself I find myself getting frustrated. I don't really feel like voiding the warranty so it's going back.

Reviews.Title: not what i expected
Reviews.Author: charles warth
Reviews.Content: no more than a toy...no video as I expected, camera...etc. I can do all this on my computer...wasted $130....the protection cover would not fit this kindle fire hd 7 inch as promised...no magnetic cover...this was a purchasing mistake.

Reviews.Title: Terrible E-Reader, Underwhelming Tablet
Reviews.Author: brian breed
Reviews.Content: I have had a Kindle FIre HD since August of 2013, when I purchased it to replace the Kindle ink reader whose screen I accidentally broke. I read several reviews and saw lots of stars for the Fire HD, so I purchased this (new) from a Best Buy eagerly. I was hoping for a more responsive touch screen, smoother highlighting, better annotation and scrolling through PDFs, and reading in the dark.I was in for a rude awakening.I'll be reviewing the device as an e-reader and a budget tablet computer separately.----ReaderMy first major disappointment was when I learned that the Kindle Fire does not support Collections - a feature which I use extensively. On the Fire, I just have a mass of books that I cannot really organize. Instead the user only has the dubious privilege of a carousel that throws all applications in with all books read. The carousel is a nuisance that can be neither disabled nor easily managed. It is not a substitute for the much cleaner collections available to true Kindle readers and computer apps.My next frustration was the way the Fire's reader manages highlighting across "screens" of a book. In point of fact, you can't. This is a major hassle, as highlighting to the bottom of one screen, flipping the page, and continuing the highlight constitutes two separate annotations when synched to your Kindle account and other Kindle apps.On that note, navigating by locations is a terrible, terrible UI decision (not endemic to the Fire), but it could at least be ameliorated by displaying the range (e.g., locations 1000-110) at the bottom of the page to facilitate smoother navigation. Or why not allow for continuous scrolling on screen, since locations are themselves a concept that's supposed embody the "seamlessness" of digital text? Hint: they don't.Finally, the on-board PDF viewer is extremely spartan. It's sluggish in loading pages and you can't even highlight or take notes with it.In these fashions the device fails to impress as a reader. End-user engagement with content is clunky for books, and nonexistent for PDFs. This isn't a Kindle e-reader with more features - it's a Fire, a separate species of device, and the consumer would be wise to treat it as such.---TabletAs a cheap tablet, the Fire fares rather poorly. The name "Fire" is ironically appropriate - moderate use makes this baby heat up like a pancake. It gets warm, and quickly, if the processor has to do any measure of work (rendering graphics in games, or streaming video on Netflix make it toasty).The battery life on this device is a further disappointment. The chief culprit? Clicking the power button doesn't actually sleep the device - it just turns off the screen. In fact, the device CANNOT sleep: it's either on, or it's off. So the WiFi is constantly scanning for connections, radically depleting the battery, wherever you go with this stowed. (By chance I happened to learn that HOLDING the power button for five seconds will turn the device off, but bootup takes around two minutes and I've just resigned myself to leaving the device "always on.")The touch screen is marginal at best. While it displays images well, response frequently lags. Swiping on the keyboard is imprecise. And good luck getting the menu button to appear when you want it: you have to touch the bottom of the screen very specifically for the Fire to register this as the request to bring up this essential function. In point of fact, it seems like the Fire DOESN'T want you adjusting things - just taking them in placidly.Not that Amazon wants you to tinker with the device. This is a machine designed to encourage you to buy. The Fire OS is a custom Google Android environment designed to facilitate quick and easy purchasing of content from Amazon. The carousel (which I touched upon previously) does not allow for organizing or arranging (although if you poke around enough, you might discover you can "pin" programs at the very bottom of the home screen). Whatever you used last appears on the far left of the carousel. Swiping across apps brings up recommended purchases (couched as "Customers who used X also bought the following").The store itself is a nightmare; the default category of New and Popular, for example, throws apps with 4,800,000 and 20 downloads into the same pot. Everything is cross-listed. This environment is a mess. And it's not even a cutting-edge mess! Amazon has to vet apps independently of Google, so the trickle-down process is slow. Expect a months-long delay before finding applications that have been around for months on Google Play or iOS.THERE IS NOTHING FOR THE KINDLE FIRE YOU CAN'T GET ON AN ANDROID TABLET SOONER, CHEAPER, AND BETTER. Everything this device does, other devices do - with better battery lives, similar price points, and far far more end-user nuance to boot.If you are scared of technology but still want its desserts, this will hold your hand through the whole process tolerably well. But that's not a real selling point, and I strongly encourage you to look elsewhere to meet your tablet need.

Reviews.Title: Poor Tablet, Poor book reader
Reviews.Author: DavidLN
Reviews.Content: I've had this device for about a week now. I also own a regular Kindle reader and an iPad. The kindle Fire HD  compares very poorly to the iPad, as a tablet. The apps that I've tried to use are of low quality, and the Silk browser is the poorest browser that I've ever used. I looked around the app store for a replacement browser. Unable to find one, I called the support team. From what I can ascertain, Amazon isn't allowing third party browsers on this device. Either that, or nobody is developing for it. As a reader, it falls far short of my old Kindle book reader.  The tablet has a shiny surface, so it is useless as a reader in the sun.  I wanted a tablet to be able to get away from my clunky, heavy laptop. This tablet does not fit my needs. It is neither a usable table, nor a good reader. I'll be looking for a new iPad or android tablet and probably giving this one away. Very, Very unhappy. Should have known that something priced this low was too good to be true.

Reviews.Title: Where did the camera go?
Reviews.Author: Califmomma "Pam"
Reviews.Content: I have the first version of the Kindle Fire HD. Granted the new model is lighter, but that could be because of a difference in batteries or THE LACK OF A CAMERA! I got the new one as a gift for my daughter. I guess she won't be Skyping with her grandmother on it or taking any cute selfies. Yes, there are many other things that she will be using it for, but I feel defrauded. My fault for assuming nothing had changed between the two versions, maybe some upgrades, but not downgrades!

Reviews.Title: 2nd Puchase Not the Same
Reviews.Author: Arcadium
Reviews.Content: Bought a second Kindle Fire HD because I liked my first one so much. Just beware that the currently shipping FIre HD 7" isn't the same as last year's model. Current unit doesn't have a camera and doesn't have an HDMI port like last years model. Also, the display doesn't seem to be as crisp even though Amazon claims it's the same 1280 X 800 resolution. Could be that the anti-glare is different but for whatever reason it's just not the same experience. I think Amazon is misleading customers by not putting a model year with their product descriptions to flag the fact that there may be feature difference. Calling it the same thing but shipping something else is not right. Bottom line, if you're looking to get a second Kindle Fire HD 7", don't assume that they are the same features and functions as previous year's version.

Reviews.Title: Shuts Down For No Particular Reason
Reviews.Author: Grangla
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!  Purchased the Kindle Fire HD after previously owning the original Kindle Fire.  Within days is began to randomly shut off.  Whether I was reading a book, using an app, or surfing the web on Silk, it would just turn off.  I contacted Amazon and was sent a replacement.  Within days of receiving the replacement the same issue arose.  I contacted Amazon again and once again I was sent a replacement.  When the replacement arrived, it was REFURBISHED.  I contacted Amazon and was told that the best they could give me was a refurbished model.  To be clear, the two NEW ones it sent me didn't work properly, so Amazon wants me  going to roll the dice on the REFURBISHED one.  No thank you.  I asked for a  refund.  I was then told that I was outside the 30 day warranty so I was not entitled to a refund as per its policy.  It took 45 minutes of my being on the phone, but I have my full refund and Amazon can keep its Kindles.

Reviews.Title: It was good while it lasted, just not long enough
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: It was good while it lasted, but like so many other Kindles once the warranty ran out the thing became useless. Bought mine 12/24/12 and 1 year and a little over 3 months later and it's frozen on the static Kindle Fire screen and will not boot up. Kindle customer service was no help whatsoever. The rep walked me through the resetting function which I had already tried several times to no avail. I have tried every "fix" found throughout the internet and absolutely nothing works.Oh, the rep said, "Well since it's out of warranty, we can give you this replacement special deal of $109 for a brand new one!" This is exactly $10 off the current selling price. Uh, thanks, but no thanks.I hope yours lasts longer than mine.

Reviews.Title: Like the color options but not the shiny screen
Reviews.Author: Shelly Bole
Reviews.Content: Not sure if I will keep it.  The screen is extremely reflective and difficult to use outdoors.  Also, it doesn't seem to pick up wifi from any place other than my home.  Not sure if I will keep it.

Reviews.Title: Lousy Deal
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: 1st one didn't work at all.  Hard to return.  Very uncooperative people in getting return authorization.  Wouldn't buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Volume has decreased!
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: I have owned my Kindle Fire HD for a little over a year now and was very pleased with it.  Now all of a sudden the volume has diminished and I can barely hear it even when it is turned on full volume.  Can anyone explain to me what has happened?  I no longer enjoy watching videos or movies as I cannot hear them and have to constantly bring the Kindle up to my ear to hear what is being said.  Is this some kind of a ploy to get me to purchase a new Kindle?

Reviews.Title: Great gadget
Reviews.Author: Bentley Jones
Reviews.Content: Its very easy to handle although I do not have a case for it.  This is a one stop package.  I prefer this to my old Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: ODD SHAPE
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The edges angle and it's somewhat difficult to insert the plug.  Also, the sleekness makes it difficult to figure out which way is up.  I'm forever holding it upside before turning it on (buttons hard to find).  With old eyes can't easily find the on/off switch because its flush with the side and it's the same color as the tablet.  And, can't navigate very well among the pages, who reads instructions to find out how to do something?  Finally, too sensitive, the pop up box always shows up when you are reading, especially when you are near the bottom and have to go to the next page and then back to get rid of the box to finish reading the last paragraph.  Makes me want to stick with a book.

Reviews.Title: I wish I had purchased the Kindle Fire HD sooner.
Reviews.Author: Carol Yeager
Reviews.Content: I am not a smart phone user so my KFHD has become my constant companion. I love to read and Amazon has a huge variety of books for download at the best prices. I have also downloaded games and keep in touch with family on Facebook. The KFHD is very easy to use and I have not had a single issue with it. It has also allowed my husband to use our PC when he wants. I highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD 7" to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Deceptive Title and it's Going Back
Reviews.Author: Deborah Karr
Reviews.Content: Bought a 2nd Kindle Fire HD 7" last week to match the other one I bought at the end of September:  IT'S NOT THE SAME PRODUCT !  This model is the old NON-HD version they used to have!!!  They merely changed the name!

Reviews.Title: Kindle is fantastic!!
Reviews.Author: Julie M Oldfield
Reviews.Content: I've had 2 Kindles and I really like them for travel. This one was bought for my mom as a Christmas gift, and I think she's going to love it too. I like watching movies and reading books. It's also convenient in the kitchen to look up recipes.

Reviews.Title: No Camera on second generation kindle
Reviews.Author: Kathy Ward "kathymetcalf"
Reviews.Content: I am not happy with the second generation kindle I bought for my mom. No camera, that means no skyping. I have the first generation kindle and it has a camera so I can skype. What happen why did they take out the camera. No mic either. Might have to send it back.

Reviews.Title: totally wicked awsome
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I am 9 years old and I love this tablet my friend and I use our kindle fires all the time this thing is great for gaming, reading and movies I especially love playing minecraft we both totally recommended this tablet.

Reviews.Title: BUY A KINDLE:  YOU'LL BE SURPRISED AT ITS USES
Reviews.Author: Nancy97210 "Nancy97210"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a big trip (a 10 hour flight).  I have been totally amazed that a product that is so reasonably priced can be so versatile.  My previous music purchases (over the years!) are magically on Amazon's cloud -- and available on this device!  I am a slow reader.  The device not only allows me to change the fonts (so you can use the elliptical and still read), but you can switch to audio.  The phone support was superb.  I couldn't find the volume switch (thinking it would be on the screen).  The support person patiently explained it was on the outside, in the back.  Thanks for not calling me a dummy!  I read my local Oregonian on it daily;  the screen is big enough to accommodate reading the newspaper -- and I can read it anywhere.  The WiFi works well.  I will be bringing it on other trips in lieu of bringing my laptop.  (I just ordered an optional keyboard.)  Oh, going back to my flight:  turns out I didn't need it.  Delta had personal music/video for each seat.  But the Kindle was much better, and, with my noise canceling earphones, I listened to books and music.  It was just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Worst device ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: My kindle from the moment i got it randomly shuts down even as I'm typing im hoping it will not shut down and when it does shut down i have to plug it in to get it started again it freezes,battery life is short,often times very laggy. Very cheep you get what you pay formy volume buttons also do not work anymore i have a really hard time using the  internet on my kindle it always says silk is not responding and makes me quit off it the when i log back on it it asks me if i want my tabs restored and one of the options is Yes please! Why so excited when i never wanted to close out anyway? They make it sound like a privilege. I would not buy the kindle even for my worst enemy it is terrible and only depresses me i hope i get an ipad for christmas.

Reviews.Title: Very nice, but not great
Reviews.Author: Camper John
Reviews.Content: I was really wanting to give this 5 stars, but just can't due to 'normal' apps not able to run on Amazon's OS.  I do most of my banking from the internet and the bank's app for Android will not run on the Kindle.  Neither will the Geocaching app or the standard NBC or CBS television app.  They work fine on my Nexus 7.I should have done my research better, but this Kindle does NOT have a camera.  I'll leave that on my shoulders for not reading up more on it.I do not care for the ads on the lock screen and hate to pay $15 just to get rid of them...sort of cheesy if you ask me.  But for the overall price being much lower than other tablets, I guess there will be a few trade offs.I hate to keep comparing it to my Nexus 7, but the Kindle's width is just a little too wide for my hand to hold comfortably for a period of time.  Again, as a reader, the width is ideal for more reading screen availability.  The Kindle is an excellent reader and other than a few games, I'm afraid it's destined for those purposes only.

Reviews.Title: I don't like! Unable to program this KINDLE FIRE.
Reviews.Author: HELEN   M . PHILP
Reviews.Content: I sent a Kindle Fire 7" HD  to my adult granddaughter in Virginia as a Christmas gift as this was what she really wanted.!!!It turned out to be a defective product and was returned to Amazon & a BIG disappointment as she will have no Christmas gift.At the same time I ordered the Origami case for the Kindle & have to return it too ..Now we are told  I will incur a charge for returning the case which is absolutely no good to her without the Kindle Fire.I will not be ordering electronics again after this occurence.A disappointed Grandmother.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7", HD Display, Wi-Fi, 8 GB
Reviews.Author: Bryan Shane Epperly
Reviews.Content: Great little tablet!  I bought one for every member of my family and they just love them!  Thanks Amazon your the best.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD....your only choice
Reviews.Author: DrUBennett
Reviews.Content: Other than a larger screen, this Kindle Fire HD does what my laptop can do and more. You cannot get a better, quality package with the fantastic customer support anywhere else. I am pleased with it all!

Reviews.Title: Clear and light weight!
Reviews.Author: Dena Best
Reviews.Content: I love it.  It is light weight and has a very clear picture.  It is easy to carry when traveling.  I would recommend this product to anyone interested in a 7".

Reviews.Title: Fire, how do I love thee?
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love it!! It's the perfect size and price. I can check emails and surf the web. The os is snappy and responsive. Videos play smoothly. Really good purchase.

Reviews.Title: great item for a child!
Reviews.Author: Donna Hersh
Reviews.Content: easy to use and my child loved his birthday gift! Very easy to use and love the settings for my son.

Reviews.Title: Amazing table
Reviews.Author: alex stevenson
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing table, quick and with many desirable features. My kids love it; I'll be buying one for each of them.

Reviews.Title: charge
Reviews.Author: sandra mendoza
Reviews.Content: After two weeks ...it did not want to hold a charge. The charger seems to tight and when inputting charger

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love...
Reviews.Author: Wilkshake
Reviews.Content: Wow, I could not wait to get on and tell you what I think.  Let me start with the "frustration free" packaging.  What a pleasure it was to be able to simply and safely open a product.  Three cheers.  I ordered two New Kindle HD's for grandchildren at a Cyber Monday price that was kind of a no brainer.  One of the tablets had a problem with the memory (said I didn't have sufficient storage to download a movie).  I called the help line and the rep patiently, kindly, and efficiently walked me through a reboot which fixed the problem.  This tablet is exactly what I wanted - a handy-sized entertaiment/reader/web access.  I have a laptop to do "computer" tasks. This is the fifth tablet in the Kindle line I have purchased and I am very satisfied. I will probably update to the HDX soon. Hoping in the meantime that the downloadable prime movies will extend to my current HD.  I love my Kindles!!

Reviews.Title: Solid Tablet.
Reviews.Author: Kyle Coleman
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 11 year old. great tablet for not alot of money. There built really well and does every thing she wants. I like it because I can block the internet with no problems. Kudos amazon for keeping it easy to keep our kids safe.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is a good device!
Reviews.Author: TheGamingExperience
Reviews.Content: We contacted Amazon a few weeks back once the new Kindle Fire HD had been released, and they sent me out one for a review. With a ton of time spent using this device I have felt comfortable enough to actually review it, but the process in how I do it actually stumped me. See the Kindle Fire HD is in a class all by itself; what do I describe it as? Calling it a tablet seems to dispute the original intentions of the Kindle name, but it does everything that a normal tablet would do. I think I finally figured out how to do this review, so here is how it will break down; I will review EACH and every single thing about it, including how it plays games, music, movies and then I will throw in a few apps to show if it is good or bad. So with that said, the one I received is the very awesome price tag of $139.00, and is the 8GB version of the Kindle Fire HD 7”. Now let’s get into the bread and butter of the Kindle Fire HD.Overall the Kindle Fire HD is a pretty solid gaming device, but it could use some improvements to the store. Other than that, I would happily play more games on it, as it is a good gaming device with a decent selection of quality games.I want you to sit back and think about this process carefully, as having a Kindle Fire HD will not set you back as other devices, and performs all the same as those that cost $400-500. I urge you to remember though, while the selection may be lackluster at this moment in time, get one for what it will become. I really do think that the Kindle Fire HD has set a bar of standards in terms of performance for me, and at a mere $139 it is a steal.

Reviews.Title: What type of mini/ micro/ wierdo connector does this thing have?
Reviews.Author: hammer
Reviews.Content: I'd love it if i could get a proper HDMI cable to connect to my television. I first bought a mini HDMI to HDMI, it didn't fit. Then I read its a MICRO HDMI to regular HDMI. Bought on of those, it still does not fit the Kindle.What type of connector is it?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 7 is a Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Merry Corso
Reviews.Content: Best thing I ever purchased!!! Goodbye paperback books. It's like having a mini computer. Works quickly and connects to WIFI.

Reviews.Title: Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Michelle A Haferland
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my kindle....still do.  My problem with the kindle is the charger plug into the device.....it wears out and the connection is bad and doesn't charge because it fits loosely.  My kindle didn't last much more than a year.  Until they come up with a better port for the charger, I would think twice about the kindle.  Three people I work with had the same problem.

Reviews.Title: WOOHOO
Reviews.Author: Jayne Cornier
Reviews.Content: This is our second Kindle Fire HD.  Love them.  This one is lighter then the last and is here NOW.  Just ordered it on Saturday.  I love my Amazon.J

Reviews.Title: Great for kids
Reviews.Author: Shelley L. Tanner
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for a 7 year old boy and he hasn't put it down since he got it. Great for anyone for any purpose.

Reviews.Title: Excellent delivery time on new Kindle Fire, WOW!!
Reviews.Author: Dusty Yefsky ""Geo""
Reviews.Content: I ordered my new Kindle Fire HD 7 on Wednesday and I received it this morning ( Saturday ).  It was guaranteed to arrive by 8 PM, next Monday.  I am greatly appreciative of Amazon's swift service.  The Kindle is charging up, now,  will let u know if it works as good as its cracked up to be.P.S.:  Can anyone tell me how to turn off the WIFI when I'm not downloading anything?  It's only two days old and I've already had to re-charge it. I have  a Kindle Touch that's 2 years old and it needed re-charging once a week.I am not mad but I would appreciate an explanation .  Thanks for your help in advance.P.P.S.:  Sorry guys,  I just read "Kindle Ops for Dummies".  Never mind about telling me how to turn off the WiFi .  It's simple. Just swipe down and hit the wifi button and go to your network and tap it then hit "forget".  That is simple.  I AM REALLY HAPPY WITH THIS KINDLE FIRE HD 7, however, if I knew that the HDX would be cheaper, today, I would have waited and bought that one instead.  Cest la vie, eh?

Reviews.Title: My Best Buy This Year!
Reviews.Author: Louis
Reviews.Content: This is the best "tool" I've gotten since DOS  (LOL)!  It does everything I want to do with it.  I've had the plain reader for two years, and when this was released, I had to buy myself an early Christmas Gift!  I'm still getting used to all the things that one can do with it.  The best buy for me this year!  Merry Christmas to all........Lou

Reviews.Title: Kindles , great products !
Reviews.Author: Kevin  A Brooker
Reviews.Content: We purchased a regular kindle fire last December, 2012,and have enjoyed it ever since.  The  hardware of the unit is out standing, as good as an Apple product. It is fast with the duel core. I would recommend this product over google products.com Also the price is right, office depot recently offered a regular kindle for 79.99 , virtually a bargain  price for this product.

Reviews.Title: My kindle fire hd experience
Reviews.Author: Ashley W.
Reviews.Content: The only reason why I gave the hd a 3 star and not 5 is because of how much of a base model device this is. There's no extrenals for a usb, or hdmi. It was a real let down as well to find out that I couldn't add my current at&t; carrier to the device to use on the go. You would have to add wifi hotspot to enable the internet, and although my carrier has exceptional areas to connect streaming would become shotty in certain places as we all know. I'm reselling mine, and I upgraded today. If your always at home then it's a perfect item.

Reviews.Title: Great but....
Reviews.Author: it's cool
Reviews.Content: Kindle fire is just great, I can download games, app, music, pictures, anything. The only thing that break me down is that I can't change my wallpaper into a picture that I personally want! I wish they can arrange that and make it more accessible on that part. But apart from that everything is perfect. I am really happy to have this, it's easy to use, to carry around, and its less expensive for such a good material.

Reviews.Title: Does What's Needed
Reviews.Author: Backwoods Technologist
Reviews.Content: Very happy. I watched a video from my living room (not the best WiFi signal). There was no stuttering or dropout. The sound quality when you use an origami cover to prop it up is amazing for such a small device. The best thing is that I can read PDFs clearly and with little eyestrain. I prefer the Paperwhite for reading but its PDF reader is not as versatile.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire is on fire
Reviews.Author: william tiemann
Reviews.Content: i just love this Kindle Fire. the only one thing i noticved was that on some video play back it was a bit blurry but i think it might be the quality of the movie and not the Kindle otherwise it has a very crisp picture and the battery last 10 hrs. well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a replacement for original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: John Martin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for my father-in-law's old Kindle Fire that would no longer take a charge.  He has only had this for a short period of time, but he has mentioned that it is an amazing upgrade from the original Kindle Fire.  He can't believe how much better the screen is or how much more responsive the system is.  He loves all of the content that you can get.  Of course, his favorite thing to do is play word-search on it.  I try to explain to him how much more it can do...

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Suzanee Delaney
Reviews.Content: It's very easy to manipulate, coming from the original kindle, that is. . A little disappointed at the glare while reading outside.

Reviews.Title: I won one at company party. Liked it so much I bought one for my mom
Reviews.Author: Joel Burgess
Reviews.Content: now all  she does with it is play games and FB...  Thats ok though, I love her anyway... Thank you

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Suranga Seneviratne
Reviews.Content: Performance is quite bad. Kind of slow. Further Amazon Premier or Free time is not available outside US. This was not highlighted in the web page.

Reviews.Title: Was just as it appeared to be
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This was a hard earned gift my daughter had saved up for.  We are happy with the parental controls as well as ease of use.  The difference between this and a HDX is not substantial enough to justify the cost when sat side by side so we are happy for the choice.  The battery is reasonable and the apps are easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 7
Reviews.Author: dd
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A GREAT TABLET...LOTS OF FUN...FOR THE MONEY....BUT CAN NOT GET IT TO PRINT COUPONS ONLINE....BUT STILL A GOOD DEAL....WISH...THEY WOULD MAKE A APP FOR PRINTING COUPONS.....

Reviews.Title: A wise upgrade
Reviews.Author: Jerry G
Reviews.Content: I wanted to upgrade from my basic Kindle so I could better enjoy subscriptions to magazines and news journals.  Easier to handle and nicer to read (and in color).  Thought of an iPad but didn't want to commit myself 100% to Apple.  Plus the Kindle Fire did what I wanted from a e-reader and was way cheaper.  Worked out perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Required headline
Reviews.Author: Carl Hester
Reviews.Content: Had a Kindle that took a bath and quit and can't look at the books I had bought for it.

Reviews.Title: i need all of my old stuff on it
Reviews.Author: kim novak
